story:
Who We Are

BookNet Fest was founded by Marines and Samantha, two content creators and avid readers who saw a need for an event that was about and for every member of the book community. The idea for an event sparked a bigger vision: an organization with a mission to promote reading, bring together readers from diverse backgrounds and uplift marginalized voices. 

This year, we're back with the second annual BookNet Fest, happening on September 7-8th in Orlando, FL. As a non-profit event, we need your help to cover costs for renting the convention space and audio/visual equipment. Even if you are unable to attend the event, supporting us today helps us for future years and makes it more likely we'll be able to make the content of the event available to all.

What We Need

Registration costs for the event are going towards renting the convention space. This year's convention space costs have been fully funded by tickets already sold.

However, in addition to that, audio/visual costs will be around $4,500. This includes mics, speakers, projectors and a technician to help us during the event. Our goal with this campaign is to raise this amount so that we can better improve accessibility and, with the internet package that is available onsite, hopefully record the panels to share them online after the festival.

Should we reach that goal, additional monies raised would go towards signage, helping marginalized creators attend the event and next year's event.

What We Want To Do

Like we said above, our mission is to make BookNet feel as inclusive and equal as possible.

This campaign is an effort to help BookNet reach as many people as possible. We understand that feeling dismissed or ignored at industry conferences is not the only way that creators and fans can be excluded from the bookish community.

We know that for many marginalized creators the cost of attending an event like this at all is impossible. To film the unique and in depth panels at this event to immortalize online would create an invaluable resource for impoverished creators.

We believe the book community should be an empowering place for all creators, no matter who or where they are.

From our sponsored marginalized attendee this year, Lily of LilyMeadeBooks on YouTube:

When I first received the email asking me if I would like to attend BookNet this fall, I was honored. When I realized that it was all expenses covered, I started crying.

For several years I have been transparent about my struggles to stay and engage in the book community--a source of deep inspiration, passion, and friendship for me, but also a place that is difficult to keep up with if you can't afford the latest books, classes or edits to improve your craft, or travel costs to go to events.

I have only ever been to two industry related events before. Both times I was helped in some way by family or a friend and I also saved for ages, but I still ended up so stressed and guilty about the costs that I would cry myself to sleep for weeks before attending. I spent every second that I was there doing my best to make it worth it, not only for me, but for others like me.

I picked panels to attend based on how helpful they would be to someone at home and brought my camera to every one, sacrificing my own personal enjoyment to make sure I had a recording to share on my YouTube channel (however shaky and amateur the results may be). To this day, those panels are my most viewed videos, receiving thousands of views a year and many comments thanking me for posting them.

I don't know how to express my gratitude to BookNet not only for inviting me, but for going to such lengths to help others. Books and access to education are two of my biggest values and this is a perfect combination of both. This is a truly incredible cause and I hope to do everything in my power to help make it an annual event.

Let's Talk Perks

For your support, we've got an amazing list of perks set up, from book recommendations from our panelists to annotated books to bookish swag to query critiques!

On-Screen Thank You - $3
Thank you for supporting BookNet Fest. For $5, you'll have your name up on the welcome screens before the start of the event and the keynote.

Rec It - $5
A good book recommendation goes a long way. To thank you for your support, we'll send you a digital thank you, complete with a recommendations list of some under-loved books from our panelists.

Exclusive BNF Postcard - $7
Receive an exclusive postcard (designed by Emma Tobias) from the event, including a hand written note by one of the attendees! Price includes shipping! US Only.

All of it? - $10
We'll include your name on our thank you screen, send you a postcard and include the recommended reading list. You deserve it.

It's Lit - $15
Score an exclusive BookNet Fest scent from Candles in Bookland! To thank you for your contribution, we'll send you this 4oz candle and the recommended reading list. Price includes shipping, US only.
50 available

BNF Poster Signed by Panelists - $20 (worth $30)
An exclusive BookNet Fest print, designed by Emma Tobias, and signed by most of the panelists attending the event. Price includes shipping, US Only.

First Chapter Critique - $25 (worth $35)
Lainey Kress from gingerreadslainey will critique the first chapter of your YA work in progress!
5 available

Hangout with BNF Creators - $30 (worth $50)
Backers at this level will get to hang out with the creators of BookNet Fest on a 30 minute call to talk all things event, books, media or community!
3 available

Softcover Monstress + Note - $35
For your pledge, receive standard softcover copies of Monstress volumes 1 + 2 (a $27 value) with a handwritten note from editorial assistant Ceri Riley! What better way (or time) to get into the series? Price includes US shipping!
2 available

Crafty - $40 (worth $52)
Thank you for your support! We've got the cutest package from Crafted Van for you, including three magnetic bookmarks, two enamel pins and two greeting cards, a $52.00 value. Price includes shipping, US only.
1 available - SOLD OUT

SDCC Monstress + Note - $40
For your pledge, receive a San Diego ComicCon exclusive hardcover copy of Monstress Vol. 2 (a $34 value) with a handwritten note from editorial assistant Ceri Riley! Price includes US shipping!
1 available

Pick a Snark Squad Topic! - $50 (worth $75)
At this level, one awesome contributor will get to pick a book or movie for Marines Alvarez and Nicole Sweeney to watch and review on Snark Squad Pod. Of course, they'll shout you out in the episode. That plus, the recommending reading list that keeps on giving!
1 available

Snarky, Annotated ACOMAF - $70
Enjoy an annotated copy of one of Marines's least favorite books of all time, A Court of Mist and Fury. You'll receive a hard cover copy full of notes from Marines about her reading experience. Price includes shipping, US Only.
1 available

Query Critique - $80 (worth $100)
Literary Agent and YA author Eric Smith will critique your query!
3 available

Beta Read - $90 (worth $200)
Marines will beta-read your finished book, provided in-document comments, suggestions, tracked changes and constructive feed!
1 available

Pick It - $100
Pick a book, any book, and Marines will read it and review it on her channel. Good, bad, worse, or anything in between. It's up to you!
3 available

Pick A Book For Review - $100
Pick a book and Samantha from Thoughts on Tomes will review it! Her only stipulation? No horror please. Otherwise, rec away!
1 available

Pet Portrait - $125 (worth $150)
BookTuber and and amazing artist, Sian O'Brien, is contributing a 10x8" head and shoulders pastel drawing of your pet! Check out her website here: https://sianobrienart.wixsite.com/artist
Price includes shipping. Intl okay!
1 available

Endless Gratitude

Seriously. We appreciate your support so much. BookNet Fest is very much the project of our hearts. We are passionate about media, the importance of storytelling, and fostering online communities. Putting this event on is a risk for us. To be perfectly frank, we are on the hook for any of the money we don't raise. So, again, we really do appreciate your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can help! Please share with your friends and get the word out. If you are interested in donating a perk, let us know.

story:
Heroes Of Scotland Book

Campaign Aim
My aim with this project is to teach children that they can look up to or even emulate scientists, engineers, inventors, great minds etc not just pop stars, actors and footballers. Entertaining and engaging them with detailed, hand drawn, colourful and humorous illustrations. This work can also impact the parents by presenting Scottish figures they had studied in their own schooldays in a new and fun way, helping them to present the ideas and achievements of these people in a form easily digested by both parent and child. Ultimately encouraging a conversation with their children about the figures in our history and in turn getting children to investigate these figures further on their own.

I have already have a path to market as I have secured a publishing deal with Bombadil Publishing and require the requested funds to dedicate the following months to research and to create each hand drawn entry on a full time basis. Unfortunately the days of getting an advance to complete the work are gone, hence my campaign here on Indiegogo.
Through my social media presence and with help of friends within the Scottish press I am encouraging the public to suggest entries that they deem worthy to teach children about.

Perks and Rewards

One of the main perks is for you to be able to suggest additions to the book. Scottish men and women you feel have not got the recognition they deserve for their contribution to Scotland and the wider world.

The rewards will involve signed copies of the the finished product and prints of your favourite 'hero'.  The larger the contribution you make the more prints you will get.

Risks and Challenges
I do not foresee any issues with the completion of this project because usually the main stumbling block is the uncertainty of finding a publisher once the book is ready to print and distribute. As stated above I have already secured a publisher who is delighted with the concept of the book and eager to take it to print as soon as possible.

With regards to the completion time I have given myself 6 months based on a list of people, which at the very minimum will be 50 but I hope to include as many as 100. With public involvement, involvement I welcome, I want to include as many figures as possible. The funding I am asking for will allow me to dedicate my entire time and effort to the completion of this project.


To suggest a hero for the book or for more information email at heroesofscotlandbook@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

About the Authors: Scott Cote has based some of the tech system details on his personal experience as an inventor. His current company is developing an advanced AI solution for healthcare that mirrors the hero system in Medica. It is called Grr-ithm, Inc. He has been involved in healthcare in its many forms for over 16 years. Scott has been happily married for 22 years and has 3 beautiful daughters.

Dr. Johannes Lierfeld is a scientist and long time fictional writer. He has developed over 20 screenplays, sold 3 series concepts, and wrote the screenplay for the award-winning and critically acclaimed dystopian SciFi thriller "2012" (the 2007 version.) He is a lecturer at both Philipps-University and the University of Cologne, teaching screenwriting and narrative concepts.  His habilitation thesis focused on Artificial Intelligence and its effects on  society. Johannes and Scott have already completed the screenplay for the TV pilot for Medica. They are presenting the script to industry leaders in production.

Our campaign and why it's important to us. Medica isn't just a book, it is a portrayal of possibilities. The novel takes on the existential threat mankind could be faced with through  Artificial Intelligence and overpopulation. Could an elitist society control  mankind through the current healthcare system and its vulnerabilities? Could they implement a veiled depopulation lottery? Could advanced Artificial Intelligence be used to guide humanity to major breakthroughs in understanding, solving, and curing disease? Although Medica is a fictional tale, it is riddled with facts and amazing medical solutions you didn't even know existed.

We promise to excite you, tug on your heart strings, keep you on your toes, inspire you with possibilities, thrill you with intense mystery and show you there is a hero on the way.

Here is what we need. We are asking for your help to raise funds for self-publishing our novel Medica. The funds will cover; book editing, website build, Copyright registration, ISBN numbers, formatting for different e-book formats, legal costs for contracts with Amazon...,book cover design, and a simple book trailer.

Here is what You Get! 

Perk 1:  $60 Major contributors will receive a soft cover copy and an E-book copy of Medica, The chance to privately ask 15 questions about what is true and what isn't in the story line, a complete set of beautifully rendered digital art  images pertaining to Medica.

Perk 2: $35 Moderate contributors will receive a soft cover copy of Medica, the chance to privately ask 5 questions about what is true and what isn't true in the story line, and 3 beautifully rendered digital art images pertaining to Medica.

Perk 3: $15 Modest contributors will receive an e-book copy of Medica and a beautifully rendered digital art image pertaining to Medica.

Medica is already written, so there no risk of it not being finished. Contributors will be receiving their copies of Medica and their other perks before December 25th. Just in time to buy for someone as a gift.

What is the magnitude of what contributors will help us achieve? Your contribution could create a pathway to helping us introduce a potential solution into healthcare that could truly transform mankind and its societies. Once the book is on sale in the market place, much of the proceeds of the book will go right into the technical development of Grr-ithm, Inc. Grr-ithm, Inc. will be offering the use of its advanced AI medical solution for free in healthcare. (free for the patient, free for the doctor, free for your insurance provider) Profits will come in other forms that will not cost patients anything. Have a look: Grr-ithm.com

The Impact: Your contribution will set things in motion that could create positive changes in healthcare, while  enriching each others lives. Publishing Medica=Book sale revenues=Funding for an AI solution, called Grr-ithm, Inc.=better healthcare outcomes at no additional costs=an enriched society

Other Ways You Can Help: Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools! And that's all there is to it.

story:
AUPI  

Pese a que fue fundado el 7 de diciembre de 2014, Bizkaia Boggarts Quidditch Taldea fue ideado por Yeray Espinosa allá por marzo de 2014.

Tras varios meses de búsqueda consiguió un grupo de gente dispuesta a participar en el equipo. Los tres que le acompañaron en la aventura fueron Nahia Otegui, Javier Fernández e Irene Velasco. Posteriormente, en navidades, Sergio Gutierrez y Ander Carbón se unirían al equipo formando el primer grueso del equipo. Todos estos fueron los que participaron en el primer partido del equipo vasco, perteneciente a la Copa Catalunya el primero de marzo de 2015, venciendo a Imperius Zaragoza 210*-70.

Tras ello vino un largo periodo sin ningún encuentro hasta que se enfrentaron por primera vez a Gasteiz Gamusins, venciendo de nuevo, esta vez por un margen más corto, 40*-110. De mediados de junio a la actualidad cinco nuevos jugadores se han unido al equipo vasco: Nagore Marquina, Josema Molinos, Sergio Johan Serrato y los hermanos Eriz y Sandor-Aritz Augusto.

Cinco de los jugadores de la plantilla de los Bizkaia Boggarts participaron en la primera Selección de España que participó en los European Games en Sarteano, Italia, el 25 y 26 de julio de 2015.

El 8 de agosto jugaron su primer torneo, el Transpiriquove. Acudieron con 6 jugadores propios, a los que se unieron Meguil, de los Madrid Wolves, y Nil, de los Barcelona Eagles. Con sólo 8 jugadores fueron capaces de lograr la segunda posición, poniendo en serios aprietos en la final al equipo de la ciudad condal, campeón de Catalunya.

Después de este torneo se incorporaron a las filas del equipo vasco Alexander Domínguez y Andoni Aranguren dejando la plantilla en 14 jugadores.

El 12 de septiembre de 2015 fue la fecha en la que dio comienzo la Euskal Liga. Se disputaron dos partidos y el conjunto vizcaíno se impuso en ambos, 20-190* y 40*-110 respectivamente.

El 10 de octubre de 2015 se disputó la Mangamore Kopa 2015 en la que el equipo de Bizkaia consiguió la segunda posición cayendo en la final 70-60*, eliminando en semifinales en un igualadísimo partido a Madrid Wolves, 90*-60.

En 2016 el equipo siguió creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar casi a la suma de 30 integrantes. Este año se han disputado dos Copas de España, la primera de ellas en Febrero donde quedamos subcampeones de España ganando el que seria nuestra primera medalla plateada en Rivas (Madrid), la segunda se celebro el pasado Noviembre en Ronda (Málaga) donde nuevamente ganamos el segundo puesto renovando nuestro titulo de subcampeones, y llevándonos a casa una segunda medalla plateada.

.

Ahora pedimos ayuda para poder viajar a Bélgica para disputar la competición europea por equipos o la EQC, ya que la mayoría de nuestros integrantes no tiene ingresos, somos el primer equipo de quidditch vasco en poder ir y queremos realizar nuestro sueño que puede ser posible gracias a vosotros.

ESKERRIK ASKO

GEU NAUSI, JO TA HAUTSI.

HI

Even if the team was created on december 7th, 2014, Bizkaia Boggarts was conceived in march 2014.

After some months looking for players, he managed to gather 3 more people to start training: Nahia Otegui, Javier Fernández and Irene Velasco. Then, in christmas, Sergio Gutiérres and Ander Carbón joined the team creating the first solid group in the team. These were the players who played the first ever game of the basque team, a friendly in the first Catalonian Cup, that they won 210*-70 against Imperius Zaragoza.

After a long term without games, they played again against Gasteiz Gamusins, winning with a lesser margin: 40*-110. That summer Nagore Marquina, Josema Molinos, Sergio Johan Serrato and Sandor-Aritz Augusto joined the team.

Five of the players in Bizkaia Boggarts played with Team Spain in the first European Games in Sarteano, Italy, on the 25th and 26th of July.

In the roster for the 2016 World Cup, 7 of the players in Team Spain were from Bizkaia Boggarts.

The team is known for competing with few people and struggling to have a big roster. And with few players (8 in 2015 Transpyrenees Cup, 9 in the first Spanish Cup and 10 in the second Spanish Cup) they have managed to get to the final, (losing against Barcelona Eagles, Madrid Wolves and Lumos Compostela in those finals).

Now we have more players, but insufficient money to gather players for tournaments. We hope you can help us to have more players for the European Quidditch Cup in Mechelen.

Thank you very much.

GEU NAUSI, JO TA HAUTSI.

story:
"Ali to narod traži!"

Ova rečenica se obično čuje kad se neko požali na količinu crnila i prepucavanja svake vrste u medijima. Možda to narod traži, možda je narod sistematski istreniran da baš to traži, a možda narod jednostavno nema izbora. Mi smo grupa ljudi koja vjeruje da je za zdravu i normalnu atmosferu u jednom društvu nužno da čovjek ima kvalitet izbor medija kojima će da posvećuje svoju pažnju. I kada smo shvatili da na domaćoj sceni ne postoji časopis kakav želimo - odlučili smo da ga stvorimo sami.

Talas je nastao kao projekat Srđana Ivankovića i Borisa Maksimovića, koji su odlučili da svoju frustraciju trenutnim izborom na kioscima i ljubav ka kvalitetno dizajniranim časopisima ispunjenim dobrim sadržajem pretoče u jedan konkretan projekat. Kasnije smo počeli u tim uključivati kako neke nove i neafirmisane autore tako i neke novinare sa dugogodišnjim stažom u svim vrstama štampanih medija. 

I tako je nastao Talas, kvalitetno odštampan časopis vrhunskog dizajna koji donosi inspirativne i iscrpne intervjue s ljudima koji se trude da poprave svijet oko sebe, ali i obilje sadržaja iz svih oblasti kulture i umjetnosti. Ukratko, nešto što želite dugo da čuvate na polici.

Čuvamo od zaborava stvaranje, strast, ljubav i naporan rad!

Prvo što smo uradili bilo je da definišemo vrijednosti koje ćemo zastupati. Talas nije samo gomila sadržaja na jednom mjestu već časopis koji ima jasno definisane vrijednosti koje su napisane na zadnjoj strani korica. Tamo stoji: "Priče koje donosimo trude se da predstave uno univerzalno i suštinsko u naporima stvaralaca, očišćeno od dnevnopolitičkog trenutka. Čuva od zaborava stvaranje, strast, ljubav i naporan rad.

 

" Kad smo to definisali krenuli smo u okupljanje tima i pola godine smo pripremali prvi broj koji je objavljen početkom juna 2016. Od tada smo izdali pet brojeva koji u prosjeku imaju oko 140 strana, prešli preko 2000 kilometara radeći promocije, upoznali nevjerovatnu količinu nevjerovatnih ljudi koji rade nevjerovatne stvari i shvatili da u ovoj zemlji ima toliko toga o čemu vrijedi pisati. Vjerujte nam, toliko se toga dobrog dešava oko nas i velika je grehota što se o tome malo piše i izvještava. Talas je zapravo pokušaj da se ta nepravda ispravi. Koliko uspješan, vrijeme će pokazati, ali znajte da preko ove kampanje vi možete mnogo pomoći u tome. 

"Ali zašto se patite sa štampom i ne objavljujete u vidu portala?"

Imamo mi i internet izdanje gdje možete da pročitate odabrane tekstove iz Talasa i nismo ograničeni samo na štampu. Ali prevashodni razlog zašto nam je štampano izdanje primarno leži u jednoj drugoj činjenici. Papir je najprimjereniji oblik za sadržaj koji mi donosimo, a to su iscrpni i sveobuhvatni tekstovi koji s vremenom ne gube na značaju. Možda dnevnim novinama prijeti izumiranje jer su izgubile trku sa internetom, ali periodična štampa nije mrtva i njena budućnost i leži u specijalizovanim časopisima iz niše, khm, kao što je Talas :)  Osim toga, neurolozi su dokazali da štampana izdanja ostvaruju daleko više pozitivnih uticaja na naš mozak u odnosu na digitalna. Ono što pročitate u jednom štampanom časopisu ostavlja dublji trag, izaziva više asocijacija nužnih za pamćenje i povezivanje činjenica i daleko više opušta tijelo nego čitanje na internetu. Da rezimiramo, Talas nije časopis, Talas je lijek za opadanje pažnje i fokusiranosti koja nas sve više i više pogađa. 

Šta nam treba i kako vi možete pomoći? 

Idemo redom:

  • Kao što smo rekli u naslovnom videu, godišnji troškovi štampanja Talasa iznose oko 9.000 KM. Za ovu godinu Ministarstvo prosvjete i kulture Republike Srpske obezbijedilo je podršku "Talasu" od 4.000 KM, što nam je ogroman vjetar u leđa. Vjerujemo da ćemo tokom godine obezbijediti 2.000 KM od oglašavanja, a od vas tražimo da nam pomognete da skupimo tu razliku od 3.000 KM koja nam je potrebna da pokrijemo štampu na godišnjem nivou kako bismo mogli da se što više posvetimo stvaranju najboljeg mogućeg sadržaja i kako bismo položili čvrste temelje za brojeve od 9. do 12. 

  • Dali smo sve od sebe da svaki od paketa bude što raznovrsniji i što više odgovara vrijednosti uplate. Preko ove kampanje možete se pretplati, možete dobiti jedan ili više prošlih brojeva (mi ih ne zovemo stari jer oni ne stare), možete odabrati paket časopisa ili proizvode ili usluge ljudi o kojima smo pisali i koji su razlog zbog kojih Talas postoji. 

"A šta ako...? Znate već..."

Mislite, šta ako ne uspijemo? Izlazićemo sigurno na ovaj ili onaj način do osmog broja i to je sigurno. Uspjeli smo da objavimo pet brojeva i objavićemo još tri, makar se nasadili na glavu. Ali šta nakon toga? To ostaje na vama. I ova kampanja treba da nam pomogne da vidimo da li je Talas samo projekat gomile entuzijasta koji opstaje na mišiće ili ljudi zaista žele ovakvo nešto i spremni su to da podrže. Vaša podrška je uspjeh za sve nas. Mi želimo stvarati za vas ne samo još 3, već 33 broja časopisa! Podrškom nam dajete znak da ga želite čitati. Dajte nam znak!

Kako nam još možete pomoći? 

Nije nikakav problem ako ne možete da se na ovaj način pretplatite ili preko nekog drugog paketa finansijski da nas podržite. Možete nam pomoći i na druge načine. Na primjer: 

  • Proširite vijest među ljudima da postoji jedan časopis koji je krenuo od nule, koji donosi dobre i inspirativne priče i kojem treba pomoć zajednice kako bi izlazio i narednih godina.
  • Podijelite kampanju na Fejsbuku, Tviteru, Instagramu...
  • Možda znate neku firmu koja bi se rado oglašavala u jednom ovakvom časopisu? 
  • Možda vi imate neku priču? Javite nam se na casopis.talas@gmail.com ili uredniku direktno na boris@casopistalas.com

I hvala vam svima, gdje god bili i na koji god način pomogli.

story:
#DEEPBREATH is a global project about the effects of living in air polluted environments.  It combines social media event based on real time reporting with innovative storytelling and will be followed by the release of an interactive reportage.

The project is based on cross-border collaboration between reporters from 8 countries:

  • Nairobi, Kenya - Brian Otieno,
  • Mexico City, Mexico - Mauricio Palos,
  • Beijing, China - Chiara (nickname)
  • Kabul, Afghanistan - Maria de la Guardia,
  • Kathmandu, Nepal - Benjamin Filarski,
  • Cairo, Egypt- Mahmoud Kattab,
  • Cracow, Poland - Magda Chodownik
  • Mumbai, India - Vishal Manve

In each country, one reporter will cover his/her part of the story i.e. will follow one person who deals with the smog on a daily basis - a doctor, a researcher, a person who suffers from air pollution, a factory worker, an activist, etc.

Online, real time, simultaneous reporting

On the  May 5th, all 8 journalists and photojournalists will live report from their countries. The audience will be able to follow the work of correspondents as it unfolds. We created a dedicated website where all insights from the ground will be gathered. You can find it here: http://outride.rs/en/making-of-deepbreath/

In times of fake and alternative news, we want to be transparent. We also want to create an interesting social media event focused on journalism. Therefore, all reporters will work the same day and share parts of their work online that exact day. 

You will be able to follow reporters while they work.

Interactive story

The interactive reportage will put together all of stories from 8 countries.

This way, we will be able to show and explain the smog problem from different angles, not only one side and perspective. Our report will combine data journalism with doctors and researchers comments as well as with personal stories of people suffering from air pollution. All in 1. We also made sure to include the countries where environmental issues are still underreported. Putting them together with known polluted places, it will make a bigger impact on people's awareness of the problem.

Our aim is to focus on personal stories of people who deals with often invisible pollution. We want to encourage everyone to rethink the way we affect the climate as well as how as a consequence the climate affects us.

story:
What is Missy/Ink Magazine?

We have some great perks! Digital copies, subscriptions, shout outs, NATIONAL ad spaces, and more! 

Missy/Ink Magazine was started in 2012 by Bella Rouge and Dana Brushette - it has grown immensely in just one year. We started Missy/Ink because we were tired of what was available for women in the tattoo magazine genre - they are all directed at men! We want to change that. Missy/Ink is a female centric tattoo lifetyle magazine that focuses on womens interests, and expands the idea of what beauty is to all shapes and sizes.

Having Missy/Ink on shelves across Canada (and eventually The United States) would mean the world to us - it would be the difference between growing the business, or staying local and not expanding past what we have already become in a short period. We believe our success thus far is because women are very interested in what we have to offer, and really love the overall message Missy/Ink puts forward.

By helping us get on shelves you will be kickstarting a small business into full working mode - we will be able to pay salary for our magnificent team. You will be helping to create real jobs for real women.

Printing Costs A LOT!

This $3000 will be going strictly towards printing the magazines first run of Issue 12 for January 2014. The cost for small run prints is quite a lot, but as we grow and print in larger quantities this cost will go significantly down. Even if we don't reach our entire goal, the money we do raise will go 100% to printing. We have been able to sustain ourselves so far with advertising sales and magazine sales through magcloud.com but to move forward we really need to step up our game.
 

Impact Statement

As mentioned, by funding this campaign you will be helping to fund and create more jobs in the Canadian workforce. Missy/Ink currently has an Editor in Chief, Associate Editor, Graphic Designer, Copy Editor and Event Coordinator as well as help from an administrative assistant. There is still space for SO MANY more employees - you will be investing in a growing company in Canada. Small business is the heart of Canada, and keeps the economy going.

Other Ways You Can Help!!!!

What is Missy/Ink Magazine?
We have some great perks! Digital copies, subscriptions, shout outs, NATIONAL ad spaces, and more! 
Missy/Ink Magazine was started in 2012 by Bella Rouge and Dana Brushette - it has grown immensely in just one year. We started Missy/Ink because we were tired of what was available for women in the tattoo magazine genre - they are all directed at men! We want to change that. Missy/Ink is a female centric tattoo lifetyle magazine that focuses on womens interests, and expands the idea of what beauty is to all shapes and sizes. Having Missy/Ink on shelves across Canada (and eventually The United States) would mean the world to us - it would be the difference between growing the business, or staying local and not expanding past what we have already become in a short period. We believe our success thus far is because women are very interested in what we have to offer, and really love the overall message Missy/Ink puts forward.
By helping us get on shelves you will be kickstarting a small business into full working mode - we will be able to pay salary for our magnificent team. You will be helping to create real jobs for real women.


Printing Costs A LOT!
This $3000 will be going strictly towards printing the magazines first run of Issue 12 for January 2014. The cost for small run prints is quite a lot, but as we grow and print in larger quantities this cost will go significantly down. Even if we don't reach our entire goal, the money we do raise will go 100% to printing. We have been able to sustain ourselves so far with advertising sales and magazine sales through magcloud.com but to move forward we really need to step up our game.  


Impact Statement
As mentioned, by funding this campaign you will be helping to fund and create more jobs in the Canadian workforce. Missy/Ink currently has an Editor in Chief, Associate Editor, Graphic Designer, Copy Editor and Event Coordinator as well as help from an administrative assistant. There is still space for SO MANY more employees - you will be investing in a growing company in Canada. Small business is the heart of Canada, and keeps the economy going.


Other Ways You Can Help!!!!
Please, if you are unable to contribute, share our campaign and spread the word about Missy/Ink Magazine.

story:
First things first!  Have you heard about Shades of Grey? Who hasn't, right?  My novels are a perfect compliment to anyone seeking more along the lines of erotic mastery.  

The first thing I'm going to do is find a good marketing agent that will get my books to the same market that is driving Shades of Grey.

Then keep on writing.  My second novel is even spicier then my first with deeper insights into the characters and darker scenes that tantalize.

Strong character development, a good storyline and steamy sex scenes can bring fantasy into reality.

Keeping it real by self publishing!

Since publishing my first novel, I have really enjoyed being in control of my own work, not having signed my rights away to some publishing house.  Which means I can determine who prints my book, how many books are printed and how my book is marketed.  I can even turn it into a movie, or a few different movies, if I like, since I didn't sign the rights to my characters away to anyone else.

The downfall of self publishing is that it comes with all the costs of production.  Not only do I need to buy the publishing package to get it printed, but I need to pay for an editor and someone to help with marketing.  

With my first novel, I only had enough funds to get it published. I had friends and family do the editing, which was helpful, but not as professional as I would have liked.  I have also noticed that while the writing fills me with passion and drive, the marketing doesn't come so easy.  The little energy I have put into advertising has shown positive results.  I would like to be able to offer a monetary exchange for someone who's savvy in this industry and can wave their wand for my benefit!

With enough funding I will be able to complete the writing of this second novel, have both of my novels professionally edited and published and create a solid marketing campaign.

Excerpts of "All Acts of Love and Pleasure Are Her Rituals" can be found on YouTube at: http://www.youtube.com/user/AllActs?feature=mhee

Shortly after I got divorced in my early 30's I had a hard time getting to sleep with my mind going in circles about what was going on in my life at that time. The only way I could get any rest was to tell myself a story. I found myself diving into the mythical and historical world of Lady Caroline Hathaway. 

Being raised Catholic in a deep South, land loving, matriarchal family, I found myself pulled to pagan teachings, finding the earth based traditions something tangible that I could honor on a daily basis, instead of in some building somewhere... looking outside of myself for the answers.

Becoming Pagan kind of felt like "coming out" in a way. I felt as if I could and would be mocked and criticized.  After learning about how the earth-based traditions were driven out of us in such dire ways, I felt I remembered being chastised for my beliefs to the point of death.  Fortunately, in this day and age we need not worry about being killed for our beliefs. I felt compelled to explore my true path.

As I began studying the ways of the moon and the aspects of the Goddess, I began to wonder what life would have been like during the period when these teachings flourished. Could there have been a woman who experienced the abrupt shift in consciousness from being revered for her powers for most of her life to being condemned as a witch?

The story of Lady Caroline Hathaway in "All Acts of Love and Pleasure Are Her Rituals" (buy it as a perk or visit www.amazon.com/All-Acts-Love-Pleasure-Rituals/dp/1432744747/), follows this journey of one woman's tale through the end of an era.  She is born into a secret society where predictions of her life foreshadow their actual events and cause her father to steer her away from her heritage.

As she grows into her power, she turns to the mythical figure of her grandmother for support and guidance, but Grandmother's teachings can only take her so far.  Lost in a world without guidance and filled with a passion so intense, she doesn't know how to quell it, she turns to the Doctor, an elder in the society, for support.  The Doctor not only helps her to navigate the ways of the body to treat ailments, but he also teaches her the power of submission.  These treatments though bondage and masochism are the only path Caroline can find to relinquish her passion and fully give herself over to the unknown.

Her tale not only follows the mythic qualities of coming into her Priestess path, it also dives into the deep erotic nature of human desire.  It explores a time where love was not chastised and sex was freely exchanged, between women and between men. When the earth was worshiped, the body was worshipped. When nature became chastised so did our inherent lusty drives.

Being a believer in a more polyamorous lifestyle, my novel explores the nature of open relationships where commitments do not constrain the partners from enjoying others.  Caroline finds herself in love with a man she can never truly have, only to be committed to him in such a way that is threatened when she meets the man who will help her realize her full potential. What happens when these worlds collide?  Can Caroline share her life with these two men?  And can these two men share their lives with each other?

Before writing this novel, I scoured the shelves looking for a similar story.  As a single woman who was not dating much, I craved erotic literature.  But something was missing.  Sure sex tales are fun and erotica has a certain musky flourish to it that captivates the senses, but I wanted more.  I wanted to be involved with the characters. I wanted a good storyline that had good sex, not some regurgitated tripe that used flowery metaphors to allude to the sex act.  I found a few books like Starhawk's "Fifth Sacred Thing," and Marion Zimmer Bradley's "The Mists of Avalon" that held my interests in the tale and contained some steamy scenes, but that still wasn't quite enough for me.

So, as I drifted off to sleep at night, I lived in Caroline's world.  And as I drove through the streets of Los Angeles for hours at a time to organize community based tree planting projects, Caroline's tale passed the time.  She became such a strong character in my psyche, I felt that if I didn't sit down and write her story, then I could possibly be taken over by her if I received a good blow to the head.

That's why I say it is not a story that I wrote, but a story that came pouring through me.  After making the decision to write the novel, it took me nine months to complete it.  After that, I held some private book readings and raised funds by selling pre-orders for my novels.  It is because of those 75 people who purchased the novel before it was published that made it happen.  If I did not have their belief and support and promise to fulfill, the manuscript would still be in a drawer somewhere under my bed.

Thankfully, I have published it and many more people have been able to read it and be touched by it.  Some people connect with it on a deep level and some people don't.  Regardless, many have told me how brave I am to put it out there. I hope that telling this tale will inspire others to live their dreams by expressing themselves as fully as they can.

This second novel, “The Initiation of Lady Caroline”, is not a sequel or a prequel, it's what I call a "withinquel" because it takes those pauses in between the chapters or the sentences that sum things up and dives into them.  It broadens the characters and reveals the driving force behind their decisions.  It takes Caroline's relationship with the Doctor to deeper and darker levels, letting us know just how far she can go.

"We tend to think of the erotic as an easy, tantalizing sexual arousal. I speak of the erotic as the deepest life force, a force which moves us toward living in a fundamental way." ~ Audre Lorde

My life aside from being a writer is dedicated to localism and community organizing around land stewardship and traditional practices. I am on the board of our local Transition Town movement, an active member of our local Grange and am a certified permaculture designer. I walk my talk by shopping locally, eating organically, driving a BioDiesel and ensuring that my books are printed on demand in the USA.  (If only they could be printed on hemp paper at a reasonable cost!)

I have been ordained as a priestess from the 13 Moon Mystery School and initiated into the Third Road Faerie tradition.

As a believer in sharing the wealth and supporting those who make a contribution to this world, I am also donating a portion of the proceeds of this campaign and all book sales to The Planned Parenthood Action Fund, an organization dedicated to healthy reproduction and reproductive choices for all.*

My hope is that my novels will bring forth the erotic nature not only sexually, but sensually and powerfully connected to the earth and all of her bounty.

The most important thing you can do is share this with your friends through all of your social media! 

*http://www.plannedparenthoodaction.org/

** www.oceannavisions.com/portfolio.htm

*** www.gregorybeylerian.com/paintedformhome/painte...

story:
The Upshot
I would like to raise funds for the second issue of an indie adult eZine -- FMO.


More on FMO
FMO is a tri-annual (three issues a year) indie prose fiction e-magazine heavily steeped in strong adult themes.

Every issue will feature three to five ORIGINAL stories by various authors from around the world.


Issue Two?
Yes, I am campaigning for issue 2 as the first issue has already launched (thanks in part to indieGOGO!). Check out the five reviews (opens in new window) it has received in just the first month since launch.

What is the current state of the issue (2)?
Submissions from authors have been rolling in since launch of the first issue back in June, and I have enough stories to fill the issue. I also have a fantastic cover artist.

Authors considered for publication in this issue: 
DL Warner
MT Starkey
James 'Grim' Desborough
Alex S. Johnson
Shon Richards
David W. Barbee
Phro Metal
Jon Konrath
Made in DNA

Cover artist:
Skip Hawks

Please note though, the issue is not yet finalized, so authors and cover artist are subject to change.

What I Need
So where does the money go? Every cent of your contribution will cover the second issue, which breaks down into the following:

$300 > Cover/image/mascot/wallpaper art. Issue 1 featured a cover (see sexy girl above) by hentai artist Toshio Maeda (of La Blue Girl and Urotsukidoji: Demon Invasion fame). This issue (2) will feature a fantastic CG cover by Skip Hawks!

Art is generally very expensive. There's no way around it.

$400 > Fiction. I pay my authors $0.01 per word for their fiction. That might not sound like much, but if I were funding a full novel (around 100,000 words), it gets expensive fast. The point is that this is a PAYING publication. I do NOT ask authors to do this for free. I treat the words of Harlan Ellison as truth: "PAY THE AUTHOR!" And that's exactly what I plan on doing.


What You Get
Check out the perks on the right-hand side for a full account.

Please consider funding this project, even if it's just with a dollar. You might already be spending more than that on a cup of coffee, which will be gone when you are finished with it. FMO is a product that you will be able to enjoy for years to come.


Other Ways You Can Help
If money is not your thing, the biggest thing you can do to help is spread the word! Visit the homepage, LIKE the page on Facebook, follow the Twitter account, and otherwise spread the word on your homepage or via your favorite blog -- word-of-mouth is, hands down, best way to promote. Please, by all means, share this project URL with as many people as possible.


Thank you for taking the time to consider FMO. Whatever your decision, I appreciate that above all else.

   --Brent Millis, publisher FMO

story:
This Book MARGARET is about a REAL Person

 

Imagine being a woman with a rebellious streak, who doesn't want to settle for marriage and domesticity, but is trapped by conservative disfuntional grieving parents who moved their children to the other side of the world. Imagine it's in the mid 1930s and the opportunities for women who want more simply don't exist.  This book explores the passions and desires of a woman born 50 years too early for the life she really wanted to lead.   But it also explores the limited choices for women in the 40s and 50s who step outside of what society dictates as acceptable and how some managed to briefly step around the fringes of convention.  

Not only is it an excellent story, but it will make you think.   I've created mystery, intrigue, sexuality, and murder - and this story is based on a real person named Margaret whom I came to know briefly when she was in her 80s.  I was intrigued by what would drive a loving mother from her children - to turn her back on them completely, and so the story unfolded.  

My name is Maria Carlton - and this is my first novel - I've also just finished the first draft of another, and the sequel to Margaret is now started.   I've had fantastic reviews for Margaret from the Amazon Breakthrough Novel Awards where it made it to the Top 10% of entries early in 2013.   

Now to complete the publishing process, I need to not only fund the final production costs - I'm going to work with a well established Cooperative publishing house in the UK, who is keenly waiting for this manuscript - and we intend to have it ready for sale in time for Christmas this year.   

Your contribution which I've effectively tried to offer as pre-ordering options will enable the publication process to be sped up - and also to enable sufficient marketing of the book to ensure that the sequel and my other book is brought to market quickly.   

I've written top selling non-fiction books, but intend to move into becoming a full time fiction author within 3 years - that means creating a strong back catalogue quickly.  

Your contribution to this funding campaign will help make that a reality - and for that I thank you very much.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $5000 US / the equivalent of just over 3,000 British Pounds for: 

  • Editing typesetting and design
  • Marketing
  • An initial print run 

The Impact

With this pre-ordering and funding to enable this to happen efficiently this book has an excellent chance of becoming successlful enough to make it 

  • Able to sell Globally
  • A top seller - straight out of the gate

I have had a successful history of writing and selling NON-fiction books for myself and other authors over the past 8 years, but writing and selling fiction is a whole new ballgame and to be successful in this field requires good management and marketing of new authors and their titles.  I'm going to be working with Mindy Gibbons Klein - who knows books, the book industry, and has an enourmously successful co-operative publishing track record for her authors.   But - as it's not a traditional publishing model - which is great because we have greater control and better profitability over the work - it does mean some up front  funds are required to get this going hard and fast.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are willing and able to help fund this book to market by pre-purchasing any of the options offered, then please know that your contribution is hugely welcomed.   

If you are unable to financially assist at this time - then please can you get in behind the book and tell people about it - help me to promote the pending launch by spreading the word.   

You can also read the first three chapters via this link.

story:
Summary

Brave New Girls: An illustrated collection of young adult science fiction stories starring tech-savvy females with the goal of inspiring more girls to become STEM (Science Technology Engineering and Math) professionals. Edited by sci-fi authors Paige Daniels and Mary Fan

The mission

I'm Tina Closser, also known as science fiction author Paige Daniels, and I've teamed together with fellow sci-fi author, Mary Fan, to tackle a subject near and dear to our hearts. We've both been avid devourers of books since we were young girls, especially when it came to sci-fi stories, with worlds as unlimited as the imagination. However, something seemed to be missing: the presence of strong tech-savvy leading ladies. Sure, there were plenty of impossibly sexy babes ready to kick butt in their four-inch heels and bumbling, brainy side kicks playing second fiddle to the main protagonist, but rarely would a smart, tech-savvy woman make it to the forefront of a story.

Well, as they say, if you want something done right, you gotta do it yourself.So we, Paige and Mary, teamed up to take a step toward changing this. We're collecting stories from brilliant authors that feature smart and strong heroines in the lead. The goal of this book is to show girls there are more roles for them than just a sidekick or a sexy babe. We feel if girls can see themselves in a role then they can become it. As an added bonus, all of the profits will be given to a Society of Women Engineers scholarship fund.

The Masterminds

So just who are we? Let’s answer in our own words…

Tina Closser aka Paige Daniels   


I grew up in various towns around Northern Kentucky reading and watching as much science fiction and fantasy as humanly possible. When it was time for college it was clear that I watched one too many episodes of Star Trek, because I chose Physics as my major with the intent of being an Astrophysicist. After graduating from Northern Kentucky University with my Bachelors of Science in Physics, I knew that academia was not the path for me so I chose to get an Electrical Engineering degree at the University of Kentucky in Lexington. Armed with two science degrees, I went to work for the Navy in Indiana.

Throughout high school and college I had millions of ideas for stories running through my head, but never had the courage to write any of them down. Thanks to the reality TV craze, I turned off my television and worked up the courage to write down a story that had been worming its way into my brain for years. I wrote “Non-Compliance: The Sector” under the pen name of Paige Daniels over the course of several years. In November 2012, it was published by Kristell Ink. In September of 2013, the follow-up novel, “Non-Compliance: The Transition” was published. Both are fast paced science fiction, cyberpunk tales with elements of humor and romance with a strong heroine. It explores different themes such as family, government control, and how one seemingly insignificant person can make a difference.

Despite being surrounded by a bunch of Hoosiers, I have lived happily in Indiana for the past fourteen years. I have held several different engineering positions in the past, but currently, I am a Science Technology Engineering and Math Coordinator... basically it's my job to get kids excited about science. 

I am also very active in my local chapter of Society of Women Engineers, doing many outreach programs to inspire girls to consider the field of engineering as a career.

In my spare time, I coach a robotics team and attend various robotics competitions. I also fiddle around with my viola and like to pretend I know how to be a farmer on my small hobby farm with my two kids and husband.

Mary Fan

I’m a lifelong nerd. My teen years were spent measuring the speed of light at physics camp and building robots for school competitions. I built my first Star Wars fansite when I was 12 and was scribbling my own space operas at 13. Of course, none of them were very good, but that doesn't mean I stopped… In fact, my debut novel, Artificial Absolutes (released by Red Adept Publishing in 2013) is a space opera with a dash of cyberpunk and the first book in the “Jane Colt” series. The sequel, Synthetic Illusions, came out earlier this year, and I’m working on Book Three.

In addition, I also write young adult fantasy, with two series, “Flynn Nightsider” (dystopian fantasy) and “Fated Stars” (high fantasy), under contract with Glass House Press. A prequel novella to “Flynn Nightsider”, titled The Firedragon (about a monster-fighting teen girl), was released a few months back.

I've spent the past several months pounding the pavement at sci-fi/fantasy conventions on the East Coast, from Central PA Comic Con, in which I argued why sci-fi was the best genre of all on a panel with two fellow authors, to Balticon, where the black-and-red wings I wore probably did more to sell books at my booth than my pitching. And I've just started…

The stories

We can’t give away any specifics about the actual stories going into the anthology, since we’re still collecting submissions and won’t make a final decision until after the November 15 deadline for authors, but we can tell what kinds of tales we’d accept.

The only requirement for the submissions, other than that it be appropriate for young readers, is that the protagonist be a teen girl who can handle her tech –  like a hacker, a starship mechanic, a robot engineer, or a biopunk scientist. Since we’re open to any and all sub-genres of sci-fi, the stories could be anything from mildly futuristic technothrillers to out-of-this-world space adventures.

Through the selection and editing process, we will ensure that each story is tightly written, well-paced, and fully developed.

The nuts and bolts

So just where will your dollars go if you choose to donate? The quick answer is: straight to the book’s production. Both of us are happily donating our time to this project, and the authors are donating their stories. The money we’re raising here will pay for the costs of professional editing, proofreading, formatting, and artwork for the interior illustrations, as well as marketing collateral such as bookmarks and online banner ads. 

To be 100% transparent with where your dollars would be going, let’s take you through the exact process we’re planning to follow:

Step 1: Collect and curate stories from a talented pool of sci-fi authors, who are graciously donating their work

Step 2: Hire a professional editor to whip the stories into top-notch shape, from closing up plot holes to smoothing out character development

Step 3: Hire a professional proofreader to zap any pesky typos and iron out any grammatical issues

Step 4: Commission or purchase rights to appropriate artwork to illustrate the anthology (one illustration per story)

Step 5: Send the polished stories and artwork to a professional book designer for formatting

Step 6: Upload the final product onto a variety of online distribution platforms, including Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and iBooks, for e-book and print-on-demand paperback releases

Step 7: Promote the anthology online via blog hops, social media, and online ads, as well as in person at bookstores and sci-fi/fantasy conventions

You might have noticed that we're taking the flexible funding option, that's because we're going to do this project no matter what. If we don't get fully funded we may have to skimp on things like illustrations for each story, but worry not, the book will be complete.


What We Need & What You Get

We’re grateful for any and all donations, and everyone giving $50 or more will receive an acknowledgement in the anthology itself. Depending on your level of donation, we’re also offering rewards in the form of the book itself (of course), our previously published works (the “Non-Compliance” cyberpunk series by Paige Daniels and the “Jane Colt” space opera series by Mary Fan), paragraph dedications to donors or those who inspired them, and prints of the Brave New Girls cover art.

  


In addition, if you choose to rule as a Galactic Emperor, Mary Fan will write a piece of sci-fi flash fiction (1,000 – 3,000 words) starring you or a person of your choice (a child, a relative, a friend, etc.) as the hero/heroine. This is more than a Tuckerization – it will be 100% custom. So, for example, you could ask Mary to write a story about your 5-year-old daughter as a steampunk airship pilot, and she’ll happily oblige.

And if you want to be really generous, you can rise to the exclusive role of Multiverse Deity, of which there can only be one, naturally. If you choose to claim this title, Mary will write a full-on short story (3,000 – 10,000 words) starring you or a person of your choice. Same level of customization as the above – you could ask Mary to write a story about your cyborg husband saving the world from flesh-eating zombies, and she’s cool with that too.

In either case, these custom tales will be published as part of the anthology with a special byline for the donor.


The Impact

What’s the significance of encouraging girls in STEM? STEM fields are one of the few jobs set to increase in the future. As a matter of fact, the growth rate for STEM jobs in the next ten years is 18% compared to 9% for non-STEM jobs. Translated: get a STEM degree and you’ll have a job in a tough job market. However, the STEM job outlook for women isn’t as great. By age 7 girls lose confidence in math and only 13% of engineers are women. However, women who hold STEM degrees can potentially earn 33% more than women in other fields.


For a degree that holds such power, shockingly few women earn them. One example is in the ever-growing world of programming: only 14% of 2013 graduates with computer science degrees were women. We hope by busting stereotypes and showing girls the potential they all hold we can possibly be a key to changing some of these statistics.


Risks & Challenges

Luckily, both of us (Paige and Mary) happen to be professional project managers by day, and so we’re quite used to managing the multitude of moving parts that come with handling complicated jobs. Between our clear-cut plan and get ‘er done attitudes, we foresee this project going pretty smoothly. However, we are also well aware of the risks associated with any high-complexity project, which in this case primarily involve timing.

Though we've laid out a realistic plan based on our past publishing experiences, with the goal of having the anthology out in midsummer 2015, unexpected hurdles could always throw it off. After all creativity can’t be rushed, and we may need to stretch timelines to accommodate time for revising both the stories and any custom artwork. And since our anthology has a pretty specific theme, we may need to extend our submissions deadline, currently set at November 15, 2014, if we don’t have enough appropriate stories by then.

And, of course, both of us have a million other commitments, between our day jobs, other writing projects, family (in Paige’s case), and plotting to take over the world (in Mary’s case). So it’s entirely possible that we’ll need extra time to read through all the submissions and coordinate the publishing process.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the cash on hand to donate? That's okay, we understand times are tight. Consider writing a story or submitting art to the cause here. Giving us a shout out on your favorite forms of social media, telling a friend or acquaintance, or even words of encouragement are greatly appreciated.

story:
I've always dreamed of being a writer. I wrote my first story in grade school, and I never really stopped. My first rejection letter dates back to 1983. I was twelve.

Three years ago, I started writing short romantic fiction. And, more importantly, I started selling short romantic fiction! This was a major dream come true for me -- I was a writer. A published writer.

Just over a year ago, I sold my first novel, Princes of Air, to Circlet Press. It was released to the wild in November of 2011, and I love it almost as much as I love my son. 

Almost.

A few days ago, I got the news that this novel, this first brain-child of mine, has been nominated for a major award. Specifically, the Passionate Plume award, which recognizes excellence in erotic romance. The Passionate Plume is sponsored by Passionate Ink, the erotic romance chapter of the Romance Writers of America.

Here's where the expensive part comes in. All major RWA awards are given out at the RWA National convention. This year, that convention is happening in Anaheim, at one of the Disneyland hotels.

I'm in Central Florida. Not too far from Disneyworld, actually. Which means that I have to get FROM the Mouse, TO the Mouse.

The irony... you can cut it with a knife. 

Now, despite what the media wants to tell you, writers don't make a whole heck of a lot of money. Most of the writers I know watch a certain television show about a writer and a cop and think it is the height of comedy. We really don't live like that. So... flying across country, staying in a Disney hotel for five days, and attending the National convention? Cost prohibitive doesn't even BEGIN to cover it.

And so I turn to you. My friends, my fans, my family.  

Help?

Edited on 6/13/2012

Just to give you an idea of what the costs are going to be, as of yesterday, this is the price breakdown.

RWA National conference: $645.00

Airfare to LAX and back: $574.00 (and guaranteed to go up)

Shuttle to and from the airport in LA: $34

Hotel: $219 a night, plus taxes and fee, so total $1300 to $1400.

Food: I'm putting down $750.00 for food, because this is Disney.

That comes to roughly $3400. Indiegogo takes 4% of whatever is raised, so I added in a margin to cover the airfare that will almost definitely go up, and to cover the Indiegogo fees.

Hope that gives everyone a better idea of the costs involved.

story:
Introduction

Hello! My name is Tania Elfersy and I am the co-creator, co-editor and publisher of Purple Leaves, Red Cherries.

Once upon a time (really!) I had an idea to create a special gift for new mothers. A gift that would inspire, embrace and comfort new moms AND be so much more useful than anti stretch mark cream!

This idea became the book Purple Leaves, Red Cherries.

About the Book

Within Purple Leaves, Red Cherries there are 48 very short stories on motherhood, stunning illustrations from the artist Nomi Melul Ohad, personal journal space and a Mothers' Toolkit with self-development exercises to help new moms come to grips with the impact of motherhood in their lives.

Andrea Katzman (my co-creator and editor) and I carefully selected stories that uncover how moms are handling their relationships, work, expectations, sex lives and more. 

We hope that our book will help our readers feel that as they journey through motherhood, they are not alone. We also hope to encourage readers to share their own stories of motherhood.

A Self-Publishing Project

I am self-publishing the book.  

Did I approach any publishers? No! These days "sisters (and moms) are doing it for themselves!" The internet, ecommerce, social media and sites such as these make self-publishing an attractive alternative.

Does this mean that I personally undertook ALL the tasks usually carried out by a big publishing firm? Absolutely not! In addition to working with Andrea and Nomi, I recruited a very talented design team, professional editors, proofreaders, web developers and a PR firm.

My creative team has helped make this book into a wonderful gift. I invite you to download two free chapters to see the results.
http://purpleleavesredcherries.com/book/downloa...

To date, Advance Review Copies have been sent to the media and I am preparing for the book's launch in early May.

In the meantime, I thought it would be a great idea to allow people to pre-order signed copies of the book and more. Great because it allows fans of the project to support us ahead of launch, and great because all money pledged will help cover the costs of the first printing round of 2,000 copies of the book. 

A Win-Win Campaign

With so many people excited about this book and wanting to help, I have created a win-win campaign.

I have already invested heavily in this project. However, printing the first round of 2,000 high-quality, offset, full color books is a large financial strain.

By connecting directly with customers through this site, I can offer Purple Leaves, Red Cherries perks at below the list price.

This campaign's target is to raise $4,000 before the book's official launch date. $4,000 will cover a minor portion of the costs of the first printing round. Money raised above this amount will cover more of the printing costs and will be welcome! If I come anywhere close to covering the full printing costs I will update this page.

Our perks range from eternal gratitude (for a pledge of $1), an ebook of the short stories (for a pledge of $5), a hardback copy of the book signed by Andrea, Nomi and myself (for a pledge of $25) and a signed hardback copy of the book plus a high-quality poster print of a picture of your choice from the book, signed by Nomi (for a pledge of $60).  More details of these perks can be found in the green column on the right side of your screen.

The Future

I hope this campaign will reach its target and that I will stay up for nights on end signing and packaging books to send. However, even if I don't raise the complete amount, I will move forward with the launch plans and this beautiful book will come to market.

Once launched, you will be able to buy the book through a third party, such as Amazon. A sale through Amazon of course will support the project but not the work of this self-publisher quite as much!

Check out our website for more information on Purple Leaves, Red Cherries. http://purpleleavesredcherries.com

If you have any questions, feel free to contact me by clicking on the picture of me (top right of your screen) and sending me a private comment.

Thank you for your support and please share this page.

FIND OUT THE LATEST NEWS ABOUT THIS PROJECT BY CLICKING THE UPDATES BUTTON ABOVE

We hope that our book will help our readers feel that as they journey through motherhood, they are not alone. We also hope to encourage readers to share their own stories of motherhood.
A Self-Publishing Project
I am self-publishing the book.  
Did I approach any publishers? No! These days "sisters (and moms) are doing it for themselves!" The internet, ecommerce, social media and sites such as these make self-publishing an attractive alternative. 
Does this mean that I personally undertook ALL the tasks usually carried out by a big publishing firm? Absolutely not! In addition to working with Andrea and Nomi, I recruited a very talented design team, professional editors, proofreaders, web developers and a PR firm.
My creative team has helped make this book into a wonderful gift. I invite you to download two free chapters to see the results.http://purpleleavesredcherries.com/book/downloa...
To date, Advance Review Copies have been sent to the media and I am preparing for the book's launch in early May. 
In the meantime, I thought it would be a great idea to allow people to pre-order signed copies of the book and more. Great because it allows fans of the project to support us ahead of launch, and great because all money pledged will help cover the costs of the first printing round of 2,000 copies of the book.  
A Win-Win Campaign
With so many people excited about this book and wanting to help, I have created a win-win campaign.
I have already invested heavily in this project. However, printing the first round of 2,000 high-quality, offset, full color books is a large financial strain.
By connecting directly with customers through this site, I can offer Purple Leaves, Red Cherries perks at below the list price. 
This campaign's target is to raise $4,000 before the book's official launch date. $4,000 will cover a minor portion of the costs of the first printing round. Money raised above this amount will cover more of the printing costs and will be welcome! If I come anywhere close to covering the full printing costs I will update this page.
Our perks range from eternal gratitude (for a pledge of $1), an ebook of the short stories (for a pledge of $5), a hardback copy of the book signed by Andrea, Nomi and myself (for a pledge of $25) and a signed hardback copy of the book plus a high-quality poster print of a picture of your choice from the book, signed by Nomi (for a pledge of $60).  More details of these perks can be found in the green column on the right side of your screen.
The Future
I hope this campaign will reach its target and that I will stay up for nights on end signing and packaging books to send. However, even if I don't raise the complete amount, I will move forward with the launch plans and this beautiful book will come to market. 
Once launched, you will be able to buy the book through a third party, such as Amazon. A sale through Amazon of course will support the project but not the work of this self-publisher quite as much!
Check out our website for more information on Purple Leaves, Red Cherries. http://purpleleavesredcherries.com
If you have any questions, feel free to contact me by clicking on the picture of me (top right of your screen) and sending me a private comment.
Thank you for your support and please share this page.

story:
Hello, you beautiful book worms and avid readers.

My name is E.M. Moon  and I have been writing for almost 18 years. It has always been a strong passion of mine to develop ideas and gain inspiration from the world around me (and those fantastical realms of supposed fantasy and fiction) to write great stories.

When I write, I think of the reader, and not just the story, not just me as the writer. I want people to pick up a piece of my writing and feel something from it, connect with the characters and story lines, put themselves into the stories, and make them think. I want to inspire others, not only in their lives as readers, but as creators in their own right. I want to incite creativity, create a haven from every day life, and fill the reader with an emotional whirlwind that has them literally FEELING and EXPERIENCING what I write, even if it is just words on paper.

I have been writing since about the age of twelve when I first discovered a little program called "Microsoft Writer" and typed up my first story about a possessed Dolly that wreaks havoc on a preteen and her friends (I know, it's been done :P )
Since then I have started and stopped many a story, penning whatever inspires me at the moment, but  losing sight of an ending. Up until that point, writing had been merely a hobby for me, but I wanted it to turn in to so much more. I completed my first full length novel in 2014, and haven't stopped writing since, delving in to the world of self-publishing and trying to get it all out there.
I currently am a stay at home mom to a beautiful, scarily intelligent and creative, 4 year old girl. I have a wonderful husband who is not only my best friend, but my creative think take and my number one supporter in my writing (and the process) and pushes me to do better and never give up.
But enough about me personally...on to the stories and why you are here.

Like I said, I have literally turned in to an eternal fountain of never ending stories. Every day a new idea pops in to my head and I rush to write it down, lest I forget. I don't have enough time in my day to write all the things that I want to write, but I am driven to create original stories with unique characters and story lines that make people just itch for the next book in the series. I can write all day every day, but since I am a stay at home mom with a limited income, getting my books out to the masses has proven to be quite difficult.

This is what brings me to the meat of the campaign...

I have quite a few books that are already self-published through channels like Amazon and Creatspace and I have several stories that are being written as we speak. My goal is to really get these books seen, to get them in the hands and on the computer screens of readers like YOU. But as I said before, in this day and age when it comes to self-publishing and being an Indie Author, getting yourself out there can be quite difficult and surprisingly expensive.

 

The S.A.I.N.T.S. Series
The Captain and the Alchemist

Book Blurb for The Captain and the Alchemist

I currently have THREE series in publication at the moment. Two series are Novel length while the other is serialized fiction written almost like a TV show in seasons. I love what I write (as an author should, even if they hate it by 6,345 edit), but I don't expect you to just take my word for it like some snake-oils salesman without giving it a little try first

So, take a look for yourselves...

You can check out my series below and each one has an accompanying website with character bios, book blurbs, and author info.

 

The S.A.I.N.T.S. Series:

Steampunk paranormal and supernatural Sci-fi series set in the late 1800's.

http://thesaintsseries.weebly.com/

 

667: Children of the Beast:

Episodic Sci-fi/Superhero fiction written in "Issues" of novella length.

http://667childrenofthebeast.weebly.com/

 

Faytes of the Otherworld:

Post apocalyptic urban/epic fantasy set in a modern day alternate timeline

http://faytesoftheotherworld.weebly.com/

 

Now that you have a feel and gotten a little taste for my work, let me tell you what my ultimate goal is with this campaign...

Self-publishing is a thriving industry right now and more and more Indie Authors are able to get their works out to readers without having to go the traditional route of professional publishing. The problem with this can be a multitude of hurdles that you have to overcome just to peak a reader's interest.

 

Character Concept for Dani Shea, the Main Protagonist for Faytes of the Otherworld

Character Concept for Violet Eve Quirke: 667 Children of the Beast

 

When you go the traditional route for publishing, the publishing company does a lot of the work for you. Once you have your book(s) professionally edited and your manuscript in the hands of the publisher and they decide to publish it, they work on the cover art, printing, and even marketing of your books. When you are an Indie Author, YOU have to do ALL of that on your own for the most part.

This can prove to be really difficult unless you have the monetary means and networking ability to advertise for yourself, market your work, and figure out all the right outlets to thrust yourself in to Book Land so that your stories end up in the hands of awesome readers.

Cover Art for Book 2 of Faytes of the Otherworld: Destyned

As I said before (and I feel like a broken record at times) having limited funds and a small networking scope can virtually make you invisible in the independent publishing industry. I want this campaign to help me fund fun and unique ways to market my books, create swag for the readers, purchase paper copies for distribution to book stores and other sellers, as well as advertising for myself and networking at conventions.

I feel like my goal amount is a good start up to get the ball rolling and garner more readers and possibly publishers in the future. Funds will go towards marketing materials like flyers, stickers, buttons and other swag, website upgrades, advertisement on Facebook and Amazon, and booths at conventions where I can really interact with potential readers and sell my work.

 

Now you know what I am working towards, but you are probably asking yourself, "What do I get for supporting this campaign besides super cool new books to read?"

Well, a lot of things.

Some of you will get credit for contributing to my writing endeavors on my author website and official Facebook page, paper and digital copies for books of your choosing, signed copies in paperback, fun swag likes signed pictures from book photo shoots, and a few of you could even get to work with me to create a very special character in one of my series and get credit for that character in the finished product!

I love to do photo shoots that correspond with my series as a way to give the readers visuals of the worlds.

Here are some examples of that work by Photographer Jordan Albertson.

(Some of these will be perks!)

 

Posters from 667: Children of the Beast

Paperback copies of my books with beautiful cover art and that sweet book feel in your hands!

 

I want to not only give you really cool stuff to read and physically collect, but the ability to be a part of my stories and my creative process. (Which is a doozy, mind you)

I am a person who hates to ask for things and not give anything in return. In a world where money can be tight, even for the best of us, I think that bartering/trading/and sharing of goods and not just cash can be a great way for us all to work as a community and help one another succeed. My perks will get you involved in the story, put the magic in your hands, and take you to a different place entirely. If for some reason this project doesn't get fully funded, I will still use what I have to put back in to this series and work even harder to get the stories in the hands of all you wonderful readers!

As with any project, there are always risks and challenges. Life isn't always forgiving, but like the characters that I create, I will overcome those hurdles. Writing is the one thing that I know I am good at; a talent that I want to share with everyone and not just  myself. I could say that it is a calling, and one that I've answered, so no matter the outcome of this project or future ones, I will still push to have my stories heard and give delight to those that I share them with. Before this point I have beaten the pavement with getting my work hyped up within the masses, and I have done that all on my own without any sort of funds whatsoever.

And even if you can't donate (which is COMPLETELY understandable) but you really want to help because you feel strongly about this campaign, you can always get the word out by sharing the project or sharing my posts on my Facebook page! (Which I will also be doing LIVE updates on) I always return the favor, so if anyone needs help with their own projects, I am more than willing to comply.

If you love reading like I do and you can contribute to the authors that lovingly craft stories for their readers, please take the time to help them in any way you can, even if it is just a little share :)

Follow me on Social Media and my Site for updates, contests, and my newsletter!

Author Website: http://author-emmoon.weebly.com/

FB Author Page: https://www.facebook.com/AuthorE.M.Moon/
