story:
The Great Reboot

For the first time in 100 years, the economy is literally shutting down in order to restart again — but the systems that come back to life are not going to be like the ones we knew before. Like rebooting a computer with a new operating system, our society will function in fundamentally different ways.

Every major crisis gets a name: The Great Depression, The Great Recession, The Dot-Com Bust. I believe this one might just become known as The Great Reboot. This book is about how you can navigate the post-pandemic world of technology and society of The Great Reboot.

 

My name is Arnobio Morelix and I am the author of The Great Reboot, the first book ever on how to navigate the massive shifts in technology and the economy in the decades after the pandemic.

 

My hope for the book is that I can help people — including myself — understand what is happening with the Great Reboot and offer tools to navigate it.

 

In this book, you'll learn about the ways in which technology and society are shaping each other, including insights around:

  • Why Sir Tim Berners-Lee, the creator of the World Wide Web, thinks the internet is broken and how we can think about fixing it.
  • What Vint Cerf, one of the fathers of the internet and Chief Internet Evangelist at Google, thinks tech creators need to take into account today that they did not in the past; and how the all-new framework of the Four Quadrants of Unintended Consequences of Tech can help you address Vint’s challenge.
  • Why the world is getting increasingly weird: If you imagine 2016 as a baseline for a very strange year, it's easy to see how it has just gotten stranger since then and we present how the little-known concept of the Pacing Dilemma explains this phenomenon.
  • How the long-running transition of a major share of the economy from analog to digital became dramatically accelerated, with shifts we expected might take 10 years happening in 10 weeks and how the simple economics of the Great Reboot can help you understand the timing of the changes and what comes next.

 

You will love this book if you are a founder or technology creator (or are interested in these worlds) and you deeply care about the broader impact of technology on society: no matter if you are in a startup or a big corporation.

There were many inspirations for this book, but an event on February 2, 2020 still sticks in my mind. On that day, I received a strange message from a business contact in China. We had a trip to Beijing scheduled 10 days later to discuss a business partnership, and our hosts sent an email of a couple of lines saying something to the effect of "Do not come to Beijing now due to the coronavirus situation, and we urge you to reconsider your trip to Seoul." South Korea was our stop before China. The dates all blur in our minds today, but on February 2, there were fewer than 200 reported COVID-19 cases confirmed in the world outside of China. The United States (the country with most cases at the time of this writing) had fewer than 10 confirmed COVID-19 cases in total, versus the millions it has today.

This event got me on the path of digging deep into the topic, and I started the Great Reboot Project, along with a website and early writing, in March 2020. I am continuing on this journey to make sense (and take action) around major global changes of historical proportions. It has been thrilling and I hope you join me.

 

We are making tremendous progress since the project began, and became the #1 trending new project on this platform within 24 hours of launch, and later again during the campaign. I hope you join me in supporting and sharing the message of the Great Reboot.

 

The Book: The Great Reboot

The Great Reboot book is written in three parts:

  • Part 1 is about the Three Waves of the Great Reboot and The Economics of Pandemics, with a framework on how to think about the unfolding changes over time, and how to prepare for them. I preview some of these in my columns for Inc. Magazine, so you can check that out if you are curious.
  • Part 2 is about the Circles of Impact of the Great Reboot: in particular the macro context of what is happening in the circles of Home, Work, City, and World.
  • Finally, Part 3 is what we call the New Operating System Toolkit, focused on what you can do about all of this. The Toolkit is targeted to founders and technology creators — both people and companies — that want to navigate this new world in the most informed way possible.

What we are creating here is a book that is different from anything else you might read on the topic for three key reasons:

First, it is at the intersection of technology, economics, and policy — my three professional areas. I work as an executive at Startup Genome, a Silicon Valley company, I’m a UC Berkeley-trained data scientist with a background in economics (studied in the University of Kansas, in the American Midwest), and in my professional history I have created research used by senators, governors, mayors, and the White House. I have worked directly with current and former government ministers as well as policymakers at the state and city level. You can read about each of these three areas separately, but they intersect in really important ways, especially in The Great Reboot.

Second, it brings a global perspective. As a native Brazilian living in the U.S. and working with organizations in every continent of the world, I am working here to tell this as the truly global story that it is.

Third, it is both long-term and action-oriented. The book is about how to navigate not only the changes that will happen in the next 1 to 2 years, but the next 1 to 2 decades. This is a point I want to make crystal clear: this is not a book about the pandemic. Rather, it is about the long shadow of The Great Reboot and its aftermath. In particular, it is about how to create technology responsibly in this new world.

 

What I Need and What You'll Get

 

This campaign is an exciting experiment on how I can collaborate with all of you to produce a book that is full of stories, learnings, and actionable insights on how to navigate the world of The Great Reboot.

I am thrilled that this campaign will allow me to share early drafts and ideas with you and incorporate your thoughts and stories in the book.

Throughout my career, I have authored dozens of research papers and reports (usually hundreds of pages every year) with organizations like  Startup Genome (where I proudly serve as Chief Innovation Officer), Stanford University, and the Kauffman Foundation (a multi-billion dollar philanthropy focused on entrepreneurship). I have also written for broader audiences for Inc. Magazine (where I serve as Chief Data Scientist), Forbes, and the World Economic Forum (where I am part of their Expert Network on the topics of like the Future of Economic Progress). I am also a Senior Advisor for the Global Entrepreneurship Network and Saude Ventures. In my usual writing, I do my best to learn from others and get feedback from trusted peers and advisors. But to be honest, it is sometimes too much like a “write it and they will come” process, and as a startup guy, that did not sit well with me. I did not want my book to be that way, especially about such a dynamic topic.

While I considered only doing a traditional book launch in December, this pre-publication campaign opens up more opportunities for collaboration with you that I could not pass up. I believe this will make our final product SO MUCH better.

This book will be published with New Degree Press, and the funds from this campaign will be used towards:

  • Additional research and writing, beyond what has been done for the current draft of the manuscript.
  • The editor I’m working with to revise and publish my book in December 2020.
  • New cover design of my book, as the mockups you see currently are a placeholder.
  • The layout design for the interior of my book in physical and e-book formats.
  • Launch and promotion efforts for my book, for when I ultimately publish this December 2020.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback (including the chance to suggest stories for inclusion — even your own).
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.
  • Ongoing updates on The Great Reboot.
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements section of my book (“With Special Thanks to”).
  • One-on-one work session with me about The Great Reboot, or any topic you might want to cover (All-Access Package and Above).
  • Book talk about The Great Reboot to your team or event (Experience Package and Above).
  • Half-Day Workshop about how your company can navigate The Great Reboot and inclusion of your organization’s logo in the book and companion website (Founding Funder Package).
  • Showcase your story at a Great Reboot Webinar around the book launch (Founding Funder Package).
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Arnobio Morelix is a Silicon Valley-based executive working at the intersection of technology, economics, and policy. His work and analysis has been featured widely in national and global media, including the New York Times, The Economist, the Wall Street Journal, and the BBC, among others. He's been a frequent public speaker, with presentations at South by Southwest, the Federal Reserve Bank, the OECD, and many others. Arnobio has advised, worked with, and presented to CEOs, founders, current and former government ministers, and top academics.

Arnobio is Chief Innovation Officer at Startup Genome, leading a global team researching and advising governments and private organizations across 35 countries on their innovation policies. He also serves roles at Stanford University (as a contributing data science expert for a research initiative focused on inclusion and entrepreneurship) and Inc. Magazine (as Chief Data Scientist).

Arnobio is the author of The Great Reboot, a book about how to navigate the post-pandemic world of technology and society. For more information, you can connect with Arnobio at arnobio@berkeley.edu, LinkedIn, or Twitter (@amorelix).

Arnobio and his work have been featured in:
 

 

Team

A project like this is a big lift, especially in the ambitious timelines we set for ourselves. I have brought together a world-class team to make this a reality:

  • Sean Ludwig, a technology and business writer/editor, formerly Communications Director at Tech:NYC, and reporter for VentureBeat, working with me on writing, editing, and strategy
  • Lubin Arora, a long-term collaborator, with consulting and research experience at places like Startup Genome, McKinsey & Company, and Bain & Company, working with me on research, writing, and management
  • Cass Lauer, my development editor with New Degree Press, who helped brainstorm many of the concepts that morphed into The Great Reboot
  • Natalie Bailey, my reviews editor with New Degree Press, working with me on the manuscript, including potentially new stories coming from this campaign
  • Jen Wichman, my acquiring editor with New Degree Press, helping me structure the manuscript and fill in the gaps still missing

I’d also like to acknowledge the huge list of talented people at New Degree Press who are working on marketing, video production, and other aspects of publishing.

The Journey Ahead

This book has been a tremendous learning journey for me so far. I have spoken with literally hundreds of leaders, in every continent of the world, about the general topic of the economy, technology, and the pandemic. But more specifically, even preceding the pandemic, I have done in-depth interviews with founders, executives, technology creators, and investors about how to think through the consequences of the technologies we create in society. These people currently or formerly work at places like Amazon, Facebook, Uber, billion-dollar startups, and top academic institutions.

In the next several months, this learning journey is about to get even more interesting, and I hope you join me for it. I cannot wait to learn from your own experiences and share more of what I learn along the way.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support.

Abraços,
Arnobio

 

Risks and Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

The Great RebootFor the first time in 100 years, the economy is literally shutting down in order to restart again — but the systems that come back to life are not going to be like the ones we knew before. Like rebooting a computer with a new operating system, our society will function in fundamentally different ways.Every major crisis gets a name: The Great Depression, The Great Recession, The Dot-Com Bust. I believe this one might just become known as The Great Reboot. This book is about how you can navigate the post-pandemic world of technology and society of The Great Reboot. My name is Arnobio Morelix and I am the author of The Great Reboot, the first book ever on how to navigate the massive shifts in technology and the economy in the decades after the pandemic. My hope for the book is that I can help people — including myself — understand what is happening with the Great Reboot and offer tools to navigate it. In this book, you'll learn about the ways in which technology and society are shaping each other, including insights around:
Why Sir Tim Berners-Lee, the creator of the World Wide Web, thinks the internet is broken and how we can think about fixing it.
What Vint Cerf, one of the fathers of the internet and Chief Internet Evangelist at Google, thinks tech creators need to take into account today that they did not in the past; and how the all-new framework of the Four Quadrants of Unintended Consequences of Tech can help you address Vint’s challenge.
Why the world is getting increasingly weird: If you imagine 2016 as a baseline for a very strange year, it's easy to see how it has just gotten stranger since then and we present how the little-known concept of the Pacing Dilemma explains this phenomenon.
How the long-running transition of a major share of the economy from analog to digital became dramatically accelerated, with shifts we expected might take 10 years happening in 10 weeks and how the simple economics of the Great Reboot can help you understand the timing of the changes and what comes next.
 You will love this book if you are a founder or technology creator (or are interested in these worlds) and you deeply care about the broader impact of technology on society: no matter if you are in a startup or a big corporation.There were many inspirations for this book, but an event on February 2, 2020 still sticks in my mind. On that day, I received a strange message from a business contact in China. We had a trip to Beijing scheduled 10 days later to discuss a business partnership, and our hosts sent an email of a couple of lines saying something to the effect of "Do not come to Beijing now due to the coronavirus situation, and we urge you to reconsider your trip to Seoul." South Korea was our stop before China. The dates all blur in our minds today, but on February 2, there were fewer than 200 reported COVID-19 cases confirmed in the world outside of China. The United States (the country with most cases at the time of this writing) had fewer than 10 confirmed COVID-19 cases in total, versus the millions it has today.This event got me on the path of digging deep into the topic, and I started the Great Reboot Project, along with a website and early writing, in March 2020. I am continuing on this journey to make sense (and take action) around major global changes of historical proportions. It has been thrilling and I hope you join me. We are making tremendous progress since the project began, and became the #1 trending new project on this platform within 24 hours of launch, and later again during the campaign. I hope you join me in supporting and sharing the message of the Great Reboot. The Book: The Great RebootThe Great Reboot book is written in three parts:
Part 1 is about the Three Waves of the Great Reboot and The Economics of Pandemics, with a framework on how to think about the unfolding changes over time, and how to prepare for them. I preview some of these in my columns for Inc. Magazine, so you can check that out if you are curious.
Part 2 is about the Circles of Impact of the Great Reboot: in particular the macro context of what is happening in the circles of Home, Work, City, and World.
Finally, Part 3 is what we call the New Operating System Toolkit, focused on what you can do about all of this. The Toolkit is targeted to founders and technology creators — both people and companies — that want to navigate this new world in the most informed way possible.

I work as an executive at Startup Genome, a Silicon Valley company, I’m a UC Berkeley-trained data scientist with a background in economics (studied in the University of Kansas, in the American Midwest), and in my professional history I have created research used by senators, governors, mayors, and the White House. I have worked directly with current and former government ministers as well as policymakers at the state and city level. You can read about each of these three areas separately, but they intersect in really important ways, especially in The Great Reboot.Second, it brings a global perspective. As a native Brazilian living in the U.S. and working with organizations in every continent of the world, I am working here to tell this as the truly global story that it is.Third, it is both long-term and action-oriented. The book is about how to navigate not only the changes that will happen in the next 1 to 2 years, but the next 1 to 2 decades. story:
We are super excited to announce the publication of our first book!

Deborah Natelson’s book Bargaining Power is scheduled to be released on December 1st. However, pre-orders will be available starting November 1st. Pre-orders are a chance to get the book at a discount and to help the book come out of the publishing gate at a higher ranking on Amazon. 

Here’s the back cover summary of the book and a peek at the front cover:

When she agreed to work for Carina’s greatest and strangest cryptanalyst, Mercedes didn’t realize she’d be playing cloak-and-dagger with aristocracy.  But once her boss uncovers a grotesque plot against King Emil II’s life, she doesn’t hesitate to dive into a world of deceit and trickery.  

Her plan might have worked, if the would-be assassins hadn’t had dark magic up their sleeves.  Soon, Mercedes has not only treacherous lords and ladies to deal with, but also both the beautiful, vicious personification Deals & Bargains and a horrifying pair of weapons ready to devour the king, bones and all.


 

What We Need to Publish

Through our Indiegogo campaign, which will begin November 1st and end November 31st, we’ll be raising funds to print the books. We’ve sourced our printing through the printers we have researched that offer us the best bang for the buck. But, even so, copies of books still add up. Each book we print costs us about $5 for just the printing. Editing, proofreading, book design, and cover costs for each book add up to around $2,000. We plan on ordering about 500 books for our first run of printing. That means each book costs an initial $4,500. 

Risks & Challenges

Sometimes I wonder why...why bother starting Thinklings Books or any company? It's such a hard endeavor! What'd we get ourselves into? We're small fish in a great big ocean. Heck, we're fish eggs right now. Caviar. … Caviar. High quality, costly, of great value. And trying to help other writers who are small but valuable too. That thought helps me just keep swimming.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Book Reviews

Honest reviews are super hard to come by, especially for first-time authors, but are one of the best ways to boost sales.

I know, also, that people get extra nervous about writing reviews. I’m sure it has something to do with those awful page-long book reports we had to do in school, but this isn’t going to be graded and doesn’t need to be nearly as long. You don’t even have to summarize the book; that’s what the book’s summary is for. Did you like the book because you liked how the main character talked? Say that. If you thought it was really good, but you were hoping for a certain ending and that didn’t happen? Write that.

Honest, short, to-the-point. 

2. Share Their Social Media Posts

It’s hard for many writers to continually post about themselves. Writers mostly tend to be a quiet, self-deprecating lot. With our Platform in a Box, we teach them some types of simple posts they can make about their books, but it’s even more helpful if you can share these posts.

No need to add anything to it if you don’t want to. A simple share to page, or retweet, is fine. If you want to go the extra mile, like the Thinklings Books page on Facebook and share our posts about the author.

3. Book Launch Party

​If you are really up for some party planning and have that pizzazz, then working with a local library, bookstore, or other venue to plan a fabulous book signing / launch party is a wonderful gift for the writer in your life. If you have terrific party-planning skills but don’t know anything about book launches, just send an email to contact@thinklingsbooks.com. I’ll be more than willing to help you brainstorm.

Authors can, of course, plan their own party; but it does seem more legit to bookstores if someone else does it . . . even if you are just the person of contact, fill out the permission forms, and then disappear into the night. 

Even if you aren’t the planning or form-filling type, you can still make sure that you show up for the book signings or launch party. Having a friendly face in the crowd makes even the most boisterous, confident author feel more at ease.

4. Low-Tech Sharing

Even if you don’t like computers, social media, or the internet, you can still talk up the book on the physical streets. Your author can give you bookmarks, posters, or flyers to put in schools, libraries, bookstores, or community centers. You can even use mankind’s oldest (and arguably greatest) technology: the spoken word. Tell your book club. Tell your mother. Tell your friend who likes to read.

Here are a few additional low-tech options:

-Put the book in one of those little free library boxes. 

-Leave the book on a table in a coffee shop.

-Gift the book to readers in your life.

-Give the book, if applicable, to local school libraries.

-Form your own book club and use your author’s book as the first book.

-Leave a flyer wherever you see people reading books.


5. Putting Books on Consignment at Bookstores

The author can, again, put their book on consignment at a local bookstore, but it looks better if someone else does this. Most local bookstores have a form you can fill out, and you can give them a couple of copies of the book. You can ask your author, or email us at contact@thinklingsbooks.com, for wholesale copies of the book to give to bookstores.

When the bookstores sell the book, they keep a certain amount of the profit and will hand the rest over to you. Usually these consignment contracts have a specific amount of time that they will have your book available. If the book doesn’t sell all of its copies before the end, you will need to come back and pick them up.

This is an especially good strategy if you are having a book signing at the local bookstore. Most of the copies will be sold right around the time of the book signing. If your author is well known in the community, you may be able to negotiate for a really good placement for the book. But, even if she is not well known, many local bookstores do have a special place for local authors to be displayed, and often quite prominently. 

If you need help negotiating this area, shoot Thinklings Books an email, and we’ll be happy to help you out. We’re here to make everyone’s job easier.

6. Requesting at Libraries

Did you know that you can request books to be at your local library? Some libraries will have the book available after just one request. Others require a few more. On the other hand, libraries also have e-books for borrowing as well. You can check out the author’s book on your Kindle or other e-reader device through the library’s online catalog. This is an easy way for the library to offer a wide array of books without actually buying them. If enough people check out the e-book from the library, they may even decide to have a hard copy available as well.

You can just walk right up to the librarian and ask if they have your author’s book available. You don’t even need to let them know the author is a friend. Just see if they have it available. They will look it up and say one of 3 things: 1) Yes, we have it available. 2) We do not have the hard copy of it, but you can download it via the online catalog. 3) We do not have it available, but you can submit a request; here’s the form or the link to the form. 

Easy peasy. 

7. Writing Reviews on Goodreads

In addition to leaving reviews on Amazon, you can also use Goodreads, which is a social media platform for readers. You just need to follow the same advice I gave above for Amazon. In fact, you can leave the same review you left on Amazon.

8. Leaving Comments on Their Blog

As part of Platform in a Box, authors are given a simple website with a blog. They will once, maybe twice per month, write a post on the blog about their book, give an update on it or themselves, or on something related to their craft.

Checking in once in a while and leaving a simple, authentic comment such as “Can’t wait to see you at the book festival!” is great. Asking the author a question is also great. For example, “Who is your favorite author?”

9. Join The Readers’ Collective

The Readers’ Collective is Thinklings Books’ group of diehard fans and readers. We send out weekly updates on our authors, which will include yours; YouTube videos; artwork; blogs; important links and dates; podcasts; and much more. It’s the easiest way to keep abreast of Thinklings’ offerings and what is going on in your author’s life. 

Being part of the Collective comes with quite a few perks, such as discounts on books, exclusive author interviews and artwork from their books, and sneak peeks at videos and recordings of their books. You never know what goodies might show up in your inbox!

It’s easy to sign up. Just follow this link and put in your email address and you’ll be all set. Make sure you check your spam folder so it doesn’t get junked before you see it.

10. Get Involved with Crowdfunding

Thinklings Books does publishing a little differently. We’re a small press, and we use a structure similar to PBS or NPR. We pay our authors higher royalties, to boot. To borrow from PBS: Without the financial support of readers like you, Thinklings wouldn’t exist. If you want to learn more about how Thinklings operates and is different, we did a three-part blog series on the topic.

In addition to this page, we also have Patreon, which will allow people to support our writers and our creative endeavors on a monthly basis. Patreon might be something many of you have never heard of before, but I think it is super awesome! It’s a website that puts a modern spin on the age-old idea of patronage. Most great artists of the past, from Leonardo da Vinci to Mozart, had patrons. Most of the time, these patrons were extremely wealthy families with money to burn. However, Patreon makes patronage accessible to even the average Joe. With monthly patronage subscriptions as low as $1 per month, even high school students have the ability to support artists of their choice. Like patrons of old, Patreon subscribers get special bonuses from the artists beyond the reach of the general public. We’ll be reading our first chapters on video, providing exclusive artwork related to the books, and giving control of picking video critiques to our Patreon subscribers. Plus a lot more!

-Leave the book on a table in a coffee shop.
-Gift the book to readers in your life.
-Give the book, if applicable, to local school libraries.
-Form your own book club and use your author’s book as the first book.
-Leave a flyer wherever you see people reading books.
5. Putting Books on Consignment at BookstoresThe author can, again, put their book on consignment at a local bookstore, but it looks better if someone else does this. Most local bookstores have a form you can fill out, and you can give them a couple of copies of the book. You can ask your author, or email us at contact@thinklingsbooks.com, for wholesale copies of the book to give to bookstores.When the bookstores sell the book, they keep a certain amount of the profit and will hand the rest over to you. Usually these consignment contracts have a specific amount of time that they will have your book available. If the book doesn’t sell all of its copies before the end, you will need to come back and pick them up.This is an especially good strategy if you are having a book signing at the local bookstore. Most of the copies will be sold right around the time of the book signing. If your author is well known in the community, you may be able to negotiate for a really good placement for the book. But, even if she is not well known, many local bookstores do have a special place for local authors to be displayed, and often quite prominently. If you need help negotiating this area, shoot Thinklings Books an email, and we’ll be happy to help you out. We’re here to make everyone’s job easier.6. Requesting at LibrariesDid you know that you can request books to be at your local library? Some libraries will have the book available after just one request. Others require a few more. On the other hand, libraries also have e-books for borrowing as well. You can check out the author’s book on your Kindle or other e-reader device through the library’s online catalog. This is an easy way for the library to offer a wide array of books without actually buying them. If enough people check out the e-book from the library, they may even decide to have a hard copy available as well.You can just walk right up to the librarian and ask if they have your author’s book available. You don’t even need to let them know the author is a friend. Just see if they have it available. They will look it up and say one of 3 things: 1) Yes, we have it available. 2) We do not have the hard copy of it, but you can download it via the online catalog. 3) We do not have it available, but you can submit a request; here’s the form or the link to the form. Easy peasy. 7. Writing Reviews on GoodreadsIn addition to leaving reviews on Amazon, you can also use Goodreads, which is a social media platform for readers. You just need to follow the same advice I gave above for Amazon. In fact, you can leave the same review you left on Amazon.8. Leaving Comments on Their BlogAs part of Platform in a Box, authors are given a simple website with a blog. They will once, maybe twice per month, write a post on the blog about their book, give an update on it or themselves, or on something related to their craft.Checking in once in a while and leaving a simple, authentic comment such as “Can’t wait to see you at the book festival!” is great. Asking the author a question is also great. For example, “Who is your favorite author?”9. Join The Readers’ CollectiveThe Readers’ Collective is Thinklings Books’ group of diehard fans and readers. We send out weekly updates on our authors, which will include yours; YouTube videos; artwork; blogs; important links and dates; podcasts; and much more. It’s the easiest way to keep abreast of Thinklings’ offerings and what is going on in your author’s life. Being part of the Collective comes with quite a few perks, such as discounts on books, exclusive author interviews and artwork from their books, and sneak peeks at videos and recordings of their books. You never know what goodies might show up in your inbox!It’s easy to sign up. Just follow this link and put in your email address and you’ll be all set. Make sure you check your spam folder so it doesn’t get junked before you see it.10. Get Involved with CrowdfundingThinklings Books does publishing a little differently. We’re a small press, and we use a structure similar to PBS or NPR. We pay our authors higher royalties, to boot. To borrow from PBS: Without the financial support of readers like you, Thinklings wouldn’t exist. If you want to learn more about how Thinklings operates and is different, we did a three-part blog series on the topic.In addition to this page, we also have Patreon, which will allow people to support our writers and our creative endeavors on a monthly basis. Patreon might be something many of you have never heard of before, but I think it is super awesome! It’s a website that puts a modern spin on the age-old idea of patronage. Most great artists of the past, from Leonardo da Vinci to Mozart, had patrons. Most of the time, these patrons were extremely wealthy families with money to burn. However, Patreon makes patronage accessible to even the average Joe. With monthly patronage subscriptions as low as $1 per month, even high school students have the ability to support artists of their choice. Like patrons of old, Patreon subscribers get special bonuses from the artists beyond the reach of the general public. We’ll be reading our first chapters on video, providing exclusive artwork related to the books, and giving control of picking video critiques to our Patreon subscribers. Plus a lot more!

story:
¿Qué?

El guardabosques es una inquietante novela de género, donde los desolados paisajes nevados son un personaje más.

Hay un nuevo guardabosques en Korsning, se rumorea que es extranjero y lo más extraño, que es una chica. Una chica que ya huyó una vez de su pasado y ahora parece que ha decidido volver a hacerlo, pero lo que prometía ser una apacible y solitaria vida está a punto de truncarse, hay algo más en el bosque.

Una rama arrancada, unas pisadas en la nieve y una bala incrustada en un árbol la despertarán de nuevo, porque ella es Hedda Berg la periodista más famosa de Europa, la mujer que descubrió el crimen más macabro que jamás se había visto en el viejo continente.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Yesica Prol Cid.

Acaba de cumplir 27 años, es licenciada en Historia con un Máster Internacional en Evolución Humana, ha estudiado en el Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle de París y actualmente realiza el máster universitario requerido para ser profesora de secundaria y bachillerato en la especialidad de Geografía e Historia.

El guardabosques es su primera novela aunque desde su infancia ha disfrutado escribiendo poesía y pequeños relatos. “Me paso el día inventando historias y creando personajes en mi cabeza, incluso me inspiro en mis sueños, es porque no puedo dejar de imaginar, esa es el arma más poderosa que tenemos, es maravillosa y nos mantiene siempre vivos. Ella no nos falla aun cuando todo lo demás lo hace”.

Yesica Prol Cid se ha propuesto helarnos la sangre.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 750€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El guardabosques que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Yesica Prol Cid vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
All campaign books have sold out, but the 2nd printing has been announced

*** Get the limited edition 2nd printing of the leather volume here ***

About

Hi Everyone! Thanks for checking out my campaign! I'm Shiva - a writer, artist (www.serpentinae.com and www.thepentaclepath.com), organizer, and satanist.

The mythology behind satanic ritual is immense. Stories of human sacrifice and barbaric acts abound and have been falsely constructed throughout the centuries as a means execute, imprison, and demonize people.  In modern times, we've seen the resurgence of this belief via the Satanic Panic of the late 20th century. In reality, modern satanic ritual practice couldn't be further from these tales.

(photo by Lex Corey)

Over the years I've constructed rituals to use in my personal life as well as group rituals for The Satanic Temple Headquarters. I've explored the transformative nature of satanic ritual and witnessed it as a powerful force of good in my life and those who have used it to better themselves. 

(photo by Lex Corey)

The Devil's Tome is a book that explores non-theistic satanic ritual as a means for healing, empowerment, and community building.  I wanted to create the book I fantasized about finding when I first began my own journey into satanism - a stunningly beautiful work of art that would also serve as guide to help me understand modern satanic ritual and build my own practice.

I remember scouring old bookstores to find some gorgeously packaged mythical work to guide to inspire me as I began my journey into the occult, but nothing really fit the bill. The books I'm offering via this campaign are the realization of that fantasy. I'm creating a very limited first-edition printing of the illustrated ritual book that comes in two forms - a pearl linen cloth hardcover and a leather hardcover. Each will be stamped with gold foiling on the cover and include illustrations by Lex Corey and Lucien Greaves. Each will be limited to 111 copies.

Lex Corey (photo by June of 87)

Lucien and Shiva (photo by Courtney Brooke)

Inside the book you will find a foreword by Lucien Greaves, Co-Founder and Spokesperson of The Satanic Temple; an overview of my journey in to satanic ritual; the scientific case for secular ritual; and a collection of solo and group rituals you can use to further your own practice or inspire your own unique path.

What We Need

I went back and forth with this decision to crowdfund or seek a publisher, but ultimately I wanted to retain as much creative control as possible (Satanist much?) and publish under my own company Serpentinae. This book is very personal to me and isn't aimed at the mass market. I want to make the book challenging and a work of art itself, so I have to have my little magical hands in all aspects of production. This means that I need your help to make the physical product a reality. I'm hoping to raise at least $6,666 to cover printing cost, taxes, shipping, and fees for these special limited edition volumes.

Stretch Goal Added!

Thanks to your support I hit my initial funding goal within 13 hours! As we near the middle of the campaign, I'm adding a $20,000 Stretch Goal. Lucien Greaves and I are both lifelong musicians and have started collaborating on music and performance over the last few years. If the campaign raises $20,000 before the end of this campaign (October 31st) Lucien and I will send all backers a download of ritual music that we create to accompany this book! This bonus add-on will ONLY be for those who back the The Devil's Tome before the funding phase closes and only if we hit the $20,000 stretch goal.

Perks!

(Artwork by Lex Corey)

We have a collection of perks at various price-levels you can purchase to support the project

Handmade, special-edition ritual incense - $13

A pack of 20 handmade premium incense that I've created especially for this campaign

Handmade, special-edition ritual candle - $33

11-ounce soy blend candle that is handmade and created especially for this campaign.

First edition Hardcover copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual - $50

First edition hardcover copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. This edition is limited to 111 copies and will include an all black pearl linen cloth cover with gold foil detail. Each copy will be signed and hand numbered by Shiva.

First edition Leather copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual - $100

First edition hardcover copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. This edition is limited to 111 copies and will include an all black leather cover with gold foil detail. Each copy will be signed and hand numbered by Shiva

Signed - First edition Hardcover copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual - $100

First edition hardcover copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. Each copy will be signed by Shiva, Lex, and Lucien and hand numbered by Shiva

Signed - First edition Leather copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual - $150

First edition leather copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. Each copy will be signed by Shiva, Lex, and Lucien and hand numbered by Shiva

Lucifer Package - Standard - $200

  • First edition hardcover copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual signed by Lucien, Shiva, and Lex
  • Handmade, special-edition ritual incense
  • Handmade, special-edition ritual candle
  • An exclusive, signed and numbered print by Lex Corey

Lucifer Package - Leather- $250

  • First edition leather copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual signed by Lucien, Shiva, and Lex
  • Handmade, special-edition ritual incense
  • Handmade, special-edition ritual candle
  • An exclusive, signed and numbered print by Lex Corey

Deluxe Ritual Package - $666

You get it all!

  • First edition hardcover copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual signed by Lucien, Shiva, and Lex
  • Exclusive print by Lex Corey- Original ink on Fabriano cold-press paper
  • Tarot Reading by Shiva
  • Shiva creates a custom ritual + ritual products made just for you 

Deluxe Ritual Package - Leather - $666

You get it all!

  • First edition leather copy of The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual signed by Lucien, Shiva, and Lex
  • Exclusive print by Lex Corey- Original ink on Fabriano cold-press paper
  • Tarot Reading by Shiva
  • Shiva creates a custom ritual + ritual products made just for you 

Risks & Challenges

Publishing a book creates its own set of challenges, but I'm ready! I have a successful business I've been running for the last 3 years and a history of hitting deadlines and getting products out on time! I've scheduled the release for March to build in any unanticipated delays and  will keep you up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram with your friends, family (they need to learn more about Satanism, right?), and network. Please use #thedevilstome and tag me (@shiva_honey @serpentinaeofficial) and my collaborators @luciengreaves @lex_corey_art

You can easily share my Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Hail Satan!

-Shiva

story:
Story of My Book

A Dolphin Miracle is a true story about a near-death experience and how it gave me new life. In this book I explain how I died and went to heaven, who I met there, and what happened there that changed me forever.

My name is Carlos Vivas and I am the author of A Dolphin Miracle. I wrote this book because I felt the urgency to share my message with the world. I heard so many testimonials about how my story impacted people, that I realized I don’t want to die with this music inside my heart. It needs to be shared.

Five years ago I had an amazing near-death experience. A dolphin saved my life. Since then, many wonderful things have come into my life, from people to experiences. My life was changed that day.

Since then, many people have heard my story. They’ve contacted me and invited me to share my message. I started sharing my story in big churches, spiritual retreats, seminars, weddings, convention centers, hospitals, hospices, birthday parties, field trips, festivals, and camping trips. I was even invited to participate in podcasts on Instagram broadcasting live to large International Audiences.

After I did my presentations in so many places it was clear to me that my message had some kind of impact on peoples’ lives. In many cases, after I shared my message, the reactions were overwhelming to me. I felt goosebumps all over my body after seeing some people crying and some people just wanted to hug me. Those are the biggest reasons that moved me to write this book. I didn’t know how I was going to do it, but I meditated and prayed about it and I was determined to write my story.

I want to be clear, my message is not about me. It is about all of us - how we all came to this world to live a life with a purpose. I believe that every person is born with special talents and unique gifts that distinguish one from another. My hope is that you will love this book if you been trying to find your life purpose, looking for hope, or working to forgive people from your past.

Ultimately, I hope that A Dolphin Miracle inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue. Here are some of the questions I hope readers will reflect on after reading my book:

  • Are you happy with what you have done in your life, until today, or do you want to change something?
  • Did you know you can start right now changing your future with the actions you are taking?
  • Did you think that we came to this world with nothing and we will leave this world without nothing?
  • How many lives have you affected in a good way?
  • What is the legacy you are leaving behind for this world?
  • How many people have you fed, clothed, or given shelter?

I believe discussing the meaning of life, your life purpose, your legacy, your happiness, forgiveness and much more will change us all for the better. I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.


What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Carlos Vivas loves to help others, both at work and in his personal life. Carlos manages and interacts with over 150 employees everyday in his business and he treats all of his employees as his own family. He always listens and offers advice to anyone on his team who is having a problem. When he isn’t working, Carlos enjoys visiting hospitals, nursing homes and hospices to pray with children, adults and the elderly, anyone who is sick or suffering. Carlos suffered his own loss when his mother died of breast cancer. After that experience, he promised to help other families affected by the same disease. He is also passionate about suicide prevention, feeding the homeless, and helping the US Marine Corps collect and distribute teddy bears through their Toys for Tots program. Carlos is a true friend to many people and charitable causes.

Carlos wrote this book because he believes people are hungry for hope, love, and forgiveness. Carlos lives by the Golden Rule to treat others the way you want to be treated and his passion is to help others when he sees an opportunity to help. With this book, he hopes readers will realize how important it is to forgive the past and continue walking toward the future, His belief is that we all came into this world with a purpose and we need to fulfill that purpose. We need to create our own legacy, a blueprint, that helps transform the lives of others. He wants readers to take control of their own lives and, therefore, bring positive change into the world.

At 14, Carlos battled cancer and won. In 2015, he survived a near-death experience. These trials transformed his perception of life. He realized that human beings come into this world for such a brief time and that this is a time to learn lessons, to love, to laugh, to cry, to experiment and, ultimately, to experience everything life has to offer. This life is a gift.

In his spare time, Carlos loves to spend time in nature. He believes that when we are present in nature we experience Creation firsthand. He will often get in his car, hit the highway and drive for hours to discover new places. He loves to visit waterfalls, climb mountain and swim in the ocean. You can also find him spending time with good friends at music festivals, camping or sitting around a bonfire. He also competes in obstacle races, like the Spartan Race. Plus, Carlos is not just there for his friends, family and colleagues. He is also a friend to animals. He loves dogs and has had a pet Cocker Spaniel and Shih Tzu. He also had a green parrot as a pet. Finally, he absolutely loves Dolphins - the angels that came to his life to illuminate his world.

If you need more information you can reach me at helpfromheaven1@yahoo.com or on social media at

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/groups/1578915005639648/  

Instagram @adolphinmiracle  

Website https://wwwadolphinmiraclecom.zyrosite.com

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ADolphinMiracle and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Carlos Vivas

I wrote this book because I felt the urgency to share my message with the world. I heard so many testimonials about how my story impacted people, that I realized I don’t want to die with this music inside my heart. It needs to be shared.Five years ago I had an amazing near-death experience. A dolphin saved my life. Since then, many wonderful things have come into my life, from people to experiences. My life was changed that day.Since then, many people have heard my story. They’ve contacted me and invited me to share my message. I started sharing my story in big churches, spiritual retreats, seminars, weddings, convention centers, hospitals, hospices, birthday parties, field trips, festivals, and camping trips. I was even invited to participate in podcasts on Instagram broadcasting live to large International Audiences.After I did my presentations in so many places it was clear to me that my message had some kind of impact on peoples’ lives. In many cases, after I shared my message, the reactions were overwhelming to me. I felt goosebumps all over my body after seeing some people crying and some people just wanted to hug me. Those are the biggest reasons that moved me to write this book. Are you happy with what you have done in your life, until today, or do you want to change something?
Did you know you can start right now changing your future with the actions you are taking?
Did you think that we came to this world with nothing and we will leave this world without nothing?
How many lives have you affected in a good way?
What is the legacy you are leaving behind for this world?
How many people have you fed, clothed, or given shelter?

story:
OUR IDEA


ProudBoy Magazine is about giving a voice to the voiceless - and we don't mean the fake victims on the left. ProudBoy, an online magazine formed by the Proud Boys of Gavin McInnes fame, will dedicate its digital pages to absolute and total freedom of speech, hilarious video content and some of the most offensive material you can think of.

 

WHO WE ARE


1) We Are Libertarians


Proud Boys, no matter their political affiliation recognize that the actions of the government should always be carefully limited and that as much responsibility as possible should rest with the people, not with the leaders. 

 

2) We Venerate The Entrepreneur


Proud Boys recognize that the pursuit of personal wealth is a noble pursuit, money is freedom after all. We are not necessarily greedy or selfish, but rather we recognize that the competition provided by a free market is the absolute best way to achieve innovation, better quality of life, and most importantly; the opportunity for any individual to succeed on their own merits rather than the whims of government or other meddlers. 

 

3) We Venerate The Housewife


A woman has the ability to create another life in her body, this is miraculous, if she finds that her purpose in life is the raising of a good, strong family then that is a good thing, not a personal failing on her part. 

 

4) We Are Western Chauvinists


Proud Boys look out at the world and at the state and history of it’s peoples, and recognize that, by every prevailing metric that demarks a great culture, the West is the Best. Western civilization, and by large extent American Civilization, has been the most successful culture in the world because of the fundamental principles of Liberty, Freedom, Meritocracy, and Reason. It is the first culture to be designed purposely for it’s own people with these values in mind and this fact makes it exceptional compared to all others. Proud Boys are unashamed of the culture that created them and resist encroachment on these liberties however they can.

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP 

 

Listen, no one wants to go on the internet to talk their cause up and solicit strangers for support. The fact stands, however, that the only people in this world who can do nothing and still receive other people’s money are in the government, and our feelings for them should be clear at this point. If you like what we’re saying and what we’re about then please, anything that you can personally do to contribute would mean a lot. We need Proud Boys (and Proud Boys Girls) of all professions and backgrounds to help out with the day-to-day operations that come along with establishing a new media presence and we welcome everyone to join the discussion and see how and where they can contribute. That being said, there are also running costs associated with all of these things, and if you’re a scuba instructor or have a set of skills that doesn’t necessarily lend itself to digital media content, then monetary contributions to the cause will never be turned away. 

Uhuru! 
Proud Of Your Boy

story:
¿Qué?

El timón del Sur es una historia de aventuras con piratas, tesoros... y un amuleto muy especial.

La vida de Maider se desmorona como un castillo de naipes. En un naufragio pierde a su madre y su padre entra en una profunda depresión. Ante tanta adversidad, Maider inicia una aventura donde gracias a su inteligencia y fe reescribirá el libro del destino. Todo comenzará cuando le entreguen el Timón del Sur, un extraño amuleto que le abrirá las puertas de un mundo bárbaro y fascinante. Conoce la historia de una chica que consigue dominar las fuerzas que rigen el cosmos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a J.M. Pérez Chaf.

Se licenció en Filología Románica mientras leía tebeos de Asterix y de los X-men, o mezclaba a Stevenson con Lovecraft en cócteles muy fríos que bebía a la luz de la luna. Con el tiempo le dio por crear Repámpanos, un blog donde habla de lo humano y lo divino, donde publica cuentos de caballeros andantes con el flequillo flojo o dandis con acidez de estómago. Desde su púlpito disecciona con humor la realidad de nuestro mundo, y a partir de ahora, también la de otros mundos.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El timón del Sur que saldría semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y J.M. Pérez Chaf vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Overview

I have reached my goal of $6000 to publish Rose's Locket! 

I am keeping this campaign open for all the procrastinators, forgetful folk, or people just waiting on one more paycheck until Wednesday August 19 just to make sure that everybody who wants to pre-order has ample opportunity to do. It's been a heck of a year, and I just want to pass on a little grace, and I'm a procrastinator myself who thoroughly appreciates extended deadlines :)  

All the funds raised beyond my goal of $6000 will be donated to local teachers in my city, Denton, TX, and pay for the construction of a little free library on my property for my neighborhood and community to enjoy. 

Thank you so much for your support and love! 

 

Story of My Book

My book, Rose’s Locket, is about an eighteen-year-old girl who receives startling new information about her adoption and must figure out how to deal with the remaining gaps. She goes on a journey to find answers and pens her own version of her family history along the way.

My name is Shannon Quist and I am the author of Rose’s Locket. I wrote this book because, like the main character Izzie, I spent a great deal of my teen years and beyond contemplating my identity and where I might belong in the world because of both known and unknown details of my adoption. I was adopted as a baby in the state of Texas through a Methodist mission home, but didn’t know the specific details about my adoption until I was much older and found documentation my parents had filed away.

After birthing my own daughter, going through a divorce, and being asked to help with a research project concerning the rhetoric around adoptions in Texas, I finally realized that it was time to look into this part of me and contemplate how being adopted has affected my life.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the power you can stand to gain if you’re brave enough to create the self you want to be. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside Izzie the importance of what it means to take control of your life’s story, especially in the face of the unexpected and sometimes incomprehensible turns of life.

The Story: On her eighteenth birthday, Izzie’s parents show her documents about her adoption she hasn’t seen before. With her boyfriend, a full tank of gas, a notebook, and a pen, she sets out on a journey to find her birthmother and the answers she feels will help her figure out who she is and where she belongs. As she grapples with what she finds, she turns inward to pen a fictional story to fill in the gaps of her own family narrative. The story that she writes is an attempt to reconcile the disappointment of seeking answers and not finding enough, but it’s also a joyful historical imagining of how stories pass down through generations. She begins with a baby named Rose and follows the winding and whimsical lives of these imagined ancestors.

You’ll love this book if you love the nostalgic tone of the late 2000s, winding summer road trips, magic unicorns, or stories about coming of age. Rose’s Locket speaks to young adults looking to define themselves and adopted people who want to grapple with the sometimes gaping lack of answers and existential thought in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Rose’s Locket inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Who am I and how do I define myself?
  • How can adopted children find greater meaning in their relationships, both biological and adoptive?
  • With the trend towards more open adoptions, DNA tests, and instant gratification, how can we grapple with questions we still might never have the answers to?
     

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing our family histories can affect our trajectories, but will change us all for the better.

 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy and Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
     

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.
 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements section of my book.
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my book cover
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book

 

About the Author

Having graduated with her Bachelor’s in English literature from Texas Woman’s University, Shannon Quist is a technical writer at Alkami Technology. Her work, including poetry, non-fiction, and journalism, has been published in The Daedalion, Gaillardia, The Lasso, and the Dallas ZooHoo! blog.

She believes that by writing this book and contributing to larger conversations about adoption, she can inspire people in all walks of life to contemplate both the power of storytelling and the importance of being the person with the pen. By writing about her experiences, she has regained control over a story that didn’t feel like her own. Instead of looking towards nature and nurture for answers about who she ought to be, Shannon decided to create the identity she wanted for herself.

Shannon hails from Perryton, TX, but she and her daughter, Emery, call Denton, TX home. She enjoys road trips, annoying her friends with phone calls, and writing poetry in the middle of the night.

For more information, you can connect with Shannon by following her on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, or visiting her website.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
 

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #RosesLocketNovel and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
     

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Shannon
