She goes on a journey to find answers and pens her own version of her family history along the way.My name is Shannon Quist and I am the author of Rose’s Locket. I wrote this book because, like the main character Izzie, I spent a great deal of my teen years and beyond contemplating my identity and where I might belong in the world because of both known and unknown details of my adoption. I was adopted as a baby in the state of Texas through a Methodist mission home, but didn’t know the specific details about my adoption until I was much older and found documentation my parents had filed away.After birthing my own daughter, going through a divorce, and being asked to help with a research project concerning the rhetoric around adoptions in Texas, I finally realized that it was time to look into this part of me and contemplate how being adopted has affected my life.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the power you can stand to gain if you’re brave enough to create the self you want to be. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside Izzie the importance of what it means to take control of your life’s story, especially in the face of the unexpected and sometimes incomprehensible turns of life.The Story: On her eighteenth birthday, Izzie’s parents show her documents about her adoption she hasn’t seen before. With her boyfriend, a full tank of gas, a notebook, and a pen, she sets out on a journey to find her birthmother and the answers she feels will help her figure out who she is and where she belongs. As she grapples with what she finds, she turns inward to pen a fictional story to fill in the gaps of her own family narrative. The story that she writes is an attempt to reconcile the disappointment of seeking answers and not finding enough, but it’s also a joyful historical imagining of how stories pass down through generations. She begins with a baby named Rose and follows the winding and whimsical lives of these imagined ancestors.You’ll love this book if you love the nostalgic tone of the late 2000s, winding summer road trips, magic unicorns, or stories about coming of age. Rose’s Locket speaks to young adults looking to define themselves and adopted people who want to grapple with the sometimes gaping lack of answers and existential thought in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that Rose’s Locket inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Who am I and how do I define myself?
How can adopted children find greater meaning in their relationships, both biological and adoptive?
With the trend towards more open adoptions, DNA tests, and instant gratification, how can we grapple with questions we still might never have the answers to? 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing our family histories can affect our trajectories, but will change us all for the better.
 

What I Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
The Cover Design of my book - the mock-ups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy and Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook. 
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements section of my book.
Early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my book cover
A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book

 

About the Author
Having graduated with her Bachelor’s in English literature from Texas Woman’s University, Shannon Quist is a technical writer at Alkami Technology. Her work, including poetry, non-fiction, and journalism, has been published in The Daedalion, Gaillardia, The Lasso, and the Dallas ZooHoo! blog.She believes that by writing this book and contributing to larger conversations about adoption, she can inspire people in all walks of life to contemplate both the power of storytelling and the importance of being the person with the pen. By writing about her experiences, she has regained control over a story that didn’t feel like her own. Instead of looking towards nature and nurture for answers about who she ought to be, Shannon decided to create the identity she wanted for herself.Shannon hails from Perryton, TX, but she and her daughter, Emery, call Denton, TX home. She enjoys road trips, annoying her friends with phone calls, and writing poetry in the middle of the night.For more information, you can connect with Shannon by following her on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, or visiting her website. 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #RosesLocketNovel and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media. 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Shannon

story:
THE BOOK

For the Lives of All Women/Pela Vida das Mulheres is a collection of photographs and interviews by Camila Cavalcante to be published by Break the Habit Press. For over two years Camila travelled around Brazil meeting women who have had, or who have been witnesses to, illegal abortions. She photographed a total of fifty women who, with their identities protected, shared their stories and intensified the debate for women’s reproductive rights. You can see some of Camila's images of this project here.

The title was inspired by the chant that people took to the streets to fight for women’s rights in Brazil and all over the world. It will be a bilingual book with the most powerful images of Cavalcante’s project, as well as interviews with the collaborators and essays from activists and experts.

In this book, Camila uses the naked female form to challenge the dangerous reproductive laws of Brazil. She exposes her body and her identity on behalf of these women in an act of dissent and solidarity for all, making her collection of portraits both deeply personal and deeply political.

For the Lives of All Women/ Pela Vida das Mulheres book cover

 

WHY IT’S IMPORTANT

Access to safe abortion is a human rights issue and until this is resolved we will continue to fight for it. In Brazil abortion is only legal to save a woman’s life, in cases of a foetus without a brain and in cases of rape. Despite this law, one in five women between 14 and 40 years old have had at least one abortion in their life. If prosecuted, these women can go to prison for up to three years.

Similar laws affects 125 countries, nearly 40% of the world’s population. That includes Northern Ireland, where the legislation, as it stands, only allows abortion if a woman's life is at risk or if there is a permanent or serious risk to her mental or physical health.

The far-right is gaining power across the world and it is women and other vulnerable groups that will be affected most by this. We have to come together and fight for what we believe to be right. At a time in which fake news is on the rise and people are closing their minds to data and facts, we need to use all possible tools to create empathy and help break the stereotypes that are associated with women who seek abortions.

Within this context For the Lives of All Women is an act of rebellion in itself.

Us For All Women in 2017-4: “My choices were either to have a baby alone again while he would be a father when it’s convenient, because he was not ready to change his life style, or not to have a baby. But what I wanted was to have a baby with him.”

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

One year ago Camila created her first crowd-funding here on Indiegogo for her project Us For All Women/Nós Por Todas. It was an amazing way to fund her research and travels in Brazil and legitimise her work and activism while continuing to develop her art. Break the Habit Press and Camila now want to create this book as a legacy for the project and the cause.

Even though Us For All Women is artistically completed, creating a photography book is very expensive. All of the money raised will go to the cost of printing the book on high quality paper and making it the most beautiful book it can be. Break the Habit Press is a new start-up and so needs help funding this.

We need £4,500 to make a basic photography book. Any money over the target will go on making the book even better. If we have lots of extra money, this will go towards the book launch on March 8th, International Women’s Day 2019. We plan to have a Q&A with Camila, an exhibition and a panel discussion. 

 

Us For All Women in 2001-2: “You cannot go through this unscathed. It’s about responsibility, but not only our own, it’s society’s responsibility. We empower ourselves to demand the right for a choice, but this is something that needs to be discussed collectively. It cannot be something exclusively ours anymore. There’s too much pain, too much sadness.”

 

HOW YOU CAN SUPPORT US

Apart from backing the project financially, what would be unbelievably helpful is if you shout about it everywhere! It is really important that we talk about this subject and that we help women who need our support. Please tell all your friends, family, colleagues and social media followers about the book and its importance. Or if you just needs someone to talk to about this, drop a line to Camila; she would be happy to hear from you.
 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We are working really hard to make this book happen. All of the photographs and interviews are completed and most of the content translated. The only thing we need now is the cash to fund it. Without your help, this book will not be possible. As this is an ‘all or nothing’ campaign, if we do not reach our goal, you will get your money back at the end and we will not print the book. What a shame that would be!

 

ABOUT CAMILA

Camila Cavalcante is a visual artist from the north-east coast of Brazil, currently settled in the UK. She holds a Masters of the Arts degree from University of Westminster and works for the London School of Photography. Camila was awarded two photography national prizes in her home country and has taken part in over 30 exhibitions and three art residencies in Brazil, the US, Mexico and the UK.

 

ABOUT THE PUBLISHER

Break the Habit Press are a feminist publisher creating books around social issues and covering topics that need to be challenged. They are dedicated to pushing for change through literature and events.

Their first book was 100 Women I Know, a collection of accounts of rape and sexual assault. Thirty percent of money received from book sales will go towards funding educational workshops in schools.

Their second book was Period. by Natalie Byrne and covers everything you need to know about periods. Ten percent of profits goes to Bloody Good Period, an organisation providing menstrual supplies to asylum seekers, refugees and those who can’t afford them.

The tote bags of the project come in black or light green

 

You can choose the size and fit of you t-shirt

story:
Hello! 

I'm Tommy Moore, a lifelong martial artist and teacher of Bartitsu. I've been wanting to make a Bartitsu book for a very long time to help people get started. And lockdown has helped me do just that!

But self publishing is expensive and challenging. And if you can help me get the project over the line, it'll help a) give you a really cool book b) allow me to give something back to the martial arts world. 

The book will be circa 150 pages, with full colour photography, perfect bound, professionally, edited and photographed and designed by pro designer Andrew Porter

In short, it'll be the business. Photographs on pretty much every page. Detailed annotations. Top tips and practical executions. It's designed to be a "pick up and go" guide for Bartitsu, allowing beginners to experience how I teach the art and experienced martial artists set up or enhance what they do at their club. 

The book covers:

  • Pugilism
  • Savate
  • Ju Jitsu 
  • Weapons (Cane, Street Weapons and Incidental)
  • Integrated Bartitsu (bringing the above together)

 

Get a flavour of what I do:

  • https://www.facebook.com/TheBartitsuLab
  • https://www.youtube.com/user/Tommysdf

 

I have self funded much of the work, but I need help to make it viable for print.

I'm known for making huge amounts of my content free. Teaching seminars and publishing videos. Often for free or just for the fuel and mars bars I need to get there! 

I have a normal job. I have a normal life. But Bartitsu, unarmed HEMA and self defence in general are my passions. And I want to be able to share those passions with you. 

Bartitsu is the "Open Source" martial art, but right now, no useful modern guides exist. I want that to change! 

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I'll need £2,500 to get the books printed in the right volumes to meet demand and help me cover the cost of making it:

  • £30 will get you a signed (if you wish) copy of the book
  • £45 will add a Bartitsu Lab Monkey Fist self defence keyring 
  • £75 will add a Bartitsu Lab t shirt 
  • £100 will add a personal 20 minute video that would cover any topic of your choosing 
  • £150 will include a virtual training session of 45 minutes 
  • £300 will add a private 90 minute lesson with me coming to you to help on any specific area you wish to cover (UK only)

 

 

The Impact

HEMA, Self Defence and Martial arts have changed my life. They bring me safety, happiness and the ability to meet amazing people. The martial arts are (for me) all about giving back. What you learn, you share. And only in that way do arts and people grow. By contributing you help:

Share one of the world's rarest arts with people

Help provide self defence content that keeps people safe 

Brings the world of HEMA, self defence and martial arts  

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The book is expensive. I get it. 

But it takes a long time to write, and I'm having it professionally designed, photographed, edited. 

It will be, I guarantee, one of the best Martial Arts books you'll ever buy. 

And unlike many books on the arts. I don't waffle. The guide is a manual. 

A tough, no nonsense guide that I want you to play with. Balance tea on. Scribble notes in. 

It's a workbook for your own Bartitsu or Martial Arts journey. 

So if you can buy it, Thank you so much. 

If you can't, or can't right now - that's okay too. Please enjoy my videos and other free content. 

But if you can, please share this page so that others may see it. It helps so much!

Thank you so so much. 

 

Tommy Moore
The Bartitsu Lab

story:
What is 'The Good Vibe'?

I've been asking myself that question for three and a half years now. I actually recently made a full circle to that title as I've contemplated what name could embody this story.

My name is Levi Himes, I'm now 26 years old and living in Denver, Colorado. I grew up in Indiana and went to school in Illinois. Back in 2016 I graduated college, packed up my car, and started driving. I had a few destinations in mind, but for the most part I was making it up day by day.

I went all the way from Indiana to the Pacific Ocean, not directly, but that's where I ended up. I bounced around to national parks and friend's houses. I spent a lot of time thinking and a lot of days hiking. I was meeting new people and arguing with myself when I failed to embrace social opportunities. Either way I was growing for the better.

During that trip I wrote extensively about what I was up to, either in my blog online or in the journal that I kept with me. Since then I have combined the two, I've supplementing them with my memories and thoughts I have about that time traveling.

The story has reached a point where it is nearly ready to become an actual book. I am ready to put into motion the process of self publishing, which is what this campaign is all about. I need your help in getting me to the point where I can hand over this story to the public, and publish my first ever book.

What is needed to self-publish a book?

I am planning to publish my book via a company called Book Baby. They are a facilitator of sorts for all the finalizing and preparation work that is needed to pull this whole thing together.

Below I have broken down my goals regarding what I financially need:

-*Professional Final Edit $700.00

-Self-Publishing Packages:

Complete $1790.00

**Deluxe $2290.00

-Bulk Book Printing:

***250 Books $1104.00

500 Books $1864.00

1000 Books $3289.00

 

*The final edit will be the last review of my complete manuscript. Thus nothing else can happen until that edit is complete. Once it is done, I will review my manuscript and alter anything that I feel necessary. Once this step is done, I can proceed with formatting and printing.

**The deluxe self-publishing package contains all that the Complete package offers, but it also provides extensive marketing resources for my final book once it is published. Both packages include an initial printing of 25 soft cover books, the designing of a cover, the internal formatting (page/text design), opportunity for printing on demand, which lessens the future need for bulk printing of large quantities of the book, and finally two ISBN numbers which will be needed for soft/hard cover, and eBooks.

***I am aiming to print 250 initial books for distribution to sellers. I wanted to provide a price point for further bulk printing, depending on what financial goals I may or may not reach. 

 

I've been writing for as long as I can remember, be it short stories I was mustering up in elementary school, or endless letters I was sending anyone and everyone in college. The idea of creative writing has always enthralled me, and now I have transitioned into a storytelling mindset. I travel and explore the farthest places I can find. I long to see the hard to reach destinations and to view the unseen. Thus I have a lot of stories about the places I have been. So this is my first big step in sharing some of these stories with the my friends, my family, and the general public.

Thank you for hearing me out, and taking the time to read through the details of what this whole campaign is about.

I am so excited to finally be at this point; turning my writings into a legitimate book. It has been a long time since I first considered turning my writings into a book, and so much time and effort has been put into turning this into something I believe is a story worth telling.

Let's do this.

story:
Old Mother Frost

Old Mother Frost is a children's Yuletide story based on tales of an ancient Norse goddess said to be older than Odin himself! She is older than the oldest Christmas story; and her role is to make sure children are happy, healthy and festive during the coldest and darkest time of year (the 12 days of Yule).

As a Canadian-born unto a Swedish heritage, my childhood was full of exciting tales and traditions from my Mom’s country. I grew up with different celebrations and holidays that were married into the western customs. For Christmas, I celebrated Yule for nearly an entire month, baked traditional Swedish treats, and took part in a couple Santa Lucia concerts; and I also had Christmas and Santa.

When I grew up I married a Canadian man from a German heritage, and together we had our Canadian-born son who we wish to raise with Swedish and German traditions.

Living in Canada, I found it difficult to find English books on tales we grew up with; and I wanted my son to know origins of Canadian traditions can be traced back to the areas his ancestors originated.

I decided to take matters into my own hands, and I began researching and writing my first children’s book, Old Mother Frost - a Yuletide story based on tales of a deity said to have inspired the stories of Santa Claus (I leave all mention of Christmas and Santa out of the story).

Perks

If you pre-order from Indiegogo, you will get your book before it is available anywhere else. 

This will also insure you get your book before Yuletide starts!

If this pre-launch is successful, the funding will go toward the cost of creating a second book in the Pagan Kids series; then a third; and then a fourth.

Hopefully this means you will have the opportunity to get an Ostara book by next spring. 

What We Need & What You Get

At this point contributions of the purchase of a perk will go directly to your advanced copy of  Old Mother Frost, packaging and shipping.  This means you will get your copy of Old Mother Frost before anyone sees it anywhere else!

Pledging over $15 + shipping will go to support the cost of a second book. Each book requires an investment of $2500 to licence, illustrate, edit, format and publish; however, if you hope to get two books message me directly and I will make sure you save a bit on shipping costs. 

Risks & Challenges

There are essentially no risks at this point in the project.

Old Mother Frost 90% ready. The manuscript, editing, illustrations and licences are complete.
I am currently working with a formatter to get the book ready for print. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to support my book please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. The pagan community is small but mighty, and we need to get more of these books out and into the hands of the world

Indiegogo has some great sharing tools to help with this process!

story:
Hi! I'm Sofia Rose. I am a queer, woman of color writer in Los Angeles, and I am raising funds to attend Voices of Our Nations (VONA) - a writer's retreat for writers of color, to be held in Berkeley, CA from June 24-30, 2012. I'm very honored to have been selected to attend this retreat with so many talented writers. Lives are changed here.

As a fierce poet, my goals are: to tell untold stories; to liberate and heal my communities; to give hope; to empower queer people, folks of color, the world (and myself!); and to bring people who will read my work to life in the ways reading yourself on the page can. My next project is a chapbook of poetry & prose. At VONA, I will begin my memoir. But I need your help!

I need to raise $1,600 to cover the cost of tuition, housing, food ($1,450), and airfare/travel to & from VONA ($150). So, I'm turning to my strongest supporters to ask for contributions! In exchange, I am offering: Thank You Postcards w a Sofia Rose Poem, a signed copy of my forthcoming chapbook, a customized personal massage (by the amazing Katherine Fink!), and even The Flying Unicycle: A Queer Adventurestory (by Oliver Bendorf and Selena Simmons-Duffin)!

By donating to this cause, you are stoking a ceremonial fire within me, a poet's fire, like medicine for the wounded, like salve for the souls aching to read stories and poems that represent their lives. Your contribution will help me embrace my creative gifts, and I hope that by reading my writing, I can further support the growth of young poets everywhere.

I hope you as family, friends, lovely strangers, & community can assist me in tending this fire within - so that I might carry it brightly into the world. 

Every dollar matters, thank you so much for loving & supporting me!

You can also support me by getting the word out, by sharing this link on your Facebook wall, or through email, and by making some noise on my behalf! Definitely use those Indiegogo share tools.


Love,

Sofia Rose Smith

story:
Thank You For Visiting!

As some of you know, I have been the owner/operator of a Painting Franchise for the last 3 years. I have donated a small portion of money from every job I have produced to the MS Society of Canada. On top of that,  I have participated in the past 3 annual MS Walks in West Vancouver and I have also accepted donations through several of my clients. We also paint a home for a homeowner with MS every year for free!

This will be my 4th year with the company and I want to step up my game and really try to make a difference. 

Why the MS society needs our help:

- We still do not know exactly what causes MS.

- There is no known cure for multiple sclerosis.

- Plain and simple, there needs to be more research and support for MS victims.

The Benfit Of Donating:

If you donate through me, Eric Banerd, our company will match your donation! This means you are actually giving double what you donated! You will get a tax credit receipt when you donate as well.

Indiegogo's maximum length of a donation website is 120 days. So, my goal for this 120 days is $1000.

However, my overall goal for 2013 is $5000. I plan on reaching $2000 through friends and family and $3000 through my clients.

Please check out the website to see where your money is going!

http://mssociety.ca/

Please Donate!

Here is a link to my painting page on facebook if you'd like to check out some before and after pictures!

https://www.facebook.com/groups/399484776800057/

 

Thanks!!

story:
The Widows of Manipur   

     With your help, I would like to spend the next few months travelling in Manipur to collect and share the stories of the women who were widowed as a result of the unlawful and brutal campaign of the Indian army, paramilitary forces, and state police against the Manipuri people.  The resulting articles and documentation will be used to spread awareness about the plight of the Manipuri people and to challenge the Indian government's policy in the area. 

Summary    

     I am a human rights lawyer from New York, who has spent the last year and a half working in India.  My previous project focused on the extra-judicial killings and disappearances of innocent civilians at the hands of the army and police personnel in India's high-conflict areas, including Kashmir, Chhattisgarh, and Assam.  

     During the course of my research, I had the good fortune of spending time in the northeast state of Manipur, where I met an extraordinary group of women: a collection of widows and mothers of people killed by the Indian army and paramilitary forces.  These women have suffered enormous losses.  Yet - and in the face of great economic, political, and social instability - these women are attempting to create small businesses, while providing each other and their children with a safe, emotionally supportive environment.  Some of their efforts fail. But some succeed.  I would love the opportunity to write about these efforts and share the stories of these wonderful women.  Any financial help you can provide towards this end will be much appreciated.


Background

     Manipur is one of eight states that make up India’s Northeast territories. Tethered to mainland India by the narrow Siliguri Corridor, only between 21 to 40 kilometers wide, the Northeast region was not part of historical India. Manipur was an independent kingdom able to trace its history to 33 A.D., and it shared closer linguistic and cultural ties with its neighbors to the east.  Even after it was conquered by the British in the nineteenth century, Manipur remained a separate administrative unit with its own king and legal system. However, after a series of political maneuverings, in 1949, India forcibly annexed Manipur.

      When Manipuri groups attempted to dispute the legality of the annexation agreement, India responded by using brute military force to counter any aspirations for independence.  Declaring Manipur and much of the Northeast a “disturbed area,” the government used the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) -- initially a colonial ordinance used by the British to suppress Indian calls for self-rule -- to suppress Manipuri desires for the same.  The initial liberation struggle to restore Manipur’s sovereign independence and the massive, and disproportionate, counterinsurgency measures by the Indian government resulted in a state of armed conflict that lasted decades. 

      The insurgency was at its height in the 1980s and 90s, but has since been effectively quashed.  For all intents and purposes, the people of Manipur are integrated into the Indian political system.  But even though much of Manipur’s insurgency has been brought under control, Delhi continues to maintain Manipur’s status as a troubled territory, and the Indian army remains in the state.  Overt racism by the predominantly Hindi-speaking speaking security forces goes unchecked.  Thousands of Manipuri people have been murdered.  Yet more have been disappeared while in state custody.  Rapes of Manipuri women by Indian security forces have been all too common.

           

(Human Rights Watch photo of women protesting the brutal rape and killing of Manaroma Devi.  On 11 July 2004, 32-year-old Manorama was arrested by members of the Assam Rifles, a paramilitary force initially created by the British colonial government to suppress dissent against British interests.  The Rifles claimed that Manorama was a member of the separatist People’s Liberation Army.   The next morning, some villagers discovered her dead, bullet-ridden body in a field not far from her home.  The police surgeon and forensics specialist noted that the shots were fired at close range and that Manorama would have been lying down when she was shot. She was certainly not trying to escape, as claimed by the Rifles.  Her body bore a number of marks and bruises indicating that Manorama had been tortured before she was killed.  Most troubling, a report from the Central Forensic Science Laboratory found semen stains on Manorama’s skirt suggesting that she may have been raped before her death.  The rape could not be confirmed, however, because there were multiple gunshot wounds in her vagina.)

      Moreover, decades of military occupation and isolation have resulted in a severely distressed economy, an inadequate infrastructure, destabilized social norms, and weak public institutions.  Unemployment is significantly higher in Manipur than in the rest of India; hardest hit are those living in urban areas.  The state’s public educational system is severely underfunded and is one of the worst in India.  Teacher absentee rates in primary schools are at 24.8%.  Many Manipuris have expressed concerns that the public education system leaves young people unprepared to compete for jobs in mainland India.  Drug abuse is rampant: 42% of addicts are 15 years old or younger.

      The militarization of Manipur has had a deep effect on Manipuri society.  Afraid of being considered anti-national, people in Manipur are afraid to speak freely.  Harassment of businesspeople at Manipur’s many checkpoints has had a chilling effect on economic growth.  The racialized interactions between army officials who are predominantly from mainland India and the people of Manipur have added to the distrust people have for the central government.  The degree of violence in Manipur has been astounding.  And the Indian government’s unwillingness to acknowledge the extent of army abuses is deeply troubling. 

          

(Photo from Outlook India)

      On 4 March 2009, twelve-year-old Azad Khan was murdered.  Security personnel dragged Azad from his home, shot him in a nearby paddy field and then, according to multiple witnesses, planted a gun on Azad’s body to make it appear as if he was killed in an “encounter,” a euphemism used throughout South Asia to describe instances in which the police, paramilitary groups, or armed forces claim to have shot and killed suspected criminals and terrorists in self-defense.  

     After years of judicial inaction, the Supreme Court finally appointed an independent commission to evaluate Azad’s case.  The commission, noting that, “[i]t is extremely difficult to believe that nearly 20 trained security personnel equipped with sophisticated weapons...could not have overpowered or disabled the victim,” found that the killing of Azad Khan was unlawful. Azad's case is still pending before the Supreme Court.  

          

(photo from The Hindu)

Vignettes

        Over the next few months, I would like to travel to Manipur to interview families of people who were killed or disappeared by the army.  The widows and children of these individuals suffer not only emotionally from the loss of their loved ones, but they also face severe economic and cultural consequences as well.  In Manipur, some of the women have banded together in an attempt to start businesses and provide emotional support for each other.  They are surprisingly forthcoming about the successes and failures of their efforts.  I would like to start first by writing some journalistic pieces about their lives.  Some close (and well-connected) photojournalist friends have also expressed interest in collaborating with me if we can raise money for travel costs.  I have also been in touch with several documentary filmmakers, who are potentially interested in telling the stories of these women. 

     The articles I will write will feature the story of women like Leena (name changed for fund-raising purposes, but we will be using her actual name when her full story is written and published).  Leena’s husband was a drug addict, an altogether too common problem in Manipur where there are few jobs, and where the army profits enormously from drug trade with Burma.  Leena found out that her husband was killed on the news.  As a widow, she was harassed for not wearing appropriate mourning clothes, and for trying to find work to support her two minor children.  She receives no psychological or financial support from the government.  She told me, “my eldest son knows that his father is dead, but my younger son is just becoming aware. I worry he will become like other children who say that they will kill the person who killed their father. So many children of those that are killed become dropouts.”  Her hardships are many, but she is also extraordinary in her willingness to be more than her struggles. She works actively to support other widows.  And she has become a tireless advocate for the repeal of AFSPA (the Armed Forces Special Powers Act).

     Another woman whom I want to profile lost her 34-year-old son to an extrajudicial murder.  She had to watch as her unarmed son was shot, at point-blank-range by Manipur Police Commandos.  Officers then planted a gun and a bundle of money by the body, and claimed that he was killed in self-defense.  After years of litigation, the government finally acknowledged a few years ago that this was a fake, or staged encounter, (in other words, they acknowledged that evidence had been planted on the body), and they awarded the family 6 lakh rupees (about $9,500).  The family has not yet received the money.  The victim’s mother lives in a rural area, and despite speaking neither Hindi nor English, she manages to regularly travel and advocate on behalf of other mothers like her.

How You Can Help

     I have been really fortunate to meet such extraordinary women in Manipur, and I really would love the opportunity to document and share their stories with a wider audience.  I am also working with human rights organizations in the state to use this work towards efforts to repeal the draconian laws that permit the army to act with such impunity.

      Because Manipur is so isolated, travel can be expensive.  I am asking for $7,500 to help cover travel expenses to and from the state as well as travel within the state.  Money will also go towards accommodations, and living expenses for the next few months for me and for the photographers that I will be working with.  Everyone who contributes will be kept in the loop via blog posts and emails about our progress.

story:
About 900 visitors and growing! Thank you all!

 


Image on the left - I just arrived at Yuksom, on the right, me riding a Yak near Tsango (9000ft) lake.

About Me

Hello, my name is Somdeep, friends call me Som (apparently its some sort of fish in Polish, but my parents had no idea, they chose the name because in Sanskrit it means ‘moonlight’). I am a celebrity and fashion photographer. I have a photography business near West London, UK and a studio in Kolkata, India, as well. You may have seen my work in magazines and publications. My portrait work of stars including Jude Law, Sir Patrick Stewart, Angelina Jolie, Gillian Anderson (X-Files fame), Devina McDougal (UK celebrity) - among others, are well published. To know more about my work, have a look at my website: lens-world.co.uk and my facebook pages:Profile and  Kolkata Fan Page

 

The campaign

The adventures themselves are only half the fun, the rest is to share the pictures and stories with others. The mystery of the hidden valleys, the magnificence of the highest ranges of the world, the unique blend of culture, the peace and tranquillity of the little villages and towns and the picturesque landscape in-between is perhaps unique in the world. For years I have been documenting spectacular scenes. Now I want to self-publish the book to share my pictures and adventures with the world.

Your contribution will help me pay for the cost of design, print and publish the book. I don’t have plans to mass produce; my target is to print only 300 books (200 in 8” X 8” and 100 in leather bound 11” X 11”).

I offer various funding options through which you can support my project. The rewards vary from a desktop wallpapers, e-books, prints of various sizes to pre-ordered books – one is 8” X 8” size hard cover with laminated jacket, the other being limited edition 11” X 11” handcrafted leather bound book with brass corners. I want my contributors to feel special, that’s why I am printing only a limited amount of books.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word among your friends and families and social networks to help me raise the funds. In return you will get free gifts from me (proportionate to the amount raised).

Free mobile wallpapers for you to celebrate Happy Holidays, to get one click Here

Please note that:
1) I have made a conservative estimate for the postal dispatches to reach you, since they will be sent from India, and Indian post takes a bit of time to reach you (often 20-25 days).

2) Even if the campaign does not get the full funding, you need not worry, all your perks will be sent as promised. 

 

Wild flower

Village in the clouds.

Left, hunting darts, probably the biggest in the world, are quite popular among the Bhutanese for hunting and sports. These are quite deadly with spikes of more than 4 inches (10cm) or more. Right, my Bhutanese guide in his National dress. I am told the color of stripes varies from tribe to tribe.

story:
Bref résumé

«Vers le Pays de Canaan», c'est plus de trois ans de travail acharné et d'exploration poétique.

Mais c'est beaucoup plus que ça. «Vers le Pays de Canaan» constitue la mise en mots d'une récente période trouble dans ma vie, pendant laquelle j'ai vécu une grande remise en questions, tant sur le plan personnel que professionnel et même spirituel. J'ai tapé le fonds, comme on dit en bon français. Je ne pouvais alors que remonter.

Mon recueil parle donc de ce chemin sinueux que j'ai parcouru, au bout duquel j'ai finalement vu la lumière. Un parcours comme une ultime prière à Dieu où tout est sur la table, sans cachettes, sans artifices.

C'est donc une mise à nu dans pudeur et littéralement une partie intime de moi que je veux vous offrir avec joie et gratitude par le biais de la publication prochaine de mon recueil «Vers le Pays de Canaan».

Mon recueil de poésie sera publié aux Éditions Carte Blanche, une maison d'éditions montréalaise qui combine l'édition à compte d'auteur et le travail éditorial (correction, suivi d'édition, promotion...). C'est pourquoi j'ai besoin de votre votre coup de pouce!


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Mon objectif financier est de 4000 $. Ce montant servira à défrayer les coûts du premier tirage de mon recueil, fixé à 300 exemplaires, ainsi que les frais afférents associés à mes lancements (à Caraquet en juin et à Chicoutimi cet automne):

- Avec toute contribution volontaire, vous recevrez par courriel une lettre de remerciements dûment signée de ma plume;

- Avec tout don de 20 $ à 40 $, vous recevrez par la poste ou le jour du lancement, un exemplaire du recueil que je vous dédicacerai, ainsi qu'une invitation à mon lancement à Caraquet ou à Chicoutimi (dont les dates sont encore à déterminer);

- *Avec tout don de 40 $ ou plus, vous recevrez, en plus d'un exemplaire du livre dédicacé par la poste, la version PDF de mon recueil par courriel ainsi que trois extraits vidéos de «Vers le Pays de Canaan» lus par moi que je vous enverrai également par courriel dans les semaines suivant le lancement à Caraquet.

*Note: pour tout don corporatif de 40 $ ou plus, je suis ouvert à vous remettre plus d'un exemplaire de mon recueil, après entente individuelle et selon le montant décerné.

Afin de recevoir ledit exemplaire papier ainsi que l'invitation au lancement, la version PDF et les vidéos, prière de m'envoyer vos coordonnées – qui demeureront totalement confidentielles – par courriel à martinroy.perso@gmail.com.


L'impact

Mon projet de recueil de poésie «Vers le Pays de Canaan» m'est particulièrement précieux.

Je caresse depuis longtemps le désir de me dire avec mes mots par le biais d'une poésie que j'estime être mienne. Je noircis des cahiers depuis plus de 15 ans et j'ai enfin le sentiment d'avoir trouvé ma voie – et ma voix – sur le plan littéraire.

Cette voix plumée ne demande qu'à se faire entendre, sous votre regard d'abord, puis avec mes cordes vocales, lorsque je participerai à divers événements littéraires et poétiques.

Cette voix de l'intime que je veux vous partager avec douceur et affection, à travers laquelle vous apprendrez à connaître une partie de l'homme que je suis au-delà de la personne publique que vous connaissez peut-être, notamment par le truchement du journal «L'Acadie Nouvelle», pour lequel je suis à l'emploi depuis bientôt 12 ans.

Cette voix à la fois profondément humaine et profondément spirituelle qui se veut adogmatique, mais néanmoins sans ambiguité concernant ma foi dont la marche est parsemée de plusieurs embûches. Je crois cependant que les croyants comme les non-croyants se retrouveront dans mon recueil, car au-delà de ma quête spirituelle, c'est ma quête humaine, dans tous les sens du terme, vers la félicité qui rugit dans mes mots comme une ode à la Vie, à la fois un cri d'alarme et d'espoir de renaissance qui se matérialise malgré les épreuves, les échecs, les douleurs, les doutes aussi.


Risques et défis

Bien sûr, un tel projet comporte son lot de défis, d'abord sur le plan organisationnel, puisque dès la mise au jour de cette campagne de sociofinancement, je mets en place un échéancier qui se précisera dans les prochains jours.

Mais le principal défi demeure celui de me dévoiler ainsi à vous. S'il y a un domaine littéraire où l'intime prend une place prépondérante, c'est bien celui de la poésie. Et la mienne est très personnelle. Je le dis toutefois sans vouloir susciter en vous une émotion apparentée à de la pitié, étant conscient et très ouvert à l'idée que je m'exposerai à la critique, comme tout autre artisan.

En vous avouant bien humblement que cela me donne un peu le vertige, je saute néanmoins dans le vide avec joie et confiance, sachant que, d'une façon ou d'une autre, mon recueil fera son petit bonhomme de chemin, peut-être jusqu'à votre coeur. Cette nouvelle aventure m'apparaît donc comme un beau défi plus excitant qu'apeurant, puisque j'entrerai avec vous dans ce «Pays de Canaan» aux mille et une promesses que je vois poindre à l'horizon. Êtes-vous prêts à me suivre?


D'autres façons d'aider

Je suis conscient que certains d'entre vous ne pourrez pas contribuer financièrement à mon projet. Ne soyez pas mal à l'aise pour autant, car vous pouvez m'aider de diverses autres façons, notamment en diffusant ma campagne dans vos réseaux de contacts ou en me faisant part de toute autre suggestion d'aide par courriel à martinroy.perso@gmail.com. Du «jus de bras», comme on dit en bon français, c'est aussi important que du «jus de portefeuille», je vous l'assure!


Note: l'image apparaissant dans la section «Explorer» est une oeuvre de l'artiste peintre Nicole Haché de Caraquet, intitulée Percevoir cette lueur (acrylique et cuivre; collection Résonance, 2011). Cette image se retrouvera en page couverture de mon recueil. Avec l'aimable autorisation de l'artiste.

=========================================================

DRINK THIS IN (drinkthisin.com)

The ultimate resource on alcohol consumption

Fitzgerald described it as “the rose colored glasses of life”, Shakespeare said it is where the truth “doth dwell”, and Sinatra said it “may be man's worst enemy”. What is alcohol really?

The Book:

Over half of the world’s adult population consumes alcoholic beverages, some much more than others. Most people know that drinking alcohol can make you tipsy, and drinking more can make you drunk. Those are simple observations but, like a complex cocktail, there is more to liquor than meets the eye, or lips. Alcohol’s influence is far-reaching and has frequently changed the course of history by shaping inventions, events, and lives. 

Drink This In is a comprehensive resource on the history, mechanics, influences, and economics of alcohol. The book doesn’t aim to promote or discourage drinking, it aims to provide unbiased information to readers. You also won’t have to study chemical biology to understand the book. Fictional characters help readers to relate to the information, and illustrations make it easier to understand. As the title suggests, we would like readers to Drink This In.

Authors & Background:

We, Chris and Luke Muller, are brothers and best friends. Having both studied and worked in the field of economics, we are also seasoned writers and researchers. Chris is currently working for an online education provider, while Luke is a freelance economic writer/researcher.

Together we have spent many years enjoying alcohol in a social capacity. In late 2012 Chris asked himself, “how much do I actually know about this substance?” The answer was “not much”. After some initial research Chris discovered a lack of any comprehensive information available for the general alcohol consumer. Luke’s interest was quickly piqued, and together we started writing and researching. Drink This In was born.

Now, 14 months later, we are preparing to publish the eBook via self-publishing. We hope you are also thirsty for more knowledge, and can help us through this final stage.

Your contributions will go towards:

  • The promotion video
  • Copy editing
  • Book layout and design
  • eBook set-up
  • Book cover design
  • Marketing
  • Illustrations
  • Website development
  • Website hosting
  • First run of books
  • Perks costs

More information:

For more information please go to our website: www.drinkthisin.com, and feel free to contact us.

My name is Nia King and I am a queer mixed-race art activist based in Oakland, California. I run a podcast called We Want the Airwaves where I interview queer and trans artists of color about their lives and their work. Last year, I published a book of my interviews called Queer and Trans Artists of Color featuring artists like Janet Mock, Ryka Aoki, and Julio Salgado.

Since publishing the book of I have interviewed several more political QTPOC artists, including many from demographics that were under-represented in the first book. Please help me publish the second volume so that the next generation of QTPOC artists will have access to the stories of their elders and understand that they are part of an important legacy!

The second volume will feature interviews with:

  • Juba Kalamka
  • Karinda Dobbins
  • Cherry Galette
  • Lexi Adsit
  • Mimi Thi Nguyen
  • Amir Rabiyah
  • Mattie Brice
  • Manish of Peacock Rebellion

and many more!

What the money will go to:

  • Paying the artists
  • Paying the editors and graphic designer
  • Printing
  • Shipping
  • Indiegogo & PayPal fees (womp womp)

Thank you!!! <3 <3 <3

story:
Whirlpool Press are a non-profit, totally independent, Scottish small-press publisher based in Edinburgh.

Poet Jim Ferguson has written a concise book in the form of 'the diary of a Scottish hippy'. It deals with the daily events in the Scottish Independence Referendum debate between January and April 2014 using a combination of humour, anger and pathos. Not propaganda, it definitely comes from the YES side of the argument. 

The book is written, typeset and ready to go to print.
What We Need is funding towards print costs and promotion.
The more funds we have the more copies we can print
and the bigger impact the book can have on the referendum debate.

The Impact

Written in an easy, fast-flowing style this book should appeal to readers of all ages but in particular it should appeal to those in 16 to 25 age range. Giving an accessible understanding to the debate around Independence and it's history.

We hope to organise events in Glasgow and Edinburgh to promote the book, both as a piece of writing in itself and as a contribution in support of a YES vote for Scottish Independence on 18th September.

Printing and promotion is where the funds raised here will be spent.

Thank you for your support.

story:
What Is The Other Side Of The Sun?

The Other Side of the Sun is a trilogy of books written by Thomas Alexander offering a unique perspective through the eyes of a rural family on the impact of World War II on ordinary Japanese life.

Inspired by the true story of a doctor from Northern Japan, it is one family’s attempt to make sense of a changing world amidst the desolation of history’s bloodiest war to date, both at home and abroad, as each person chooses their own destiny and place in the new world.

Spanning the duration of the war with a story of love and loss and life reclaimed, The Other Side of the Sun series consists of three volumes: A Scattering of Orphans, The Disingenuous Martyr, and Beyond the Noonday Sun.

Sample Chapters

Follow the link for sample chapters from A Scattering of Orphans, the first book in Thomas Alexander's trilogy The Other Side of the Sun.

Read Sample Chapters of A Scattering of Orphans HERE

Why Does This Story Matter?

If recent world events have taught us anything it is that we haven’t learnt from our history.

Since the end of World War II there have been approximately 250 major wars in the world, in which over 50 million people have been killed, tens of millions made homeless, and countless more injured or left bereaved. In the history of the world, the twentieth century stands out as the bloodiest and most brutal. There is no part of the world that war hasn’t reached, and no people in the world who haven’t suffered.

We keep reliving our mistakes for one reason, and one reason only.

We forget that the other side is made up of ordinary people just like you and me.

Understanding is the only way forward, and stories are how we reach beyond ourselves.

Stories are the only way to move towards a world where we can celebrate the fact that there are far more similarities between cultures to unite us than differences to divide us.

Stories of you and me and ordinary people scattered all over the world matter.

Far from glorifying war or taking sides over the conflict, The Other Side of the Sun trilogy takes us into the story of an ordinary family caught within circumstances beyond their control. We follow them through their intimate times of heartbreak and joy, of new life entering the world, of death taking others out, and all those moments in between that make us all human. It reminds us that there were never “a million hearts beating as one”, but rather each heart struggling to find and follow its own truth.

There are some stories that need to be told.

This is one of them.


Who Is Thomas Alexander?

Thomas Alexander is a poet, playwright, and novelist who lived in Japan for over ten years. During his time in Iwate he was told about the memoirs a friend’s grandfather published about his experiences during the war. He was immediately struck by the raw humanness of the story. Inspired, he began to write what would eventually become The Other Side of the Sun trilogy.

While Thomas Alexander made a successful transition over the next ten years into writing primarily for theatre, the novel he began so long ago in Japan never let go of him. The characters and their lives kept drawing him back, until he eventually had no choice but to sit down and finally complete them.

Most of all, the disturbing events unfolding internationally confirmed for him how vital it was that these stories be told. While 2015 will mark the 70th anniversary of the end of the war in the Pacific, he could see very little change in how we fundamentally view those we believe to be unlike us.

It was this sense of urgency, coupled with the absolute belief that stories can help bridge differences and build understanding, that pushed Thomas Alexander to complete this trilogy for publication.

Thomas Alexander has had over a dozen plays produced on three continents, in countries ranging from Japan to the United States to Afghanistan, with his work translated into four different languages. Following several highly successful writing and directorial seasons in Tokyo he was handpicked by the Afghan government and commissioned to write The Crossroads Country, which he directed to international acclaim, receiving extensive coverage from the likes of CNN, NHK, The Yomiuri Shimbun, and The Boston Herald. He is experienced in all aspects of theatre, from opera to children's performances, having written over twenty plays and directed more than ten.


What Can I Do To Help? 

The costs of producing a book are endless, but even with all three books in the trilogy written and raring to go there are multiple expenses – including design, ISBN cataloguing, and editing – to consider.

We need at least $3,235 to ensure that Thomas Alexander’s The Other Side of the Sun trilogy is published in full.  

While we are aiming at a print run as early as September we still need funds in order to help pay for publicity and proof copies so that we can get all three books into stores as quickly as possible, coinciding with events commemorating seventy years since the end of World War II.


The world changed for so many people that year, and we want to tell you about just some of them.


How Will The Money Be Used?

The cost of producing a book is sizable, but the costliest – the written word – is all but done!

       

The funding we’re looking for not only ensures that these three books get published, it allows us make sure these stories get the exposure they deserve.

Without your help, the enormity of publishing a trilogy of this magnitude over the course of a single year is at risk. With the 70th anniversary of the end of the war in the Pacific upon us, we believe that these stories need to be heard.

In return for your generosity, we’ve put together a fantastic range of perks that ensure you get to be the first to read this trilogy for yourself!

We’ve broken down the production costs below, but these books – a labour of love that have taken over ten years to write – need just that little bit more help.

And that’s where you come in!


What Do I Get?

This is the fun part!

To say thank you for your help in making this possible we have a huge variety of perks for you to choose from, but it all depends on what you want…  

  • How would you like a special first edition copy of A Scattering of Orphans, signed and numbered by the author? Sure thing. Check out the Manila Package.
  • Are you more the zipping-around-town type who would like an e-reader packed with literary goodies to devour? Absolutely. The Shinjuku Package is what you’re after.
  • Perhaps you’re struggling with your own creativity and would like a workshop tailored to your needs? We can help. Have a look at the Tokyo Package.

    These are only a few of the unique packages we’ve put together to thank you for your generosity. We’re absolutely confident that you’ll find the perk that’s perfect for you - especially since postage is included - so why don’t you have a look through our extensive list in the side column on the right. 

    Most of all, you’ll know that your contribution has gone towards building greater cultural understanding, recognizing how much our similarities outweigh our differences, and ultimately helping to make the world a better place.


    Big On Love But Short On Cash?

    We understand that you might not be in a position to contribute financially, but the great news is that you can still help! Here are a few ways:

    • Share! Share! Share! Indiegogo has some spectacular share tools – why not use them to help us get the word out about our fantastic campaign.
    • Tell your friends and family to also join in and help us make some noise about our campaign. Usually it’s your mother who has the best networks.
    • Let your local library know how much you’re looking forward to reading A Scattering of Orphans as soon as they order it in for you. This is why we love libraries.  
    • If you’re part of a book club, suggest reading A Scattering of Orphans together. With the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII there’s never been a more timely story.
    • Know a group or organization that might be interested? Pass on our details and let them know that we would love to hear from them.


    Want To Talk To Us?

    We love hearing from our supporters!

    Our team will try as hard as possible to answer any and all messages left for us on the comments page, but the best way for you to contact us with your questions or suggestions is at thomasalexander@directlight-publications.com

    We promise we’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

    In the meantime, don’t forget that you can use social media to stay up-to-date with the campaign as it unfolds.

    • Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Thomas-Alexander 
    • Follow us on Twitter: @thomasaauthor

    For inquiries regarding distribution please contact our lovely publishing team at info@directlight-publications.com 


    After Some Answers?

    Do you offer worldwide delivery?

    Absolutely! We are all about sharing this amazing story and are happy to ship to all major countries. Best of all, postage has already been included in the price of each package for you.

    I’m getting a softcover copy of the novel - when will it arrive?

    We know you can’t wait to start reading so we’ll do our best to get it to you as soon as possible, but please allow up to 60 days from the end of our Indiegogo campaign depending on your location. As you can imagine, shipping to Albania is very different to sending something to Albuquerque.

    E-books are more my thing, but tell me when I can get it?

    Good question. At the very latest, you’ll get your e-book within 10 days of the end of our Indiegogo campaign but we definitely plan on it hitting your inbox even sooner if we can!

    What format will my e-book arrive in?

    We can provide pretty much any format that you want – as long as you tell us what you need (ePub, mobi etc.) Just remember to let us know when you’re choosing your perk, or send an email to info@directlight-publications.com

    What kind of details do you need from me?

    Because we really want to get your perk to you as soon as we can, please make sure you supply us with your email address, no matter what the package is, so we can send you your e-book or voucher, or even contact you if we need to. If your package involves us sending you something – like a copy of the book or an e-reader – please remember to supply us with your full postal address.

    I think my postal address might change – what should I do?

    That’s absolutely okay – we just need you to communicate with us! Let us know, either through our Indiegogo page or via our email address (info@directlight-publications.com) that your postal address will change and where we should send your perk to instead.

    I’ve pledged for the Yokohama package – how does it work?

    Thomas Alexander and one of our Direct Light Publications editors are both really looking forward to reading your work! While our team will send you an email with more in-depth guidance, we need you to send your manuscript to info@directlight-publications.com by 31 December 2014. You will then receive a review, analysis and feedback on your work within 60 days. Easy peasy!

    What about the Tokyo package?

    You lucky thing – you get a creative writing workshop with Thomas Alexander! It all depends on when you’re available and when he’s available. While our team will contact you to sort out the details, we will need to arrange a time that everyone is happy with. Remember that you can invite your friends or writing group to join in, so just make sure that everyone is free to come and enjoy the workshop!
    ps. This package is suitable for all age groups, so writers from 8 to 80 and beyond are all welcome!

    I’m much more interested in the Morioka package – tell me about that.

    Wow – you’re getting the galleys from A Scattering of Orphans! This means that the original, marked proof between Thomas Alexander and the publisher of the first novel in The Other Side of the Sun trilogy are on their way to you as you pledge. Not only is each page is signed and dated, but it also has all the hand written annotations that Thomas Alexander sent to the publisher before the final proof.

    This package comes in a special presentation box along with a copy of the book and a handwritten thank you note from author, but don’t forget to send us your email address as well – we’re sending you a limited edition e-book with a new cover AND a one of a kind e-book copy of The Sun In Its Zenith – unavailable in bookshops – as a huge thank you so you don’t miss out on a single word!

What Is The Other Side Of The Sun?
The Other Side of the Sun is a trilogy of books written by Thomas Alexander offering a unique
perspective through the eyes of a rural family on the impact of World War II on
ordinary Japanese life. 
Inspired by the true story of a doctor from Northern Japan, it is one
family’s attempt to make sense of a changing world amidst the desolation of
history’s bloodiest war to date, both at home and abroad, as each person
chooses their own destiny and place in the new world. 
Spanning the duration of the war with a story of love and loss and life
reclaimed, The Other Side of the Sun
series consists of three volumes: A
Scattering of Orphans, The
Disingenuous Martyr, and Beyond the
Noonday Sun.



Sample ChaptersFollow the link for sample chapters from A Scattering of Orphans, the first book in Thomas Alexander's trilogy The Other Side of the Sun.


Read Sample Chapters of A Scattering of Orphans HERE
Why Does This Story Matter? 
If recent world events have taught us anything it is that we haven’t
learnt from our history. 
Since the end of World War II there have been approximately 250 major
wars in the world, in which over 50 million people have been killed, tens of
millions made homeless, and countless more injured or left bereaved. In the history
of the world, the twentieth century stands out as the bloodiest and most brutal.
There is no part of the world that war hasn’t reached, and no people in the
world who haven’t suffered.
We keep reliving our mistakes for one reason, and one reason only.
We forget that the other side is made up of ordinary people just like
you and me.
Understanding is the only way forward, and stories are how we reach
beyond ourselves.
Stories are the only way to move towards a world where we can celebrate
the fact that there are far more similarities between cultures to unite us than
differences to divide us. 
Stories of you and me and ordinary people scattered all over the world
matter.
Far from glorifying war or taking sides over the conflict, The Other Side of the Sun trilogy takes
us into the story of an ordinary family caught within circumstances beyond
their control. We follow them through their intimate times of heartbreak and
joy, of new life entering the world, of death taking others out, and all those
moments in between that make us all human. It reminds us that there were never “a million hearts beating as one”, but
rather each heart struggling to find and follow its own truth.

Short Summary

Hi! My name is Heather B. I am a freelance character designer and I have been drawing for as long as I can remember! I have always loved reading childrens book from time to time, mainly for the reason that they are usually really funny and very creative! After years of coming up with some ideas for a children book, I decided to make a childrens book series called the McKenzie and Hall Adventures! McKenzie Does NOT Like Snow is my second book in the series. In this story, McKenzie shares my great dislike for snow, but towards the end of the story, McKenzie's views might be changed due to her friend Mag's convincing reasons why snow is not so bad.


The money that you contribute towards my book will help me to be able to buy enough copies to share with at least one elementary school class! It costs a lot to print books so really, your donation will really be appreciated!! I really want to be able to share my passion for writing childrens books and hopefully, I'll inspire children to follow their dreams of becoming a artist or whatever else they want to be!

Preview of the Story!


 

What We Need & What You Get

I know I will definitely need at least $100 to buy the amount of books I need! I expect the book to be at least 32 pages. The money raised will be used to buy copies of the books to be given to a class of elementary school students. Does this mean that you pay and that's that? Noooo! If you donate a certain amount, you get a copy of the book, signed! There are other perks too if you can't afford a book! There are limited edition art prints, tshirts and posters! :D If I don't meet my entire goal, I will be using whatever I make towards buying some copies of the books because at the end of the day, my ultimate goal is to buy copies of my book for students to enjoy!


The Impact

 

I really could inspire children to go after their dreams if this is successful! Before writing these books, I tried to apply to jobs to illustrate childrens books for people in the past but I was always told no, I couldn't illustrate a book, I wasn't qualified. Well, after being discouraged for a while, I got to thinking one day, I don't have to keep trying to get hired to illustrate someone else's book! I can make my own childrens book and decided what I write and what I want to illustrate! And so came the McKenzie and Hall Adventures series! :) I plan on making more books for the series in the future and I hope that with every classroom, library, bookstore, etc. I can share my story with kids and inspire them to follow their dreams and to do what they love! I want to help them see that they need people to tell them they can do it but instead, they should be able to look at themselves and realize they can do it!

 

Risks & Challenges

 There is low risk with this project. The only real risk I can see is not getting the book shipped in time. I hope to get them shipped out for those who donated enough money by the end of January. But with holiday shipping, it could be delayed until Febuary even! I don't anticipate that to happen though, but if it does, I will stop at nothing to ship out the books and prints for you who payed for it!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help me! You can tell your friends and family about my book and campaign, whether it's by word of mouth or through your social media accounts! I will appreciate your help just as much as someone who contributed money!

Help make McKenzie Does NOT Like Snow happen!  Grab your perk now!!

story:
Zach Lowe did not go far enough. 

Recently, Grantland's NBA correspondent Zach Lowe published what he titled "An All-Too-Serious Breakdown of Space Jam," in which he reviewed the film in question after viewing it for the first time as a 36-year-old man. 

All-too-serious? Ha. I say: not nearly serious enough. 

After viewing Space Jam perhaps dozens of times as a child, and also a small handful of times as I have evolved into young adulthood, it is clear to this cinema critic that the state of Space Jam criticism and interpretation is in a sorry way indeed. If a review as overwhelmingly brief as Lowe's is enough cause for a revival in Space Jam scholarship, well, then, I'll show you. 

By supporting this project you are supporting my upcoming long article/short e-book of at least 10,000 words called Here's Your Chance, Do Your Dance, a project that has the foolish if not impossible goal of being at the contemporary vanguard of Space Jam criticism and interpretation. Among the topics that Here's Your Chance, Do Your Dance will explore in unflinching depth: 

  • How the profound, film-defining motives of Mr. Swackhammer (proprietor of the interplanetary amusement park Moron Mountain) seek to be a mirror that reflects back on the society that birthed the film.
  • The performance of Michael Jordan: art imitating life, or life imitating art? 
  • The influence of Space Jam on other basketball-centric pieces of cinema, such as Thunderstruck (Warner Bros. Pictures; 2012; 94 minutes; starring Kevin Durant). 

The project will be released in early October, to supporters of this campaign, or mid-October, to the general Space Jam audience. (And also apologies to Mr. Lowe, who is a really great writer.)

story:
What We Are About

Darkflame Books is the starting point for the publication of a series of modern-day fantasy and horror novels.  It began as an idea after I’d finished writing my first novel Lost & Found, and it has expanded into a project that will be used to publish an ongoing series.

From a young age, I always enjoyed reading and storytelling.  I was the kid on the playground reading a book on most days, and throughout middle school and high school, I used writing as a creative outlet.  With both solo projects and collaborations, fiction has become my passion, and I would love to share that with others.

Self-publishing takes time and money, though, and I reached the conclusion that I cannot do it alone.  Bringing characters and stories to life has been a dream of mine for a very long time, and turning it into a reality would be one of the biggest achievements of my life.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is set at $1500 for several reasons.  The cost of filing for an LLC in the state of Texas alone is $400.  Promotion, cover art, and publishing itself take up the bulk of the rest of the costs.  I plan on including finished copies of the first novel as an incentive for supporting this project, and it will be less expensive to have them printed in bulk instead of individually.  It’s more cost-effective to have fifty copies printed than ten at a time.

I also plan to attend events to help promote Lost & Found and its sequels.  Planning and travel costs can add up, especially if interacting with readers involves spending a night or two away from home.

Even if I don’t reach the entire goal, I hope to raise enough to at least file for the LLC and get a few copies printed.  Events may have to wait a little longer, but the most important parts of the project are sorting out the legalities of incorporation.

Risks & Challenges

Getting a small business off the ground comes with its own set of challenges. Gathering interest is one of the main ones, but I plan to utilize both social media and my personal network to get the word out about both the business and my books.

I plan to use Lightning Source for publishing itself. They offer a "print on demand" service, as well as e-books. They also list the book with retailers, so if there is enough interest, then it could end up on bookshelves in the near future.

Once the first book is published, I'll need to do my own advertising. Agan, social media will help, but I'd also like to start going to local fantasy/sci-fi conventions so I can set up a vendor table and interact with potential readers personally.

The biggest obstacle to getting this project off the ground is funding. The costs of filing the paperwork to establish an LLC, production, shipping, and the artist commission for the cover art are all part of the initial startup costs. If this campaign is successful, however, then the money raised will cover all of that.

In the future, I hope to publish not only my own novels, but those submitted by other unpublished authors. Everyone has a story, and Darkflame Books is ready to tell it!

Can't Contribute but Still Want to Help?

Money isn't always readily available when we see something that interests us, but there are plenty of ways you can still help out without spending a dime!

Word-of-mouth is one of the best ways to let your friends know what interests you. We also have several social media platforms you can follow to stay in the loop with what we're doing and where we stand with our projects.

The Official Darkflame Books Facebook Page

The Official Darkflame Books Website

The Official Darkflame Books Twitter

The Official Darkflame Books Blog
