story:
What is this?

Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Iulian, I'm a small-time writer of mostly journalistic content, with the odd dabble into fiction. I've never been published before, though I was once quoted as a source on Wikipedia, which people have constantly told me I should stop pointing out as an achievement. Over the past few years I have been trying to put together ideas for a book, a fiction novel with a simple manageable story.

That was about a decade ago. Over more iterations than I can remember, it has evolved into something less than simple, less amateurish, and approaching a status that I would consider to be at least half decent. Not only that, but during the writing process, it has grown from more that just one story and into a multitude of tales spanning worlds and characters abound, all tied together by a common thread. Yet none of these will be realized if I don't finish this one story.

Tale of Doom: Part One is my attempt to begin this journey. I'll probably have a flashier name for it later on. Part Two will also come along soon, depending on how well Part One is received. They were at one time meant to be one single Tale of Doom, but I decided to break it off in two parts, in the hopes that this way at least part of it will be out there, available for people to read. I repeatedly slapped myself to not turn it into a trilogy. So far this has worked.

It is a story of a character named Thorm. He used to be called Silverblade in an older version of the book, but that was a stupid name. Part One centres around an attempt, by him and several other characters, to basically save the world. Well, a world, it's got two moons and I'll probably give it a silly fantasy name. The catch is that he failed. And that's not much of a spoiler, Thorm dies about a page in. And unlike some other characters, he does not wake up in a mortuary, with amnesia. Instead, he spends what's left of time trying to explain to the embodiment of Death what exactly happened. 

Talking about the book isn't probably going to do much, so you may as well read a draft of the first chapter, which is now posted in the Updates section.

Why are you here?

Part One is almost finished, as writing goes. There is only one chapter left to write, which I had planned on finishing this summer, had being employed not kept me occupied. Not that I mind, having food to eat is a nice perk when writing. But that's just phase one. The book still needs several passes for consistency, a few details that need to be added once everything else is in, and the mother of it all, spell-checking, grammar checking, and all round "does this make sense" checking. English isn't my first or even second language, it borders on fourth, but it is the one I'm most comfortable to write this story with, so this part will be a doozy. That being said, that's not why I am here.

I am here because I want this to be a better book than just a text file. I want to add art to it, illustrations, an actual cover that's not made in MS Paint. A rough sketch, that I can do, but something that really catches the eye, that is beyond my ability, and people that do have the ability tend to value it. So that is where a portion of the budget intended for this book will go. The rest, well, there's the odd tax and maybe, just maybe, enough to take some time off work to really dedicate myself to this book and see it completed in its best form.

Why am I here?

Hopefully to help fund this book. If you've read the draft of the first chapter, and you enjoy it, please consider chipping in, at whatever sum you can afford.

Apart from a digital copy of the book, and maybe wallpapers with eventual illustrations, I can't offer any tangible rewards. Physical ones are out of the question, unless this thing really takes off and I can actually make print copies of the book. In which case, absolutely, 

Most rewards will be relating to the book itself, such as including your name in a special dedication page, naming a character after you, and just about everything else you see to the right of the screen.

No, really, why am I here?

Tale of Doom: Part One, is just that, part one, a tiny little part of something much greater I one day hope to build. But if that ever happens, it will be built upon this, this book, this story. If people don't hate it, if some people even actually somewhat find it mildly enjoyable, that it means there's a chance. A chance for this, for Part Two, for the book about some characters in their younger days, some in their older days, some in a far away place beyond, other characters in another world, another time, another place, all existing in the same universe, all linked together by a single, common element. That element isn't actually noticeable in Part One, unless you squint really hard. Or unless I change it, because in hindsight it may seem silly.

For me, this book is the first step on an expedition into unknown. Care to take it with me?

Risks & Challenges

Part One is nearly done. One chapter left and the frightening prospect of editing it all. Regardless if this campaign reaches its goal, you will have Tale of Doom Part One in March. It may not be much to look at, if we only raise 5 bucks, but the story will be there, even if it's shaped like a pdf file with laughable doodles as covers. 

I will finish this book, that I can promise. Even if by some freak accident I get my arms chopped off, I will finish it by typing with my nose if I have to. I've spent far too many years working and reworking everything to have it fail when it is this close to being finished, and this close to the real adventure getting started.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word. Please. I know how annoying it can be to get constant tweets or facebook posts about stuff you don't like, so if you refrain from doing that to others, I fully understand. But it would help.

Read the draft of the first chapter, tell me it sucks, tell me it's awful, tell me it's almost readable, tell me it's half decent, tell me it's enjoyable. Tell me anything that pops into mind about it, because every little thing helps.

Frequently Asked Questions


Q: What kind of book is this?

A: Fantasy. Like Lord of the Rings, but worse.

Q: Does it have sexy vampires and werewolves?

A: Sort of, but they're not the focus.

Q: Wizards?

A: Yes.

Q: Do they have noses?

A: Yes. And no, they don't use wands.

Q: Who is this book for?

A: Anybody that can read. There is a bit of violence in it and a lot of existential crisis, so maybe not for little kids.

Q: Your name sounds weird. Why don't you use a pseudonym?

A: Good idea, call me M.C. Sheppard. 

Q: How long is the book?

A: Currently it is about 56.000 words long, without the last chapter or the add-ins. When it's finished, it should be at around 65.000 words. Part Two will be about the same size.

Q: Have you talked to any artists about those illustrations?

A: Not yet. I will once I have a clear idea of what the budget is, so I know just what I can shoot for. Ideally, the covers, and one illustration for each chapter and main character. Realistically, the cover, a few characters and maybe some chapters. Most probably, half a cover and two-three scenes from the book.

Q: What happens if you don't get enough money for any illustrations?

A: They will be replaced with sketches, horrible sketches, like the one in the title of this page, and this sketch of the world Part One and Part Two take place in.

story:
Robert Bly: Like the New Moon I Will Live My Life


White Pine Press has been publishing quality poetry and literature in translation for over forty years. We have published the work of Robert Bly for almost that long and are asking your help to raise funds to support the publication of Like The New Moon I Will Live My Life, a major collection of his work. 

Like The New Moon I Will Live My Life forms a companion to his recent Stealing Sugar from the Castile: New and Selected Poems. The Chinese-influenced strain of Bly's work is celebrated here and amply showcased in the over 170 poems. The collection is a kind of back road running parallel to the more traveled route of his Selected Poems.

I have worked with Robert and the poet Thomas R. Smith who contributes an insightful introduction, to rediscover a significant body of his work hidden in long out of print chapbooks, books, magazine issues, and in manuscripts. 

Robert Bly has long been recognized as one of the giants of Twentieth century poetry and thought. The Huffington Post says of him "Robert Bly changed the course of American poetry by opening it up to the imagination and the deep-image aesthetic, he is dedicated to reintegrating poetry with life — daily life, the life of the body, spiritual and political life."

Please join us in celebrating and supporting the publication of Robert's work in the new collection and spread the word to friends who enjoy his work. 

Dennis Maloney

Founding Editor/Publisher

White Pine Press

story:
I was just one of 60 writers accepted to Ashbery Home School, a week-long program  in Hudson, NY, where 60 writers experience their written work through considering visual art, music, dance, and other media. This is an unbelievable opportunity for me to make great new work--and to reshape the way I think about writing. 


The Why: If I attend, I will be able to work with remarkable poets like Timothy Donnelly, Dorothea Lasky, Eileen Myles, Adam Fitzgerald, and Paul Muldoon. These are writers who I respect and whose work has taught me so much already; to work with them one-on-one and in workshop would be truly unbelievable. The connections I can make at Ashbery Home School will help me make my work what I want it to be: relevant and challenging. 


The Nuts and Bolts: In order to attend, I need to send in my  registration fee of $1175  by February 25th or they will give away my spot. As a graduate student heavy in student loans, I won't be able to afford this without help! My goal is $1400, which will cover tuition, transportation, IndieGogo fees, application, and lodging for one night in Hudson. The entire cost of the conference will be ~$1750, including Ramen, so $1400 will be enough to make this goal a reality. 


Who I am: I'm graduate student in poetry who writes and translates. I write every day, often on the train. My writing is frequently concerned with the experience of women. I also take photographs and watercolor, and serve as Assistant Translation Editor for Catch & Release. If you'd like to read some of my writing,  click here.  


What you can do: I am very grateful for any financial contribution you are able to make to help me make this awesome opportunity real! To show my gratitude, I would love to make and send you something: a thank you note, a recording of whatever poem you wish, a translation of your choosing, a photograph I've taken, or a watercolor of my making. If you aren't able to make a contribution, please share my project with whomever you can, on Facebook, email, or instant message! Whatever you can do, I thank you for your support.

story:
Update: A significantly cheaper retailer has been found! It drops the price from $5000 to just under $3000. Sweet, right? Unfortunately, I can't change the damn fundraiser price. So...let's just pretend it says $4000, not $8000.

My name is Cat. I'm a 20-year-old non-binary trans person from the Wiradjuri people. I am chronically ill - severe fibromyalgia, epilepsy and neurological impairments stemming from these, as well as autism.

I am extremely poor, living on the generosity of my partner and friends. I cannot work, and all my attempts to receive government assistance have been denied, due to issues with my parents' incomes and the nature of my disabilities.

I tried crowdfunding once a few months ago, but because of Australia's strict laws regarding online money services, I couldn't prove my identity adequately, and my fundraiser was shut down.

Despite my need, my family have refused to help with my needs. Over winter, I starved. The cold weather resulted in nerve damage in my fingers.

To make a long story short: I need a powered wheelchair. A wheelchair that suits my needs is very expensive. Walking causes me extreme, widespread pain and severe fatigue.

The total sought sum is $4000, covering the chair, as well as some of the expensive therapies I need. I have put off vision therapy for a year, and as a result, my eyesight has deteriorated to the point where I can no longer read books. I also need cognition and physical therapy.

If by some miracle, I exceed my needed amount, I will be donating all extras to charities such as Guide Dogs Australia, and other programmes that assist the disabled in our community.

If you cannot donate, please share if you can. If anyone wants or can donate perks, that is equally as welcome.

Thank you for reading.

story:
The story of the project

Lila Jean Vintage is a quarterly vintage fashion and nostalgia magazine, enriched by real stories. Through submissions from the public, Lila Jean retells social history through the lens of everyday stories. We go to the very heart of vintage – to the men and women who wore it first – and tell their story.

Lila Jean is made locally. The first three issues of the magazine were entirely self-funded by the magazine's founding editor Naomi Gall. We feel strongly about working with local businesses for print and design services and ensuring that every commissioned writer, photographer and illustrator are paid for their work. Your support will allow us to expand our list of contributors to get some fresh, new voices and artwork into the magazine which is why we need your help so that we can continue to support other independents just like us.

What’s in Issue Four?  

The campaign is to support the production of Issue four – The International Issue – due for release in September 2015. Work has already begun, with our content plan all set to go. Between the covers you can expect the best places to shop vintage overseas, a look at Qantas’s 95 years in the sky, an interview with Dita Von Teese ahead of her trip to Australia, a look at some lesser known historical attractions overseas, and fashion and beauty tips for the vintage traveller. We will be enlisting the help of writers from both Australia and abroad to present a diverse range of engaging content.

Image: Travel fashion, Qantas, 1930s. Courtesy Qantas Heritage Collection. 

How the funds will be used

We want to involve more people in the creative process, giving early career writers a chance to have their voices heard. We also have some great ideas to further involve artists and illustrators in the magazine. Part of the funds raised will ensure that all our wonderful freelancers – photographers, writers, illustrators, videographers, web gurus – are paid for their amazing work. We are committed to supporting independent small business within Australia so the funds will go towards printing and design locally. The rest will be used for incidentals such as studio hire for photo shoots and administration costs.

Image: Issue Three photo shoot. Photo: Will Taylor.

Other ways you can help

We understand that not everyone can donate, but sharing is free and a really great way to help support what we're doing. Sharing our project would mean a lot and be an enormous help, so thank you in advance!

Perks

We are very fortunate to have the support of Tresors who specialise in antique jewellery as well as Audrey's Wardrobe, Evelyn Wood Vintage Fashion House and The Gold Hatted Lovers, who each have a selection of gorgeous vintage and vintage reproduction clothing. 

Our $500 perk is an amazing  necklace and earring set circa 1950s.

Our $800 perk is a stunning Edwardian lead crystal necklace.

Issue Four is available in PDF format upon request.

story:
Short Summary

For the last several years I have been publishing short stories on my blog and in e book. I have decided it is time to step it up and write a full length novel, Marked. You can read a sample of Marked here.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $5,000 because I want to make sure that Marked is published correctly. I will be using the money for editing, formatting and cover art. I also want to step beyond e publishing and into print.

Then there is advertising and promotion, as well as a small cost of living. I would like to keep the electricity on while I write. :)  

The Impact

Your contribution will help me reach my goal. One of the basic things in writing is editing. I have tried to wing it in the past, but that hasn't worked. I am dyslexic, so trying to self edit my own work is like the blind leading the blind.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help out by letting people know about my campaign. A tweet, shoutout on Facebook, even word of mouth. If you have read my blog, Jezri's Nightmares and enjoy my writing, tell a friend.

Thank you,

Lisa McCourt Hollar

So if you watched the video down below you will see what it is this entire planet has too do right now; Pulse LOVE. But to have the greatest effect
with our hearts in relation to our Mother Earth we must have all of our
greatest spiritual masters go to the chakra points on this planet and consciously pulse peace and love; acting like acupuncture needles for the
earth. While I believe this alone can be enough, I’m not willing to stop
here in ideas that need to be initiated. So the next thing that needs to
happen is also going to be the hardest, yet, most gratifying. The world
needs to put down the controllers of violent video games. And not because I believe video games makes people violent but because of what’s going
through the gamers mind is. If you are playing a shooting game and the
whole time you are thinking bang bang, oh shit I’m getting shot at for
hours, those thoughts carry a low vibration. Next and most obvious one is
also another hard one for many because they have a war within themselves
and it reflects out to the world and so they think the war is out there but
in reality it‘s a reflection of the war that is taking place within their minds. I was in the Marines, infantry at that, so I can speak for myself
when I say that all the fighting I did did nothing but brought more misery, alienation and confusion to my life. There is no glory, honor, or courage
in war, only illogical madness. Despite what the recruiting adds say. So I
have this one question to all of our troops, to all of the terrorist, to
all those freedom fighters; do you really have to fight? Let’s be honest
with ourselves, the real reason we fight others is because we are afraid of facing the real enemy; FEAR. Which can be easily concord by going within
our hearts and letting out our infinite light of love. If you think I’m
saying this just because it sounds good think again. I was consumed by FEAR
for years and it was eating me from the inside on out. I was saved by
something that our western society demonizes. Maybe because this plant can challenge all the mainstreams programming in just five minutes. It’s Salvia Divinorum and with just one session with this sacred plant, it dissolved
all my depression, alienation and showed me that there is indeed an
afterlife. I could not believe that after being on this planet for the past
28 years I had no idea there was a simple way of going into the spirit
realm or that it existed at all. So if you haven’t tapped into the other
side with Salvia or any other entheogen (psychedelics that are used to find
the god within) to experience other realms, your higher self, or extra dimensional entities I suggest you look into it. But first educate
yourself. Psychedelics are like any other tool. If one knows what one is
doing, then they can be very useful. But if not used with the proper
education, respect and intent then you increase the chances for negative results. After four years of experimentation I’ve learned that the best
intent with the use of entheogens is to do the following.

First I revved up my heart chakra imagining the flow of energy going around
my heart in a clockwise motion. While at the same time pulsing love to my heart. Then I turn on my chakras and aligned them
for the big takeoff. My Love shield has now been put up. As I dust myself
off with my quick takeoff as I circle the earth and solar system while
pulsing love to them. After which I race to the sun pulsing all my love to
it with the GPS turned on with the center of the galaxy as my next
destination. As my spirit hit’s the suns surface I bounce off flying twice
as fast past solar systems that keep getting brighter with love. As I enter through the galaxies black hole of intense light I leave my ripple of love vibrating rainbows of light throughout the galaxy before departing this
galaxy with the center of the Universe as my next destination. Flying even faster than before I see the galaxies streaking by while catching glimpses
of intelligent life roaring to my wonderful presence and acknowledging my
call for help. As I get closer to the center of the universe my spirit gets completely striped of it’s ego; losing it’s form, color and idea of it’s self. All that’s left is it’s truest essence; an energetic ball of
conscious light/love. Piercing the light, in the center of the universe, I
loss all sense of boundaries and enter into the universal consciousness.
There I pulse my love out to the whole universal mind. Next I send out the
call to help rid the Earth of the negative influences. And once more I send
out another pulse of light love to all that are out there. Several minutes
is all it took for this message to be received. And several minutes to get
the response in a high light loving way. As the energy intensifies, I
struggled to hold onto so much love in my aura’s cargo bay area. Once I was
as full as I could get, I jettison back to planet earth. The trip back took several minutes and as I enter the center of earth I explode love light in
all directions, blowing away all the darkness from this world, leaving us glorious horizons to look forward too.

You are NOW and ALWAYS Full of LIGHT, LOVE, PEACE and most importantly
FREEDOM from ANY and ALL inferior thoughts, energies and actions. We have
NOW reached a 100% operating Levels of spiritual awareness. It’s time for humanity to live up to it’s highest potential.

Spiritual Special Forces

-Pulse the LOVE

Stewart Allen “Vulcan” Mosher

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uHA9Gj5xtQQ&feature=related

Stewart Mosher experienced close calls with death in his youth, but it was his last four months in the Marine Corps Infantry (surrounded by the dead and dying in Port-au-Prince, 2004) that forced him to question life after death. Is there a God? Why is there so much suffering?

Out of the Marines, unknowingly a victim of PTSD, Stewart found the transition back into civilian life difficult. He found work, but could not find sufficient relief from his inner pain.

One day a coworker told him of a legal psychoactive plant called Salvia Divinorum. This information kicked off a four year quest of self-healing and exposed Stewart to a much broader view of reality using a variety of entheogenic substances.

Through these entheogenic journeys, Stewart found and explored many facets of a world beyond, a deeper sense of the basis for religion, and a new knowledge of what lay beyond death. Stewart travelled with interdimensional beings which  focused his visions, and opened his eyes to new revelations.

 

This book is dedicated to all those who want the spiritual freedom to explore the spirit realm themselves with the use of entheogens, to all who are currently in our prison system for non-violent drug crimes, to all those who could have their PTSD greatly diminished, to all those who would greatly benefit from the use of Cannabis for medical purposes, to all those who could have a greater hope of getting rid of their addiction to harmful narcotics such as heroin, crack, meth, etc. with the use of Iboga and to all those who have gone before me in speaking out against the ridiculous drug laws that are currently in place.

 

This funding will help me turn my manuscript into a book and bring more of my visions into reality. You can see all of my art on my website at entheogenicvisions.com or go to http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x9kgpwslFXo&feature=g-upl

If I end up going with self publishing like iUniverse.com then I could be paying up to $4,449 to complete my book. And the rest of the money would be used to fund the next 25 pictures.

If I don’t reach my whole goal then the money will be used to either create more pictures or for iuniverse.com to print what I have now. And when I have enough money to finish the next 25 pictures then I can do a 2nd edition of the book at a later time.

If you like what you see but can’t afford to buy any of the perks then please help me by showing friends and family this site. Also if you know of any publishers that would consider this book please feel free to email me their info at entheogenicvisions2012@gmail.com

 Thank you for your support.

Spiritual Special Forces

  -Pulse the LOVE

Stewart Mosher

story:
A yearly publication of Van Times in Turkish/Armenian/Kurdish/English and French (optional) at the occasion of the celebration of Surp Khatch in September 2012.

The magazine will include articles from intellectuals of Kurdish, Turkish and Armenian origin aiming essentially to promote  the specificity of Van as a unique multicultural region and to help the preservation of this cultural diversity.

What is Tursu.tv

Tursu.tv is a company supporting dialogue between humans through several media.

It tries to create a common and better understanding in different areas such as arts, culture, journalism and Armenian-Turkish dialogue.

Up to now, Tursu.tv has participated and set up many projects thanks to different funds.

Among others:

-        The first Armenian Tv show in Turkey in partnership with IMC TV (International Media Center TV): Gamurç-Köprü (Bridge in Armenian and Turkish). The programme introduces weekly to several aspects of Armenian culture, politics, community life inside Turkey and abroad as in Armenia and Armenian Diaspora

-        Production of several innovative videos: “Hrant Dink Case” in collaboration with arte Germany, “24th April”, “19th January”, “Avtobus” in collaboration with EPF (Eurasia Partnership Foundation) and many others.

To learn more about Tursu.tv, don’t hesitate to visit our website: www.tursu.tv

Since 1915: first articles published in Armenian language!

We believe in the necessity and the positive added value of local media.

In 2010, the first impression of articles in Armenian language has been published during one week in Van Times in collaboration with Sehrivan newspaper.

It was a great première in Armenian and Turkish History as since 1915, it was the first time that a newspaper was published in Armenian in Van!

The newspaper included maps of old Armenian villages, churches and monasteries.

It represented an incredible opportunity for local inhabitants as for the thousands of people coming from everywhere during Akhtamar’s yearly celebration of Surp Khatch (Armenian liturgy) to learn that there are many other ruins in the region deserving a visit.

As the articles were translated in Kurdish and in Turkish, it was a great input for the actual inhabitants to better know and understand Van region.

Van Times Magazine Yearly Project

After the 2010 experiment, we realized that

-        an increasing amount of researchers, intellectuals, students, tourists, people looking for their roots were interested in Van

-        many visitors coming to the Surp Khatch celebration in Akhtamar were exclusively French and English speakers.

-        Van and its historical, geographical, cultural treasures are hidden

 

That’s why we want to bring back to life and spread the word about the beauty of Van!

To do so, a group of Armenian, Turkish, Kurdish intellectuals, researchers, writers, historians will deliver articles to our team.

Those articles will be translated in Turkish, in Armenian, in Kurdish, in English and in French!

Through our magazine, that we will distribute in September during the celebration (moment of the year when Van gathers a maximum of people coming from everywhere) we will make it sure that a maximum of people learn about Van.

You love History?

You believe in human brotherhood?

You believe in cultural diversity?

Join the trip and help us to find the financial means we still need!

-        many visitors coming to the Surp Khatch celebration in Akhtamar were exclusively French and English speakers.
-        Van and its historical, geographical, cultural treasures are hidden
 
That’s why we want to bring back to life and spread the word about the beauty of Van!
To do so, a group of Armenian, Turkish, Kurdish intellectuals, researchers, writers, historians will deliver articles to our team.
Those articles will be translated in Turkish, in Armenian, in Kurdish, in English and in French!
Through our magazine, that we will distribute in September during the celebration (moment of the year when Van gathers a maximum of people coming from everywhere) we will make it sure that a maximum of people learn about Van.
You love History?
You believe in human brotherhood? 
You believe in cultural diversity? 
Join the trip and help us to find the financial means we still need!

story:
UPDATE 10th July: Plant-Powered Women is now available on Amazon (ahead of schedule! Yay!)  Click here if you prefer to buy from Amazon.

                                                     ...........................

Hi! I'm Kathy Divine, a vegan author from Sydney, Australia and I'm embarking on a vegucation revolution. 

My new book Plant-Powered Women is coming soon. This book is the perfect gift to give your friends who are thinking about going vegan and would like to hear from some of the most inspiring vegan women on the planet.

This campaign is designed for people who want to pre-order Plant-Powered Women.  It is not a campaign to raise funds to publish the book. The book is finished and is in the final stages of publishing. We will post all book orders in late August/early September.

The purpose of this campaign is to help people go vegan, not just by buying and reading copies of Plant-Powered Women, but also by using the money from book sales to translate my books into as many languages as possible and distributing these translated books for free in countries that don't yet have access to vegan books and have requested them.

My mission in life is to vegucate the planet. Through my four books (Forever 21, Vegans Are Cool, Plant-Powered Men and Plant-Powered Women) I'm aiming to assist omnivore and carnivore humans who have not yet heard about veganism, be inspired and excited about it and go vegan, for life.

By buying a book or grabbing any of the other perks, you will be joining this vegucation revolution and will be an integral part of making this happen!

So that's the overall picture: the grand vision. 

We have already started work on the Vietnamese and Spanish translations of my second book Vegans Are Cool. The first project is to veganise Vietnam through this book. The Vietnamese people will be the first recipient of free vegan books.

By buying one copy of Plant-Powered Women , you will enable us to give away five books. It's pretty awesome! Not to mention...vegantastic!

Here is the contents of Plant-Powered Women:

1 Plant-Powered Health Professionals

Making the Connection: How I Became a Vegan Activist, Dr Nandita Shah

Walking the Path of Wellness and Kindness, Tracie O'Keefe

2 The Foodie and the Chef

The Kind Cook, Mel Baker

60 Seconds to Veganism, Sara Kidd

3 Doing it for the Animals

Knowledge is Power and the Growth of Compassion, Kym Henley

Choosing Justice for Animals and Active Compassion, Sarah Davison

Being a Rural Vegan, Christina Louise Dicker

Building The Compassionate Future, Billie Dean

A Truly Compassionate Veterinarian, Siaw-Yean (Sy) Woon

4 Plant-Powered Athletes

64-Year-Old Raw Vegan Woman Breaks Marathon Record, Janette Murray-Wakelin

Fit Doesn’t Mean Necessarily Healthy, But You Can Be Both By Eating Plants, Suzanna McGee

5 Vegan Journalists and Media Pioneers

Vegan Journalist Blazing a Trail of Greater Awareness for all Beings, Katrina Fox

The Unbearable Rightness of Being Vegan, Ruby Hamad

Soft-selling a Serious Cause, Karen Dawn

Pioneering Public Relations for Animals, Kezia Jauron

6 Vegan Advocacy Pioneers

A CEO's Journey To Vegan, Jasmijn de Boo

The Corporate Vegan: Taking Plant Power to the Mainstream, Clare Mann

7 Inspirational Creatives

Using Creativity to Spread the Vegan Message, Melissa Kilkelly

A Spiritual and Creative Visionary Inspiring Change to a Compassionate World, Supreme Master Ching Hai

8 Healthy Testimonials

Maureen Foster

Jargal Jamsranjav

9 Short Grabs for Final Inspiration

Jessica Constable

Carolyn Ienna

Julia Harger

Silva Mirovics

Loren Lembke

Georgia Rickard

Holly George

Elizabeth Usher

10 The 30 Day Vegan Easy Challenge

Lefki Pavlidis


Please help spread the word through social media; email; phone calls; send a postcard; tell your postman; your neighbour; and everyone else who might be interested in joining the vegucation revolution.

Thanks so much for stopping by and thank you for sharing the link to this page  with others (igg.me/at/ppwomen)!

Kathy xx

story:
The Dragonskinner

The Misadventures Continues...

Hello, my name is Christopher Goodrum.  I am an actor, writer, composer, and director.  I was born to entertain and I have tried my hands in just about everything from stand-up to theme parks, and from theater to short films.  What I have always been passionate about was writing, from the time I wrote my first talent show skit at 13 years of age.  I love creating characters and developing stories. 

This campaign is created for the follow-up to the short story "The Legend of the Dragonskinner", published in August 2013. The tale is filled with humor borderline on existentialism, suitable for teen readers, and pop culture references adults may enjoy.

And I need your help to make it a reality to complete the story.

The Campaign

Set Goal

The campaign goal is set at $800 which will cover the production of the book and marketing costs. You may contribute as much as you like, as often as you like.  A $3 contribution is as equally appreciative as a $20 contribution.  Any and all contributions will be released to me 10 days after the conclusion of the campaign period whether I make my goal or not.  However, the fee for Indiegogo services is higher for not making the set goal, so every little bit counts.  Publication of the book should be within 180 days from the time the book is put into production.

Campaign Period and the Perks

The campaign period will run for 45 days.

So...what's in it for you?  I have created some perks for certain contribution amounts.  Among them are...

- A contribution of $10  will get you mentioned on the Acknowledgement page.

- A contribution of $15 will get you a free soft cover copy of the book plus a set of bookmarks.

- A contribution of $20 will receive an autographed soft cover copy of the book. 

Off to the Races

It is my hope that the goal is met and the second installment of "The Dragonskinner" is published late this fall.  Please, spread the word and suggests to family and friends to check out this campaign.

I appreciate your time and consideration.

story:
WHO IS ADAPT?

ADAPT is a national grassroots community that organizes disability rights activists. ADAPT Los Angeles is a chapter of ADAPT National.

WHAT IS HAPPENING IN ARKANSAS?

Over 300 ADAPT activists from around the country demanded that Arkansas select the CFCO (Community First Choice Option) to end the waiting lists for community services and end the institutional bias in the Medicaid long term services and supports system.

Over 50 activists were arrested in Little Rock fighting for the right for people with people with disabilities to live in the most integrated setting. The Little Rock police were extremely rough on the ADAPT activists. In spite of all that, activists continued their chant: "OUR HOMES NOT NURSING HOMES or OTHER INSTITUTIONS."

A court date has been set for the first week in December.

JOIN US IN A SHOW OF SOLIDARITY

In a show of solidarity and support for the ADAPT National Action in Little Rock, Arkansas to end institutional bias & implement the federal Medicaid Community First Choice Option (CFCO), ADAPT Los Angeles will walk to the Governor’s Office in Los Angeles.

When: October 29, 2014

  11:00am Meet at Grand Park

  12:00pm Walk to Governor’s Office

Where: Grand Park

   200 N. Grand Avenue

   Los Angeles, CA 90012

WHAT YOUR DONATION SUPPORTS

ADAPT now needs your financial help in offsetting the legal costs that ADAPT is facing because of the arrests. It is estimated that with lawyer costs, fines and potential travel costs, ADAPT will face over $50,000 in legal fees. A court date has been set for the first week in December.

All donations will go directly to support legal and transportation expenses for the ADAPT National Action in Little Rock, Arkansas. Without your help these legal fees could be devastating!

OUR GOAL
ADAPT Los Angeles has set a goal of raising $1000 towards the ADAPT National Action in Little Rock, Arkansas by November 1, 2014.

If you would prefer to make a tax deductible donation, personal checks can be made out to SCRS (please write "ADAPTLA" in notes section of check) and sent to 7830 Quill Drive, Suite D, Downey, CA 90242.

Thank you for your support of disability rights and services and full community integration.

Don't to forget to share our campaign through your social networks!

story:
¿Qué?

El invierno del lobo traslada al lector a Acoma, un paraje frío tanto en el plano físico como en el emocional, en una historia que sorprende...

En Acoma se crean muchas leyendas urbanas alrededor de las pandillas y la gente se encarga de propagarlas con bastante rapidez, especialmente aquellas que involucran a Çakir y los suyos, un pequeño grupo de kíes que no le temen a nadie ni a nada. El invierno está comenzando y los amigos salen a celebrar un cumpleaños, pero una masiva intoxicación desata un episodio muy extraño en el que todos se ven involucrados. Al parecer, Toni, el líder de los kíes contrincantes, está detrás de todo el asunto y ahora ha desaparecido misteriosamente de Acoma. Las sospechas aumentan cuando descubren tres cadáveres que pueden tener un vínculo con su enemigo. ¿Es Toni realmente un asesino? Çakir no está dispuesto a quedarse de brazos cruzados, especialmente porque tiene la sensación de que alguien los está persiguiendo continuamente.

¿Quién sobrevivirá al invierno del lobo?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Ángel Ferrela.

Nacido en Santander en 1988, es licenciado en derecho por la Universidad de Cantabria, premio de la Fundación Juan de Dios Valenzuela 2014, y tiene un Máster en Mediación y Gestión de Conflictos. Disfruta de la música electrónica, los e-games y de la literatura épica.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El invierno del lobo que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ángel Ferrela vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
By publishing and sharing this book, we hope to entertain and inspire readers everywhere. In raising the voices of women, our goal is to make readers feel less alone, more connected to a global sisterhood of safety and acceptance, and empowered to find their own voices.

There is no doubt that this is an ideal selection for any book club discussion.

WHAT INSPIRED THIS COLLECTION OF REAL WOMEN’S STORIES?

This project emerged from a desire to support the New York City-based, 501(C)3 charity, 4 Real Women International, Inc. (4RWI). This award-winning, 100% volunteer organization takes women’s empowerment and leadership development to a whole new level.

With innovative programs and practical training for women of all ages, 4RWI does the essential work of teaching girls and women to stand tall, to own our choices and actions, and to recognize and live up to our unlimited potential.

In honor of 4RWI’s 10th anniversary and its annual Voices of Women conference, Real Women’s Stories is launching on November 12, 2017.  For more information about 4RWI and #VOWCON17, go to www.4rwi.org.

WHY SHOULD YOU CARE?

This book is a passionate leap of faith. If we agree that we must be the change we want to see in the world, this unique collection of short stories is one small step — a way to celebrate the voices of women.

50% of net proceeds from Real Women’s Stories will go to fund 4RWI and their innovative programs for women’s empowerment and leadership development.

The movement is underway! As each woman benefits from the safe, caring network 4RWI provides, she changes her own life, her family, her community, and in time, we can change the world.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Buy the book. Make a donation. Read and discuss these stories. Select Real Women’s Stories for your book club (one of our authors may join you via Skype!). The more this book is shared, the more we can help women to realize universal goals of safety, freedom, independence, education, and leadership training for the benefit of every family and community around the world.

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Mom & Me – Ava Carmel

A Genuine Smile – Marlena M. Matute

The Choice – Crispin McKay

A Bundle of Love and Joy – Regina Murphy-Keith

A Victory Over Violence – Nancy Salamone

The Historical Artist Goes Home – A story about Jasmine Germani

Monica & Me – Jean Messina

Lion Lullabies – Shanna Sussens

Tough Girls Wear Anchors – Maurine Conrad

What Did I Get Myself Into? – Karin Marie Kalb

Surviving & Thriving – Markela Evett Morrell

Being Still and Listening – Penny James

story:
The Premise

Earlier this year we ran a Kickstarter campaign for ZACH-LIKE, a book of behind-the-scenes design documents from Zachtronics. Since then we've completely run out of our extra copies, despite continuing to receive requests for physical copies of the book, and have decided to attempt a second printing (provided there is sufficient interest).

ZACH-LIKE contains:

  • Annotated design documents for all major Zachtronics games, from The Bureau of Steam Engineering to EXAPUNKS, including almost all individual puzzle design sheets.
  • Never-before-seen sketches and design documents for a bunch of games we worked on but never made— Miniatures, The Second Golden Age, Project Typhoon, and more.
  • Weird design exercises from before Zachtronics, like fake Pokémon cards Zach made when he was in 6th grade study hall and the installation-based projects he worked on in college.
  • A small variety of one-off pencil-and-paper puzzles that don’t belong anywhere else (including the full contents of the SpaceChem puzzle book).

 

This book doesn’t contain much narrative history or any theories of game design. It’s best thought of as primary material, a record of the Zachtronics design process in action. It's probably 90% pictures and 10% text.

At almost 400 pages, this is a big book. It’s great as an archive of the nearly complete design history of Zachtronics, but less great for international shipping (which is nearly $40 for a single copy). This is not a money-making exercise, so instead of selling a PDF at a lower tier we have  made it available for free on Steam:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1098840/ZACHLIKE/

 

Risks and Challenges

We've already printed and fulfilled a first run of this book, so we believe there are very few risks or challenges aside from the everyday difficulties of being a person and attempting to do things.

story:
Featured on:


Yahoo article - An ex-stock broker travels around the world on $10 a day

TEDx talk - How to travel the world with almost no money?

1000 Days of Spring

Hey guys!

My name is Tom (short for Tomislav), and I am a travel writer from Croatia.

After almost five years of traveling on five different continents, I laid down in a hammock in one village on the coast of Ecuador, and started writing a book.

I was determined to put down everything I know about traveling, and with that, answer the questions that many people ask me for years:

  • How is it possible to travel with almost no money?
  • Is my way of traveling safe enough?
  • What are the worst, and the best moments on the road?
  • How can you earn money while traveling?
  • Where to look for sponsors?
  • How do you parents and friends react?
  • Why am I traveling in the first place?

Since its impossible to give a simple and short answers to those questions, I started answering them in the only way possible - by telling my life story. In a way that is much detailed, comprehensive and intimate from the one that I shared with people via my FB page, blog and YT channel, for years.

I wrote about my student days, about the days when I had a well paid job as a stockbroker, about going bankrupt, about turning my life around, about first ventures on the road with a backpack on my back, and about finding a way that I will follow in the years to come - by traveling.

I wrote about hitchhiking in numerous countries, sleeping in homes of strangers, camping on the side of the road, eating in supermarkets and drinking beer in parks, volunteering, many anecdotes that I encountered on the road, natural beauties that left me breathless, and about the beautiful people that I met on the way.

I wrote about love.

Even though the plan was to write mostly about my last, biggest, and longest trip - 1000 Days of Summer, when I came to page hundred-and-something, I realized that I haven’t even started writing about that part of my life, that I have so much to say about everything that preceded it.

And since spring precedes summer, and since all the events in the book took place (almost) in thousand days time, the book got its obvious title - 1000 Days of Spring.

And the book is now, after four months of reminiscing, writing, erasing, editing - finally finished.

Why am I writing all this, and why are you reading it?

The answer is very simple - I need your help.

Book is written, but for it to see the light of the day - it needs editing, translating to English, printing. And since I decided that I want to self-publish the book, I need some money. Money that I, since I traveled the world for years, lived my life to the fullest, gathered experiences and wrote them down in my small black notebook - don’t have.

That’s where you jump in! 

Here, besides the book itself (cheaper than it will be after the campaign) - you can get:

  • T-shirt that traveled with me everywhere,

  • cute leather bracelets from Kenya (with the purchase you directly help "Little Home" orphanage),

  • beer in Zagreb,

…and many more!

How can you be a part of it?

The process is very simple: on the right side of the text find something that interests you, and with few clicks, via safe transaction of your credit/debit card, get some of the perks.

Besides the fact you will get something for your money's worth, you will help me with financing the entire project, which depends on the funds we collect: more money = better quality of the book. Hard cover design, photographs within the book, printing on a recycled paper - are just few details that you can be a part of.

Expected minimal expenses:

While you are reading all this and getting your perks, I’m visiting printing studios, drinking beer with my editor, having the book translated to English, and arranging a tour. A tour I’ll go on when I’m done with all this, some time in May. The plan is to hitchhike around Croatia and some other European countries, where I will give lectures about my travels, and at the same time - promote and sell the book.

Who knows, maybe I see you in your city. And if you get yourself a book now, and help me with the entire publishing thing, you will get an extra long hug when I see you.

- if you have any question, feel free to contact me on 1000daysofspring@gmail.com :)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- HRVATSKA VERZIJA -

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Mediji koji su popratili ovu kampanju:



1000 DANA PROLJEĆA

Pozdrav svima!

Ja sam Tomislav Perko - putnik, putopisac, i nesuđeni osvajač najboljeg posla na svijetu.

Nakon gotovo pet godina putovanja po pet različitih kontinenata, legao sam na ležaljku u jednom ribarskom selu na obali Ekvadora, i bacio se na pisanje knjige. 

Bio sam odlučan u namjeri da sve što znam o putovanjima stavim na jednu hrpu, i time odgovorim na pitanja koja mi mnogi već godinama postavljaju: 

  • Kako je moguće putovati gotovo besplatno? 
  • Koliko je moj način putovanja siguran? 
  • Koji su mi najgori, a koji najljepši trenuci na cesti? 
  • Na koji se način može zaraditi putujućI? 
  • Kako pronaći sponzore?
  • Kakve su reakcije roditelja i okoline? 
  • Zašto uopće putujem? 

Pošto je na sva ta pitanja nemoguće odgovoriti jednostavno, kratko i sažeto, krenuo sam odgovarati na jedini mogući način - prepričavanjem svoje životne priče. Na puno opširniji, iscrpniji i intimniji način od onog kojim sam godinama dijelio svoje priče s ekipom preko fejsbuka, bloga i jubitoa.

Pisao sam o studentskim danima, o vremenu kad sam imao cijenjeni i odlično plaćeni posao brokera, o naizgled bezizlaznim financijskim problemima, o preokretanju života naopačke, o prvim upućivanjima na cestu s ruksakom na leđima, te o pronalaženju puta kojeg ću slijediti idućih godina - putujući.

Pisao sam o autostopu po nebrojenim državama, spavanju u domovima neznanaca, kampiranju pored ceste, hranjenju po supermarketima i ispijanjima pivi na klupicama, volontiranju, brojnim anegdotama koje su me zadesile na putu, prirodnim ljepotama koje su me ostavljale bez daha, i o predivnim ljudima koje sam susretao usput. 

Pisao sam o ljubavi.

Iako je prvotni plan bio da knjiga prvenstveno govori o mom posljednjem, najvećem i najdužem putovanju - 1000 DANA LJETA, došavši do sto-i-neke stranice shvatio sam da s tom tematikom još nisam ni započeo, da se toliko toga ima za ispričati o svemu što je njemu prethodilo. 

A kako ljetu prethodi proljeće, i kako je to razdoblje također trajalo (otprilike) tisuću dana, knjiga je dobila svoj očiti naziv: 1000 DANA PROLJEĆA.

I ta je knjiga, sada, nakon četiri mjeseca prisjećanja, pisanja, brisanja, uređivanja - konačno gotova. 

Zašto vam pišem sve ovo, i zašto vi to čitate?

Odgovor je vrlo jednostavan - trebam vašu pomoć.

Knjiga je napisana, ali da bi ugledala svjetlo dana - treba ju i urediti, prelomiti, prevesti na engleski, tiskati. Kako sam odlučio da ću ju izdavati u vlastitoj nakladi, za sve to mi je potreban novac. Kojeg, pošto sam godinama putovao svijetom, živio život punim plućima te skupljao iskustva i zapisivao ih u malu crnu tekicu - nemam.

Tu vi uskačete u čitavu priču!

Osim same knjige (po povoljnijoj cijeni nego kad ova kampanja završi), ovdje možete dobiti i: 

  • najdražu majicu koja je sa mnom proputovala svijet,

  • ručno izrađene kožne pletene narukvice s perlicama (čime direktno pomažete sirotištu "Mali Dom", u Keniji),

  • pivu u mom društvu, u Pivnici Medvedgrad,

...i još mnogo toga!

Kako možete sudjelovati?

Proces je vrlo jednostavan: s desne strane, pored ovog teksta, pronađite nešto što vas zanima, te ćete s par klikova, uz sigurnu transakciju putem kreditne/debitne kartice, za svoj novac dobiti nešto od ponuđenog.

I uz to, pomoći ćete mi u financiranju čitavog projekta, koji ovisi o prikupljenim sredstvima - što se više novaca prikupi, to će knjiga biti ljepša i kvalitetnija. Tvrdi uvez, fotografije uz tekst, tisak na recikliranom papiru - samo su neki od detalja na koje vi možete utjecati.

Očekivani minimalni troškovi:

Dok čitate ovo, ja trčim po tiskarama, pijem pivu s urednicom, sređujem prijevod knjige na engleski jezik, i dogovaram turneju. Turneju na koju ću se, kada sve ovo bude gotovo, sredinom svibnja, uputiti po Lijepoj Našoj i okolnim zemljama - autostopom. U mnogim ću gradovima održavati predavanja o mojim putovanjima, te u isto vrijeme - promovirati i prodavati knjigu.

Tko zna, možda se i vidimo u vašem gradu. I ako ste si upravo vi uzeli knjigu sada, i pomogli mi u čitavom procesu izdavanja, dobit ćete ekstra dugi zagrljaj kad vas vidim.

- ako imate kakvih pitanja slobodno me kontaktirajte na 1000daysofspring@gmail.com :)

story:
The Story of The Unwavering

The Unwavering is a novel of short fiction stories focusing on the themes of humanness and reconciliation. It centers around how we reconcile in our relationships with others, and most importantly, with ourselves. There are a variety of stories focusing on different characters. In one story, it follows the travels of the wind as it traverses across the plains of the midwestern US, searching for towns to inhabit. In another story, a woman tries to remember the girl she once was, seeking to find a new way to live her life in the city of her dream. Another follows the journey of man with no home and a heart that’s seeking the sea.

I’m Lily Smith and I’m the writer of The Unwavering. I wrote this book because I am an artist. I discovered and then rediscovered my passion for writing several years ago when I realized I wanted to write and create with my writings. It wasn’t until a few years ago that I fully recognized the building passion inside me to write a novel.

This novel means so much to me. I originally started to write this book for my passion as an artist, but also for you. In this book, I aim to focus on human stories and the varying struggles that come with being a human in this world. This book focuses on our shared humanity, but equally as essential, the different stories, lives, and relationships we lead.

You will love this book if you enjoy asking and finding the answers to questions that sometimes seem as if they have no answers. This book focuses on the different realities of our lives and questions that play into our moments of existence. If you enjoy diving into yourself and the seemingly unknown, this book will touch you.

The Unwavering speaks to people, but especially students and younger adults who seek answers to questions we sometimes don’t know we’re asking.

I hope that The Unwavering ignites reflection and introspection in you by pressing into essential questions like:

  • How do we reconcile in our relationships with others? Where do we fail to see where they end and we begin? How can we listen to the needs of others?
  • How do we lead our lives? Are we listening to the needs and wants that are not our own?
  • Where do we fail to reconcile with ourselves? What do we ignore in ourselves? Are we recognizing and honoring our individual stories and needs?

I’m really grateful for all of you and excited to be on this journey together as we seek to discover these questions and more.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  •  Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback that we can collaborate on together!
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published 
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition (+character / book themed art)
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition  (+character / book themed art)

About the Author

Lily Smith is a writer and Authorpreneur. She is passionate about humanity and what it means to best show up for one another and for ourselves. She wrote this book to center human stories and voices relating to the different lives we lead, and how that affects our individual and collective humanness. She wrote this book to underline the answers to questions sometimes we don’t even know we’re asking. She fully believes in the mission and commitment to showing up to learn whatever and as much as she can about the planet we share together. Lily is passionate about listening to stories and hearing the voices of people whose stories differ from her own. For more information and to share some of those stories with her, you can connect with Lily Smith at lilyhdsmith@gmail.com and Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Pinterest.

Preorders Outside the US

For international preorders (ie. Berliners, etc.), please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form https://forms.gle/vHKWyAkci6bcnb3u8 to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support financially, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

story_txt:
The Story of The Unwavering

The Unwavering is a novel of short fiction stories focusing on the themes of humanness and reconciliation. It centers around how we reconcile in our relationships with others, and most importantly, with ourselves. There are a variety of stories focusing on different characters. In one story, it follows the travels of the wind as it traverses across the plains of the midwestern US, searching for towns to inhabit. In another story, a woman tries to remember the girl she once was, seeking to find a new way to live her life in the city of her dream. Another follows the journey of man with no home and a heart that’s seeking the sea.I’m Lily Smith and I’m the writer of The Unwavering. I wrote this book because I am an artist. I discovered and then rediscovered my passion for writing several years ago when I realized I wanted to write and create with my writings. It wasn’t until a few years ago that I fully recognized the building passion inside me to write a novel.This novel means so much to me. I originally started to write this book for my passion as an artist, but also for you. In this book, I aim to focus on human stories and the varying struggles that come with being a human in this world. This book focuses on our shared humanity, but equally as essential, the different stories, lives, and relationships we lead.
You will love this book if you enjoy asking and finding the answers to questions that sometimes seem as if they have no answers. This book focuses on the different realities of our lives and questions that play into our moments of existence. If you enjoy diving into yourself and the seemingly unknown, this book will touch you.The Unwavering speaks to people, but especially students and younger adults who seek answers to questions we sometimes don’t know we’re asking.I hope that The Unwavering ignites reflection and introspection in you by pressing into essential questions like:

How do we reconcile in our relationships with others? Where do we fail to see where they end and we begin? How can we listen to the needs of others?
How do we lead our lives? Are we listening to the needs and wants that are not our own?
Where do we fail to reconcile with ourselves? What do we ignore in ourselves? Are we recognizing and honoring our individual stories and needs?

I’m really grateful for all of you and excited to be on this journey together as we seek to discover these questions and more.

Lily Smith is a writer and Authorpreneur. She is passionate about humanity and what it means to best show up for one another and for ourselves. She wrote this book to center human stories and voices relating to the different lives we lead, and how that affects our individual and collective humanness. She wrote this book to underline the answers to questions sometimes we don’t even know we’re asking. story:
PROYECTO DRONES

Desde que conocí la fotografía como profesión siempre he tenido algo que falta profundizar.

Con el descubrimiento de los Drones siento que es EL SALTO que quiero dar. Tomas aéreas de videos y fotográficas JAMAS registradas en el planeta. Un punto de vista nuevo para todos los paisajes, arquitecturas y espacios en el mundo.

Sin duda un mercado creciente que se expande agigantadas, esta tecnología puede ser aplicada en muchos campos; en la Agricultura, la Industria, Audiovisual, Seguridad y Comercial.

Las posibilidades de trabajo empiezan a crecer enormemente en países como Estados Unidos, Europa y próximamente Sur América. 

Mi objetivo es a corto y largo plazo:

1. Subir mi nivel profesional. 

2.  Conseguir un trabajo con los Medios de Televisión, documentales, Cine Francés.

3.  Conocer a fondo el tema para poder llevar esta Tecnología a Colombia lo mas pronto posible (Como ven en las noticias, los militares y Canal como RCN ya los empiezan a utilizar, todavía no existe la legislación, por lo tanto es legal) y explotarla en todos los campos posibles como ya había mencionado, de la agricultura a comercial.


La practica y conocimiento serán las herramientas para desarrollarlo en Colombia 

Los invito colaborar con la realización de este proyecto. No tengo los medios para llegar a esta formación rápidamente, afortunadamente los tengo a todos ustedes que me han apoyado en todo momento de mi vida y soy lo que soy gracias a cada uno de ustedes.

Gracia por confiar en mi y en mi futuro.

story:
Story of My Book

Storytelling and the Music of Journalists. This book explores how music journalists go through the process of researching, interviewing, and creating profiles and stories on the artists we love. This book includes an inside look at this profession along with personal anecdotes from these journalists and general advice for writers who want to improve their craft.

My name is Emma Djordjevic and I am the author of Storytelling and the Music of Journalists. I wrote this book because I’ve always loved music. It’s been something that’s been ever present in my life since I was young, and reading and learning about music was something that grew my passion as I got older. Through reading about musicians in magazines and online, I formed a curiosity about the journalists who cover this beat. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how music journalists convey the character of an artist from a snapshot of an interaction. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for music and writing in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you improve your writing and help you understand how to approach people when meeting them for the first time.

In this book, you'll learn about the different steps of creation and writing and the struggles that come along with covering music as a beat. 

  • My connection personal connection to music and writing. 
  • A timeline of the story-writing process, from research and interviewing to editing and feedback. 
  • Journalists and their struggle with harassment, criticism, and covering sensitive topics. 

You will love this book if you are a music lover, curious about how the music industry works, or are a writer that wants to improve their craft.

Storytelling and the Music of Journalistsis a non-fiction book that speaks to writers and music lovers who are looking at the music journalism and freelance industries for the first time.

The Book - Storytelling and the Music of Journalists

The book is written in 2 parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-5. This half of the book goes through the stages of writing the story including my personal connection to writing and music and how it has touched my life. Accounts from journalists who’ve covered indie artists like Mitski, Japanese Breakfast, and object blue to world stars like Blink-182, Halsey, Billie Eilish, and BTS will be included to show the wide range of music as a beat. The importance of research, connecting with the artists, and the writing process will be explored through this part of the book.

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10 including the conclusion. This part includes some challenges that journalists face when interacting with artists as well as the problems that exist within the music and writing industries for women. Living in the age of #MeToo, targeted online harassment, and the conversation around visibility for different groups will be explored. A firsthand account of an inappropriate encounter with Alex Kane of The Last Shadow Puppets as well as the struggles with being a freelance writer will show the hidden problems of the industry. The book will conclude with some tips and tricks on how to break into the industry and generally how to grow as a writer.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019. 
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder.
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter. 

When I pre-sell 100 copiesof my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Emma Djordjevic is a graduate from New York University where she earned a Bachelor of Science in Media, Culture, and Communication with a minor in Philosophy. She spent her first year of university abroad studying in London and continued her academic journey back in New York City. She has interned in the media industry, including in social media and in radio, and was a contributing writer for the NYU chapter of Her Campus, a website for collegiate women. 

Emma wrote this book in order to gain a better perspective on the music industry and on professionals who cover the music industry as a full-time career. Growing up with a passion for music, she has always loved listening to and exploring new music through different platforms. As an individual who loves writing, Emma wanted to continue learning how to grow as a writer and learn how journalists have taken their passions and combined them to make a career.

She has also been to numerous concerts (35 shows and counting) in a variety of cities (London, NYC, Chicago, LA, Tokyo, etc) and hopes to continue her global concert journey. She also loves cooking, eating pizza, looking at cat pictures on social media, and lurking around in online fandoms. 

For more information, you can connect with Emma at ed1463@nyu.edu and on Instagram: @emma_dj77 or LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/emma-djordjevic-99340a142/

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Emma Djordjevic

story:
"Unbroken" tells the story of several extraordinary young people who have overcome overwhelming obstacles in their determined pursuit of higher education.

As a published writer and journalist whose work has appeared in the Chronicle of Higher Education, USA Today, NBC News, Crain's New York Business and CNBC, I've had the opportunity to come across a number of incredible young people whose stories of grit, tenacity and perseverance have alternately inspired and fascinated me.

Each time I've read one of their stories, I've been left with the feeling of wanting to investigate and learn more about how and why they've persisted in spite of what appeared to be daunting odds.

"A first-generation college student, [Harvard freshman] Reuben [Howard] has more immediate family members who have been incarcerated than have graduated from high school."

As the youngest son of a single mother who grew up without a father and lost my oldest brother to gun violence, I know what it's like to have the deck stacked against you and the "statistics" suggesting there's no way you can possibly win out.

Sponsoring Young People was founded in an effort to alter those odds.  We aim to make certain that we are creating college-going cultures for every young person—not just a select few.

As a storyteller, I believe profoundly in the power of stories to transcend race, class, religion and/or sexual orientation.  With this campaign, I am asking for your help in publishing this collection of stories, so that others can learn from and be as inspired by them as I have been.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the contributions to this book project will go to supporting (3) fundamental goals intrinsic to the success of SYP's core mission:

  • Successfully attain 501(c)(3) status, which will allow us to apply for grants and other forms of support primarily afforded to registered non-profit groups.
  • Support our ongoing scholarship and contest initiatives, such as our Write Way To College essay writing contest (a partnership with Story To College) aimed at encouraging NYC high schoolers to work on the critical essays that can substantially affect their odds of gaining admission to the college of their choosing.
  • Support newer initiatives, such as our Edvisors peer-to-peer college counseling program for student's in NYC's public school system.

The perks we offer range from a Thank You letter up to a copy of the published book with a printed acknowledgement and an invite to our book debut party, to be held in NYC.

The Need This Book Fulfills

At a time when it is increasingly difficult for those from low-income backgrounds to gain access to a quality post-secondary education due to such factors as rising tuition costs, it's more important than ever to share stories that empower and enable young people from low-income, first-generation college-going and minority backgrounds to believe that, despite what may seem like overwhelming odds, they, too, can attain a college education.

“College matters a lot for social mobility,” says Richard V. Reeves, policy director of the Center on Children and Families at the Brookings Institution. "For someone from a poor background, getting a four-year degree virtually guarantees upward mobility. Getting more poor kids into colleges, and getting the brightest into the best colleges, ought to be a national mission.”

Well we've heard that clarion call loud and clear and endeavor to help fill that void!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're unable to contribute monetarily, we would still appreciate your support:

  • We are always looking for college and university administrators, professors, college access advocates and subject matter experts to serve as lecturers for our Office Hours platform.
  • Please encourage the young people in your life to visit Sponsoring Young People and take advantage of the range of advice, interviews, information and resources we offer.

www.sponsoringyoungpeople.org
