story:
Ligaya: Short stories about one day in ten lives

Ligaya, a Filipino woman who lives everywhere, can sense people's true characters. One day in the lives of nine people she meets.

I am an independent writer fighting for a chance to write her second book!  This campaign will open for donations May 25 through July 24.   Thank you for hearing out my story...

About my first novel, North for Sun:

North for Sun is the book of Martha Marcelo, a Filipino-American woman with mental illness who can travel in time. Martha awaits an upcoming procedure that may affect her memory, and she decides to write a book for herself to read afterwards. She chooses the year she first recovered, when she returned to college, so she can remember how to get better. Martha chases people through the past and future, through generations of her countries, looking for somebody who will stick. North for Sun is a story about playing in time, how families filter memory and how the experience of mental illness distorts and loosens time. It asks how we want to remember ourselves, what we would keep if we had to start over. At its heart, North for Sun is the story of how a good person got better again.

You learn more about my first book and read an excerpt on my website.

About my second book, Ligaya:

One day in the lives of nine people who cross paths with Ligaya, an extraordinary Filipino woman who has lived everywhere and met two million people.  Ligaya is a professional observer of human nature.  She has called most towns and many countries her home.  Now she lives in a city's heart: a bench at the liveliest intersection of Pine and Orchid Streets.  From her journeys, Ligaya has learned to judge people's characters in an instant. She can feel people's intentions, in the shapes of sensations, tastes, and sights.  The book starts with Ligaya's chapter.  Afterwards, each short story shows how her sensations grow in the lives of nine people, in one day, the same day.

My next book will be a collection of interrelated short stories, all set on the same day in the lives of ten different people. Each chapter or short story follows a different character as they go about their day. The stories connect because they are rooted in one person: Ligaya.  The stories are set in our world with magical elements woven into one day, in the lives of everyday, special characters.

Some central questions of the book: Every minute, we live near people we don't know. What happens to people who pass each other for this minute? What happened before this minute? What will happen afterwards? This book will explore what connects and divides people who could be closer but choose to live apart.

Why I want to write this story:

People have more in common than we realize. I want this book to make people think about what we have in common. 

  • In my experience as a counselor, street outreach worker, and shelter worker, I've seen that everyone tries to survive. No matter their circumstances or choices, people try to meet what they need and want in life. And these needs and wants come from the same places: a drive for connection, emotional fulfillment, and safety. I want this book to look at the commonalities and differences among people with, at heart, the same desires. 
  • One survival skill is judging whether to trust other people, who they are and how they can change other people for worse or better.  This real skill became the inspiration for Ligaya's magical empathy.  Ligaya has learned resilience from surviving her life.  She is deeply connected to herself and her community, which has brought out her capacity to relate viscerally with others.
  • I would love to read more stories about Filipino identity.  I think we need more stories about the whole spectrum of mental health, emotion, and imagination. 
  • My first novel, North for Sun, told the story of Martha Marcelo, a Filipino-American woman with mental illness who can travel in the time.  This new story plays with time and perspective in new ways that will challenge me as a writer. I would like to learn more about magical realism. I'm excited for all the problems and tangles that I'll have to tackle to tell this story! 

Why I am doing an Indiegogo campaign:

I came into writing my first novel, North for Sun, by happy accident. I had too much free time, and I tried writing fiction out of curiosity. I ended up loving it completely. Writing fiction is a mess that deeply fulfills me. You aren't creating something out of nothing — you are creating something from your dreams and people who were meaningful to you. You are creating a meaningful world to share with another person. 

By donating to this project, you will support essential costs for me to self-publish Ligaya, from start to finish, in its best possible form for my readers.   The budget of $5,000 funds equipment, editing, cover design, and publicity.  I'll write on a more powerful laptop with better writing software and be able to print drafts.  I'll engage in research activities like books and classes, hire a professional editor, and work with a cover designer to create an aesthetically wonderful book.  I'll organize publicity events to share Ligaya with readers.  Your donation covers all the needs for me to tell this story.

I think of your donation as an advance, so I can afford resources to create this book to the best of my ability.  Since it is an advance, your donation comes with rewards that will enhance and expand your experience of the story.  For $8, you preorder your early e-book of Ligaya as soon as it's ready.  The early e-book will be ready before the paperback is available, so you will be able to read Ligaya before the public release.  If 625 people preorder the e-book, we will reach our goal.  Tell your friends who would be interested in this story.  This campaign will accept donations for 60 days from May 25 to July 24, so spread the word!

If you'd like to see proof of my writing, you can read an excerpt from North for Sun on my website. If you'd like to see more proof, you can read North for Sun.

Think of yourself as my potential publisher. This is my pitch.

Thank you for your consideration! If you're interested, you can read on for more about your donation...

Making your donation:

You are taking a chance on a new, independent writer, and I hope you'll enjoy the rewards I came up with.  Beyond the opportunity to preorder your e-book for $8, rewards include an audiobook, special edition annotated e-book, paperback with handwritten notes, and one-on-one chat with the author.   I'm open to more ideas about how to thank my donors. If someone decides to donate more than the maximum gift of $200, I will think of another gift to thank your generosity.

Allowing room for contingency and the creative process, I estimate the book will be available by December 2018.  I'm basing this 18-month timeline on my progress so far and an extended timeline that I completed for my first book.  For context, I completed North for Sun, from conceptualization to self-publication, in five months. I had never written fiction before, and I was working simultaneously on my second book during the final month.  I consider Ligaya a more complex narrative structure and likely more research-intensive book than North for Sun, so I'm estimating 18 months until release.   Importantly, for Ligaya's story, I will draw on five years of experience, including grad school, in the field of social work.  As with North for Sun, I will draw on my personal experiences of mental illness.   If you're curious about my timeline for North for Sun, please check out my blog. (It also has many free resources on how you can self-publish your own book, if you're interested.)

I started work on this second book in April. I have started research, character development, and writing.  I have written the beginning and end and more of Ligaya. I'm very excited about the book's shape. It's going to be a good story.

NOTE: Book sales have now moved to Amazon: http://a.co/h1rCNuh

Set in ancient times, Stranger Bird charts the passage of a young misfit, summoned to the service of a great and distant emperor. On his journey, the boy is awakened to his own gift, the talent for speaking with animals, and he comes into contact with many people who would use his abilities for their own ends. After arduous travel, the boy arrives at the capital and the emperor's palace, only to find that the land is held together by a dark secret. The boy’s navigation of this secret marks his passage from the powerlessness of childhood to adulthood discovery, leading to the realization that, of all creatures, only people can choose what they become.

 

This story combines the literary style and epic sweep of Ursula Le Guin’s Earthsea with the disarming fable-like quality of Paolo Coehlo’s The Alchemist. While Stranger Bird appeals to adult readers of the genre, the first audience for the story was the author’s young daughters, bright and literate girls with a love for The Hobbit and D'Aulaires' Book of Greek Myths. Stranger Bird will appeal to anyone like them: intelligent young people who expect to be taken seriously.

When I'm not working as a teacher or as a parent, I'm an author of fantasy and science fiction. And, while I've published many short works of science fiction and fantasy in magazines, podcasts, and anthologies, I've never published a novel--until now. That's why I'm here: with your help, I can publish my first novel-length work of fantasy, Stranger Bird, and bring it to fantasy readers just like you.

I want to raise $2500 to cover the expenses of publishing Stranger Bird. While it's easy enough, and cheap enough, to publish an e-book version of Stranger Bird, your contribution will help create a physical book which is as artistically crafted as the story itself. 

Contributors at the $80 level will receive a signed first edition copy of Stranger Bird. Contributions at this level will make it possible not only to create a well-designed work of art to match the artistry of the story, but it will help make copies of the book available for reviewers.  If Stranger Bird does well, you'll be able to tell folks that you were one of the first supporters of the book! 

For those few who are interested in supporting this project at the $100 level, I would love to help you workshop your story or novel idea. As a veteran teacher of creative writing, I will offer a personal workshop of your work, giving you both an honest critique and constructive feedback on your own fiction.

Stranger Bird is an homage to the fantasy authors of my youth—Ursula Le Guin, Richard Adams, Lloyd Alexander—and a nostalgic look back at the dark and mythical tales that were published in the generation before Harry Potter. I've labored over this book for years, and the book will be published in some form or another. If the project attracts fewer contributors than I had hoped, the book will still come out as an e-book, perhaps with a few print-on-demand copies. Your help accelerates the process of getting the book out to the public: with your assistance, Stranger Bird will receive a great deal more exposure in its first year than it would have otherwise. However, I am a very patient writer. If the project doesn't receive the support I am seeking, it means only that bringing Stranger Bird to the public will be a slower and more laborious process.

I'm grateful for everyone who is interested in supporting this book, whether you are able to contribute financially or not. If you're not able to donate money to the project, you can still help bring Stranger Bird to the public by getting the word out. Forward this link to your friends on social media; pass it along to the people in your life who read fantasy literature. I'm more grateful than you know to everyone who tells a friend about Stranger Bird.

Hi, I'm Markus Monastery, author of the Paladin series. 

Paladin - the Novice is a contemporary fantasy novel allowing an insight into the world of a powerful secret society, called the Community of Sacred Light. The story unfolds through the eyes of Veronica, a novice at the beginning of her studies and rise through the ranks of the community.

The girl is on a quest to find her true self and the meaning of her life, not yet aware – along with everybody around her – that she will discover answers not only to these questions but will unintentionally find herself caught up in in the midst of a war waged between the mightiest lords of the Community. This war is of great significance , and its outcome will determine the future of human civilization. 

The young novice has no time to waste in rising to the challenges before her. She must rise beyond her previous, small world and brace herself to take on responsibility that would break most others. 

The story of the first part is completed but publishing requires serious sum. But with sufficient support we would be able to publish the first book - which is going to take place certainly so our contributors will receive a copy for sure- and it would also make it possible to continue with the sequel... as the journey has only begun. 

In case you like the story or the project but for any reason you are unable to support us with backing, we would still appreciate if you could share our campaign via Indiegogo share tools so it could reach as many people as possible. 

Thank you for your help in advance, we hope you will be among the firsts to join the world of paladins.

story:
What is this?

This is the third book in the Eden Kane series that began with Sky Pirates of the Rio Grande and continued in Queen of the Sky Frontier.  Now the epic story moves into high gear with this concluding chapter!

In 1867 Eden Kane left her job at the Smithsonian and headed West, intending to find the fabled Dark Aetheric Transmitter and become an agent of the government.  Instead, she became a leader to the Brethren of the Sky - the airship pirates who control the western frontier.  The following year, she faced her greatest danger as the former Confederate General Hood plotted to become the overlord of the west and destroy Washington D.C.

Now, with three of his superior air-warships at her command, Eden has become a power to be reckoned with, and as the forces of a weakened government and scheming robber barons converge on the frontier, she must find what course she intends to steer, and hold to it.  With her constant companions - the Experimental Zenobia Santiago and Diamondback Sally , Eden must try and carve out the destiny of the Brethren in the West - the Graveyard of Empires.

  • This is our 12th Adventurotica title produced by two award-winning authors.
  • We use the funding for these campaigns to live.
  • You will help keep us alive and fed, and also contribute to the creation of awesome sexy adventure fiction.

We are artists who live by what we do, and this is how we make our way.  It does not pay much, but it allows us to keep doing what we love.

What We Need:

Money. (No point in beating around the bush.)

Here is how we will spend it:

  • Materials for the incentives. All that fun stuff has to come from somewhere!
  • Living expenses. Food, bills, and a roof to turn away the life-leeching rays of the blazing hatestar – sorry, the sun. We have this annoying hierarchy of needs thing going on. Damn you, Maslow!
  • Medical care. Writing all these naughty words can be dangerous, you know. Paper cuts, repetitive stress injuries, tragic Hitachi accidents . . . it's a brutal line of work. (Have you ever tried to get lube out of a keyboard?) No, seriously, some of us need to be medicated for the public good.

And there you have it. Most of it is going towards keeping us alive. Is that exciting? No! But we have to stay alive to write smut. Contrary to what you might think, zombies don't write very interesting sex scenes. It's just a lot of moaning and cannibalism.

What Happens:

We post the book serially on our site. This will be our 12th novel, and we've never failed to post three serial updates a week. We are reliable. The story will be finished on time. It is projected to run between 45 and 50 chapters, and should be between 125,000 and 150,000 words.

  • Memberships to Adventurotica will be available for use immediately, meaning you can follow along there, three times a week, until the story ends.
  • If you've bought yourself any sort of walk-on role or bonus scene, that will obviously come out with the ebook.
  • The ebook won't come out until after the book has been published in serial form on Adventurotica.com. You'll be able to read it at Adventurotica the entire time.
  • Print books will be released as soon after the ebook as possible.
  • Production of material incentives will begin after the campaign ends.

If we don't make goal, we'll still be able to provide the perks for everyone who did donate, and we'll do the best we can on what we get.


The Impact:

This is the part where we're supposed to explain how our project is valuable to you and to the world. No pressure. I'd love to claim that our project will bring about world peace by making sure nobody has a hand free to pull a trigger, but that seems unlikely.

  • What we can do is make people happy. Have a good time. Bring something that is unreservedly fun into the world, just because it belongs here.
  • Erotica is an important genre, and we want to make it a better, more entertaining place. Bottom line, people often complain, with good reason, that good erotica is difficult to find. That most of it is poorly-written. That the characters are flat. That the sex is boring. That it doesn't tell an interesting story.
  • We want to give readers entertainment for adults, not just adult entertainment. There is a dire shortage of well-written, fast-paced, plot-heavy long-form erotica. We want to write a book that provides you, the reader, with a well-told adventure story that doesn't fade to black just when things are getting good.
  • We want to encourage independent erotica publishing by being part of it. By publishing independently, we are freeing ourselves from the restrictions placed on authors by publishers; restrictions on content, on length, on ratio of plot to sex. We aren't breaking rules. We're stepping outside of them. We're doing our own thing, our way. And you can help!

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

Boost the signal! If you can't contribute, that's fine.  You can still tell everyone about us.

There are share tools right here on Indiegogo!  Also, we are assuming you have some social network stuff going on, so spreading the word that way would be super-awesome of you.

We're sure you have friends who would appreciate some swashbuckling smuttery, so, really, you'll be doing them a service sending them our way.

We sincerely appreciate those who support us by helping to spread the word. Y'all do a lot of good, and we cannot thank you enough.

We post the book serially on our site. This will be our 12th novel, 
and we've never failed to post three serial updates a week. We are 
reliable. The story will be finished on time. It is projected to run between 45 and 50 chapters, and should be between 125,000 and 150,000 words.

Memberships to Adventurotica will be available for use immediately, 
meaning you can follow along there, three times a week, until the story 
ends.
If you've bought yourself any sort of walk-on role or bonus scene, that will obviously come out with the ebook.
The ebook won't come out until after the book has been published in 
serial form on Adventurotica.com. 
You'll be able to read it at Adventurotica the entire time.
Print books will be released as soon after the ebook as possible.
Production of material incentives will begin after the campaign ends.

If we don't make goal, we'll still be able to provide the perks for 
everyone who did donate, and we'll do the best we can on what we get.
   
The Impact:
This is the part where we're supposed to explain how our project is 
valuable to you and to the world. No pressure. I'd love to claim that 
our project will bring about world peace by making sure nobody has a 
hand free to pull a trigger, but that seems unlikely.


What we can do is make people happy. Have a good time. Bring something that is unreservedly fun into the world, just because it belongs here.

Erotica is an important genre, and we want to make it a better, more entertaining place.
 Bottom line, people often complain, with good reason, that good erotica
 is difficult to find. That most of it is poorly-written. That the 
characters are flat. That the sex is boring. That it doesn't tell an 
interesting story.

We want to give readers entertainment for adults, not just adult entertainment.
 There is a dire shortage of well-written, fast-paced, plot-heavy 
long-form erotica. We want to write a book that provides you, the 
reader, with a well-told adventure story that doesn't fade to black just
 when things are getting good.

We want to encourage independent erotica publishing by being part of it.
 By publishing independently, we are freeing ourselves from the 
restrictions placed on authors by publishers; restrictions on content, 
on length, on ratio of plot to sex. We aren't breaking rules. We're 
stepping outside of them. We're doing our own thing, our way. And you 
can help!
   
HOW YOU CAN HELP:
Boost the signal! If you can't contribute, that's fine.  You can still tell everyone about us.
There are share tools right here on Indiegogo!  Also, we are assuming
 you have some social network stuff going on, so spreading the word that
 way would be super-awesome of you.
We're sure you have friends who would appreciate some swashbuckling 
smuttery, so, really, you'll be doing them a service sending them our 
way.
We sincerely appreciate those who support us by helping to spread the
 word. Y'all do a lot of good, and we cannot thank you enough.

With all of your tremendous support I've made my initial goal! Check out the updates tab above to see the new Stretch Goals for this campaign!



How exciting would it be to receive an unexpected package from a far away land? Perhaps a postcard from an exotic location would change the color of your day? Would you get your thrill from teas or trinkets from ancient markets selected just for you?  Those things that fill you with wander lust are to be appreciated and enjoyed. 



For those of you who don't know me, I'm Celeste. I'm a chef, an explorer, a storyteller, and a connoisseur. I've spent the last 4 years meandering about the globe and I am about to embark on a new journey. My time in New Zealand is coming to an end, but I've decided to take a final trip before heading state-side. After a sunny summer Christmas I'll head to Istanbul. From there I'll weave my way to the distant city of Marrakech, and exploring many places in between.

Thanks to the kindness of family, friends and strangers I'll be able to do this, and I couldn't be more excited! Traveling isn't always easy though, and often you have to find cheap ways of entertaining yourself. Winter travel can be particularly challenging since you can't wile away the afternoons on the beach or in a park. When I think of things I'd like to do for extended periods of time in small cafes and tiny train cars I imagined myself writing postcards. Penning letters to friends around the world. 

It's all fine in theory, but there are a few questions I found myself asking. Who would I send them to? Who would actually want to read them? Where would I find the spare change to mail them even if I spent the time writing them? That's where this project comes in...

The Traveling post isn't just a way to collect funds for travel, but it's my way to give back to all of those who give to me. If you've read this far your probably my family or friends (if not, maybe we will be friends one day.) With Christmas and my 30th birthday just around the bend, you might be asking yourself what should you get me? As a mobile vagabond, I really have little use for material presents, but when you're traveling the world a little extra money can make all the difference

I've been saving for this trip myself, but extra funds don't hurt. Your donation will help me with more than travel! The more money I have, the more cities I can see, the more cooking I can engage in, the more cultures I can immerse myself in, the more tidbits and treasures I can mail back to you. 


The Traveling Post is a way to celebrate the old world and the old ways. With great advances like iPhones and internet, social media and Skype, we lost something along the way. We lost the magic of mail, the romance of writing, the thrill of the unexpected package. I want to give that gift to those who give to me. 

Of course if you can not donate there are many other ways to help. I always need support when I'm out out the road alone. If you have connections of your own in Europe who want to put up a wayward traveler, or your grandmother makes the best food in Italy, put us in touch. Just as a postcard from me could brighten your day, messages of reassurance from others gives me the strength to keep on exploring. Also emails, messages and "likes" on Facebook and Instagram keep me motivated to seek out new adventures and post more stories and photos.

Thank you all so much! I wish you the best for Christmas and the coming year! May it be full of adventures, joy, and deliveries from The Traveling Post.


*The credit for the photographs is hardly my own, as I haven't yet had the pleasure of traveling to these places.

story:
Becoming Fierce: Teen Stories IRL - What the heck is this?

Sometimes it totally sucks being a teen. Trying to fit in, dealing with bullies, a changing body, and the feeling that no one really gets it. It’s hard on the head and often seems like no one else understands.

That’s what Becoming Fierce is all about. Those not-so-fun times that come with being a teen but also how others have gone through similar things and made it to the other side. New and established Canadian authors share experiences from their teen years that have stuck with them. Some of the stories are dark and heartbreaking while others are lighthearted and grin-worthy. Regardless, they all have something in common: while things may seem like an epic fail now, they do get better.

We’ve chosen ten of our most popular and best selling digital shorts to include in the anthology. Here they are!

These Memories Can’t Wait by Jamie Fitzpatrick (Newfoundland)

Say It’s Okay by Ben Boudreau (Nova Scotia)

Love You Like Suicide by Jo Treggiari (Nova Scotia)

Cuisvé by Chris Benjamin (Nova Scotia)

The Long Last Year by Gerard Collins (Newfoundland)

Some of My Parts by Alison DeLory (Nova Scotia)

Before I Was Me by Chad Pelley (Newfoundland)

Diary of a Fluky Kid by Lee D. Thompson (New Brunswick)

Prince Nameless by Patti Larsen (Prince Edward Island)

I Used to Think I’d Make a Good Boy by Cale Liom (Prince Edward Island)


We’re super excited and over-the-moon thrilled that the wonderful Susin Nielsen, author of such fabu young adult novels as Dear George Clooney, Please Marry My Mom and The Reluctant Journal of Henry K. Larsen, wrote the foreword. She also chose the charity for the anthology. Twenty per cent of sales will go towards Kids Help Phone.

We also want to let you guys know that not all the content is suitable for a younger audience, which is why we gave it the following rating:

M - Mature 17 and up: May contain sexual content, intense violence and/or strong language.

Alcohol - Reference to alcohol use

Blood - Depiction of blood

Drugs - Reference to drugs and/or drug use

Self-harm scenes - Includes depictions or discussion about suicide, cutting and/or other self-harm

Sexual Content - Mention or description of sex or a sexual act

Strong language - Frequent use of profanity


Why should you care?

Bullying, self-esteem issues, sexuality, mental health, suicide. These are just a few of the things that teens have to deal with and a lot of the time they think that they are dealing with them alone. What if you could help teens understand that others have gone through what they are going through? That all the heartache and awkwardness is something that they can overcome in order to come out the other side stronger?

That’s what we set out to do with our Fierce Shorts imprint of digital shorts. Once a month we publish a creative non-fiction piece by a Canadian author. Over the past few months, readers and fans have been asking us if we had any plans to publish an anthology of our shorts. Well, we always take into consideration what our fierce readers want, so we’ve decided to print a collection of some of our most popular digital shorts to date. In keeping with the tradition of our digital shorts, twenty per cent of profits will go towards a national youth-oriented charity.

Becoming Fierce: Teen Stories IRL will make you laugh, make you cry and break your heart over and over again. But it will also give you hope  that things do get better and that it is possible to make it through the teen years and thrive.


How can you support Becoming Fierce and teens?

Buy a copy through this campaign. Buy a copy for your bestie. Share it on social media. Email your seventeen-year-old niece or nephew about it. Send some good karma our way. Any way that you can think to support our campaign is very appreciated and will give us all the feels, promises.


What’s in it for you?

First of all, a copy of Becoming Fierce! And some pretty cool, exclusive swag, like Fierce mugs, notebooks and keychains. You’ll also get the satisfaction of knowing that you’ve helped a small indie publisher. And really, what else could you ask for?


Where will the money go?

Proofing: $200

Payment for non-exclusive rights: $1,000

Cover: $500

Books for the launches: $1,420

Shipping/order fulfillment: $1,700
